Hello, DEXTER MORGAN!
üéÑ muhammad (task 2)12/01/2026, 09:26:15

Some people believe that children should not be given homework everyday, while others believe that they must get homework everyday in order to be successful at school

It is undeniable that some families argue about whether children ought to be given homework athome everyday. Some of proponents of this view claim that it can be reason for burnout, while others believe that it may be lead to academic performance. This essay will examine both sides and explain why I support the idea that homework has a crucial role in children‚Äôs life.

On the one hand,critics of homework believe that it can be not only harmful for children‚Äôs lifebut also may be unnecessary. One common argument for this is some children are not able to find free time to dedicate themselves for others activity such associal gatherings or sports. As a result, most children become more isolated and do not lead healthy life style. Moreover, this practice can has detrimental effect on their overall well-being due to day-to-day homework. Stress, depression or even burnout, for instance, might be a cause of this practice. Lastly, it is believed that everyday homework is not guarantee for children‚Äôs development, whereas developed countries show the greatest educational outcomes where students rarely given home tasks.

On the other hand, advocates, as well as I, argue that home assignments could play a essential role in teenager‚Äôs life. One main benefit is independent studying. Most pupils who are study at home after classes, they are enhance their solving skills, which can be important in their future life. Furthermore, for pupils it is a great opportunity to strengthen their knowledge and reviewing what they learned at school. I firmly believe that if children do home tasks at home every day it would be beneficial for their academic gains.

In conclusion, although homework might cause some stress which can lead to burnout, I strongly believe, that home tasks not only do improve their problem-solving skills but also strengthen their knowledge which is substantial for children

Word count: 335
Teacher Feedback
1. Task Response ‚Äî Band 6
What you did well:
You addressed both views clearly.
Your opinion is clear and consistent (you support homework).
The essay stays on topic throughout.
Weaknesses:
Some arguments are too general or not fully explained.
A few claims are unclear or inaccurate, for example:
‚Äúdeveloped countries show the greatest educational outcomes where students rarely given home tasks‚Äù (this needs clearer explanation or a specific example).
Some ideas are repeated instead of being developed further.
How to improve:
Explain how homework improves academic performance more clearly.
Avoid broad statements unless you explain them well.
2. Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äî Band 6

Clear paragraph structure (introduction, body paragraphs, conclusion).
Logical organization using On the one hand / On the other hand.
Ideas generally flow in a logical order.
Weaknesses:
Many missing spaces and punctuation errors affect readability:

Some sentences are too long and confusing.
Linking between sentences is sometimes weak.
How to improve:
Leave a space after punctuation.
Split long sentences into shorter ones.
Use clearer connectors like As a result, For example, Moreover.

Weaknesses:

‚úÖ can have a detrimental effect
‚ùå is not guarantee
‚úÖ is not a guarantee
Some phrases are unnatural:
‚ùå teenager‚Äôs life ‚Üí ‚úÖ teenagers‚Äô lives
How to improve:

Check singular vs plural forms carefully.

üéÑ Maqsudjon12/01/2026, 09:10:20
Task-1 The Life Cycle of a Frog The diagram illustrates the life cycle of a frog from mating to adulthood. Overall, the process is circular and consists of eight main stages, beginning with reproduction and ending with a fully grown frog that can reproduce again. In the first stage, adult frogs mate on land. After that, the female lays eggs in water. These eggs hatch after about 7 to 10 days and become small tadpoles. At this stage, tadpoles live in water and feed mainly on algae. Over the next six weeks, the tadpoles grow bigger and their bodies begin to change. After around nine weeks, the tadpoles develop legs and look more like young frogs. Then, after approximately twelve weeks, they become froglets and start breathing with lungs instead of gills. At this point, they begin moving from water to land. Finally, after about four years, the frog becomes fully mature and the cycle starts again.
Word count: 157
Teacher Feedback
üìò IELTS Writing Task 1 ‚Äì Full Feedback

Diagram: Life cycle of a frog

üîπ Task Achievement ‚Äî Band 7.5

Strengths:

You clearly describe all main stages of the life cycle.

A clear and accurate overview is included.

The description follows a logical chronological order.

Key time frames (7‚Äì10 days, six weeks, nine weeks, four years) are accurately reported.

No irrelevant information or personal opinion.

Minor improvements:

You could mention that eggs are laid in clusters (frogspawn) if shown in the diagram, but this is not essential.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.5

üîπ Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äî Band 7.5‚Äì8.0

What you did well:

Excellent paragraphing: introduction ‚Üí overview ‚Üí body.

Smooth use of linking words:

After that, Over the next, At this point, Finally

Ideas flow naturally with no abrupt jumps.

Possible improvement:

One or two sentences could be combined for even smoother flow, but this is minor.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.5‚Äì8.0

üîπ Lexical Resource (Vocabulary) ‚Äî Band 7.5

Strengths:

Accurate and varied process vocabulary:

circular process, hatch, develop, fully mature

Natural academic tone.

No spelling mistakes.

To improve further:

Very slightly more advanced wording could push this to Band 8 (e.g. undergoes metamorphosis), but not required.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.5

üîπ Grammatical Range & Accuracy ‚Äî Band 7.5

Strengths:

Wide range of sentence structures.

Accurate use of tenses and passive voice.

No noticeable grammar errors.

Clear control of complex sentences.

Minor note:

Grammar is strong and consistent; nothing significant to correct.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.5
Word count is achieved
AI Feedback
**Band Score: 7.0**

**Strengths:**
1. **Clear Structure:** The response is well-organized, with a clear introduction, overview, and detailed stages of the life cycle.
2. **Coherent Progression:** The stages of the life cycle are logically sequenced, making it easy for the reader to follow the process.
3. **Use of Appropriate Vocabulary:** The vocabulary used is relevant to the topic, such as "reproduction," "hatch," "tadpoles," "froglets," and "mature."

**Weaknesses:**
1. **Limited Detail:** While the stages are described, there could be more detail about the changes that occur during each stage, particularly in terms of physical or behavioral changes.
2. **Lack of Variety in Sentence Structure:** The sentence structures are somewhat repetitive, which can make the writing feel monotonous.
3. **Minor Grammatical Issues:** There are a few awkward phrases, such as "the process is circular," which could be more naturally phrased.

**Improvements:**
1. **Add More Detail:** Include additional information about the physical changes and behaviors of the tadpoles and froglets, as well as any environmental factors that might influence the life cycle.
2. **Vary Sentence Structure:** Use a mix of simple, compound, and complex sentences to enhance the flow and engagement of the writing. For example, instead of starting multiple sentences with "After that," consider using transitions like "Subsequently" or "Following this."
3. **Refine Language Use:** Aim for more precise language. Instead of saying "the process is circular," you might say "the life cycle is cyclical in nature," which sounds more polished.

Overall, this is a solid response that effectively communicates the life cycle of a frog, but with some enhancements in detail and language variety, it could achieve a higher band score.

Rubric: task-2, Some people believe that children should not be given homework every day, while others think that daily homework is necessary for success at school. Discuss both views and give your opinion. People have different opinions about whether children should receive homework every day. Some believe that daily homework is unnecessary and stressful, while others think it is important for academic success. This essay will discuss both views and give my own opinion. On the one hand, many people think children should not get homework every day. After spending many hours at school, students often feel tired and need time to relax. Too much homework can cause stress and reduce their interest in studying. Children also need time for hobbies, family, and rest, which are important for their personal development. On the other hand, some people believe that daily homework helps students succeed in school. Homework allows children to practice what they learn in class and understand lessons better. It also helps them become more responsible and organized. Students who do homework regularly are usually more confident in exams. In conclusion, both sides have strong reasons. However, I believe that children should receive homework, but not too much. When homework is given in a balanced way, it can improve learning without causing too much stress.

Develop each idea slightly more.

(task 2) Some people believe that children should not be given homework everyday, while others believe that they must get homework everyday in order to be successful at school. Discuss both sides and give your opinion. Some individuals are of the opinion that children should not receive homework every day while others believe that daily homework is essential for doing well at school. I will discuss both of these views and explain why I agree with the latter. On the one hand, there is a belief that giving homework every day puts pressure on children. After spending long hours at school, students may feel tired and bored. As a result, daily homework can reduce their motivation to study and effect their mental health. Moreover, children also need free time for relax, play sports or spending time with family. These activities are important for their emotional development . If students had a lot of homework , they may lose interest in learning. Despite these arguments, I believe that homework plays an important role in helping children secced at school. Homework allows students to revise lessons and practice what they have learned in class. Subjects such as math and languages require regular practice and homework is important for them. Furthermore, homework teaches children responsiblity and time managament skills, which is useful for their future career. By doing homework regularly, students can gradually build confidence. In conclusion, although both sides have strong arguments, I would like to say that daily homework can improve academic performance. Regular homework is beneficial for students career.

üéÑ muuhammad (writing task1)12/01/2026, 04:51:30

Writing Task 1 ‚Äì Life cycle of frog

The given diagram illustrates various stages in the life of frog. It can be seen from the picture that complete natural phenomenon lasts four years which is include 8 phases. However, we can from the picture, that there are 2 main steps in the development of the frog, from the egg to mature adult animal.

Initially, the natural phenomenon begins with mating of two mature frogs on the land. Next, the eggs are laid by female in the water, where frogspawns live until they reach full size. After seven or ten days tadpoles emerges from the eggs and consume aigae like a food. Then, the tadpole become bigger between six and nine weeks but do not reach full maturity.

When the tadpole has been become froglet in twelve weeks, it is started living on the land and started of pulmonary breathing. In the following stage froglet is become young frog which is take a few time. Finally, young frog reach maturity after 4 years being immature frog, and habitat on the land for the rest of its life.

Overall, it is seen that life cycle of frog is a complex phenomenon which is consist of 2 main steps, living in the water and on the land. After all above stages, the life cycle begins anew

 

Word count: 219

TASK 1 THE LIFE CYCLE OF FROG The diagram illustrates the various stages in the life of frog. We can see that the complete life cycle lasts four years.It also noticable that there are three main stages in the development of frog, from egg to mature adult insect. The life cycle of frog begins when adult frogs mate, and female frog lays egg which are called frogspawn.Around seven and ten days later tadpole which eats algae.During two stages tadpole continues to grow After 12 weeks it becomes a froglet which has starts pulmonary brathing.The next stage is that young frog emerges from froglet by leaving the water.The final stage is yong frog becomes into an adult frog, and then life cycle begins anew.

Overall, it can be seen that the life cycle of frog is a long time-consuming process involving many steps.

Teacher Feedback

Logical sequence of events is maintained.

Weaknesses:

Some key details are missing or unclear:

‚ÄúDuring two stages tadpole continues to grow‚Äù ‚Üí vague, could mention size increase or tail growth.

‚ÄúPulmonary breathing‚Äù could be better explained: starts using lungs instead of gills.

Slight factual inaccuracy: ‚Äúadult insect‚Äù ‚Üí should be ‚Äúadult frog.‚Äù

Could give more precise times for each stage (7‚Äì10 days, 6 weeks, 12 weeks).

Weaknesses:

üéÑ akramjonov muslimbek task 2 essay11/01/2026, 10:07:49
Rubric: Some people believe that children should not be given homework everyday, while others believe that they must get homework everyday in order to be successful at school. Discuss both sides and give your opinion. Essay: Opinions are divided on whether schoolchildren should be given homework as a daily routine. Some people argue that it is unnecessary, while others believe that it helps children to learn better. This essay will examine both of these views and explain why I support the latter. There are some reasons why people may believe that homework is an unnecessary burden. One common reason is that homework does not improve students‚Äô results. In some countries, for instance, such as Finland, where students are rarely given homework, educational systems are very good and students perform well in international tests. Another reason supporting this idea is that students already spent a lot of time at school, and after such a long day they feel exhausted and stressed. Encouraging them to do extra work at home may increase pressure and reduce time for rest. Therefore, giving extra work to do at home every day not only is unnecessary, but also bad for their overall well-being. In spite of these arguments, there are people, including myself, who argue that homework plays a key role in children‚Äôs learning. One benefit is that it teaches children to study independently. At home they have to work through tasks without teacher‚Äôs help which will encourage them to become organized and responsible. For example, when students practice math problems at home they are reviewing and strengthening what they learned in class. I believe that learning how to manage time and study independently is an essential life skill, and homework helps children to develop this habit from a young age. To sum up, although homework could cause some stress, I believe that it offers more benefits than drawbacks. When used in moderation and with a clear purpose, homework can help students to become better learners and prepare for the future.
Word count: 335
Teacher Feedback
1. Task Response ‚Äî Band 7
Strengths:
Both views are clearly discussed.
Your opinion is clearly stated and consistently supported.
Examples are used effectively (Finland example, math practice).
Ideas are relevant, developed, and logical.
Weaknesses:
Some explanations could be slightly more precise (e.g., ‚Äúencouraging them to do extra work at home may increase pressure‚Äù could specify impact on learning outcomes).
Could briefly explain why independent study improves future academic success.
Tip: Always link benefits to school success explicitly for maximum Task Response marks.
2. Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äî Band 7‚Äì7.5
Strengths:
Clear paragraphing and logical order.
Good use of cohesive devices:
In spite of these arguments, For example, To sum up.
Easy to follow.
Weaknesses:
Minor overuse of some phrases (for instance, at home). Varying connectors more could help.

üéÑ Akramjonov Muslimbek Task 1 essay frog life cycle10/01/2026, 09:12:21
The illustration gives information about the various stages in the life of a frog. It is noticeable that the complete life cycle lasts 4 years and there are three main stages in the development beginning with an egg and finishing with a mature frog. The life cycle of frog begins when two adult frogs mate and female lays eggs which are called a frogspawn. Between 7 and 10 days later a tadpole, which feeds on algae and has a small tail, emerges from a frogspawn. During the next two stages, the tadpole continues to grow in size. In the space of 12 weeks it becomes a froglet which has small limbs and starts pulmonary breathing. In the next stage of life, a young frog emerges from a froglet by leaving the water with the ability to breathe and walk. The final stage occurs when juvenile frog reaches full maturity and then life cycle begins anew. Overall, it can be seen that life stages of frog is a long and complex biological process which involves many steps.
Word count: 176
Teacher Feedback
üîπ Task Achievement ‚Äî Band 7.0

Strengths:

You accurately describe the main stages of the frog‚Äôs life cycle: egg ‚Üí tadpole ‚Üí froglet ‚Üí young frog ‚Üí mature frog.

Key timeframes are included (7‚Äì10 days, 12 weeks, 4 years), showing careful attention to details in the diagram.

The overview mentions total duration and number of main stages, fulfilling Task 1 requirements.

The description is factual and objective, suitable for Task 1.

Areas to improve:

You mention ‚Äúthree main stages‚Äù in the overview, but then describe more than three stages (egg, tadpole, froglet, young frog, mature frog). This inconsistency may slightly lower the band.

Could clarify transitions between stages to make it perfectly clear how one stage leads to the next.

The final sentence of the essay is slightly generic; a more precise summary would be better.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.0

üîπ Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äî Band 7.0‚Äì7.5

Strengths:

Paragraphing is clear: overview ‚Üí stages ‚Üí conclusion.

Sequencing words are used appropriately:

Between 7 and 10 days later, During the next two stages, In the next stage, Finally, Overall

Ideas progress logically from start to finish.

Minor issues:

Some sentences could be combined for smoother flow.
Example:

During the next two stages, the tadpole continues to grow in size. In the space of 12 weeks it becomes a froglet‚Ä¶
Could be:
Over the next 12 weeks, the tadpole grows and develops into a froglet, which has small limbs and starts pulmonary breathing.

Slight repetition of ‚Äústages‚Äù in many sentences; could vary vocabulary.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.0‚Äì7.5

üîπ Lexical Resource ‚Äî Band 7.0

Strengths:

Appropriate scientific/process vocabulary:

emerges, pulmonary breathing, juvenile, mature, frogspawn

Academic tone is maintained.

Precise use of biological terms is good for Task 1.

Areas to improve:

Minor word choice issues:

‚Äúyoung frog emerges from a froglet‚Äù ‚Üí better: ‚Äúthe froglet develops into a young frog‚Äù

‚Äúlife stages of frog is a long and complex biological process‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúthe life cycle of a frog is a long and complex biological process‚Äù

Could use a few synonyms to avoid repeating ‚Äústage/stages‚Äù so often.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.0

üîπ Grammatical Range & Accuracy ‚Äî Band 6.5‚Äì7.0

Strengths:

Generally accurate sentence structures.

Use of relative clauses (which feeds on algae and has a small tail) is good.

Tenses are mostly correct (present simple, which is appropriate for diagrams).

Errors / areas to fix:

Subject‚Äìverb agreement:

life stages of frog is a long‚Ä¶ ‚ùå
the life stages of a frog are a long‚Ä¶ ‚úÖ

Article use:

the tadpole continues to grow in size ‚úÖ (good)
a young frog emerges from a froglet ‚úÖ (good)

Some sentences are slightly awkward and could be rewritten for conciseness.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5‚Äì7.0

Word count is achieved
AI Feedback
üéÅ
THE WINNER TAKES IT ALL. (I am saul goodman. Did you know that you have rights? Constitution said that you do and I agree with it)
üéÑ Farida10/01/2026, 04:28:28
Stages of produsing chocolade from cacao beans The given diagram describes the stages of chocolate production. Overall, chocolate is produced through a series of interconnected stages, commencing with harvesting cacao beans and culminating in ready liquid chocolate. Initially, cacao trees are cultivated in tropical regions such as South America, Africa and Indonesia. When pods ripen, they are harvested, and the white cacao beans are extracted. The beans are placed to the large tray for fermenting. Then the beans are spread in the sun and are dried naturally. Already dried beans are packed into large sacks. Once beans are dried the sacks are transported to factories by lorry or train. The sacks are taken to factories where beans are roasted at high temperatures up to 300 C. Beans are crushed using a crushing machine to remove outer shell. Finally these beansare placed to a huge mixer with two rollers which make it liquid chocolade. How plastic bottels are recycled The illustration gives information about the recycling stages of plastic bottles. It can be seen from the diagram that there are 9 different stages in the process which began with throwing bottels into bins and finishing with ready items. Firstly, plastic bottles are thrown and collected to the rubbish bins. In the following stage bottels are loaded to the lorries and delivered at the recycling center. Then at this center bottles are sorted manually to the two boxes according to the quality of plastic. After that bottles are compressed into large blocks. Once blocks are ready they crushed using machine with two rollers and washed in a huge container which is fool of liquid. Another device is produced plastic pellets, which is heated and are melted to form raw materials. All this materials are collected to the wooden tray. In the final stage from this row products are made items such as clothing, containers and stationery.
Word count: 314
Teacher Feedback
üìò IELTS Writing Task 1 ‚Äì Full Feedback
üîπ Task Achievement ‚Äî Band 6.0‚Äì6.5

What you did well:

You covered both diagrams fully (chocolate production and plastic bottle recycling).

The main stages are included and described in a logical order.

You provided an overall statement for both processes.

The writing is factual and relevant to Task 1.

Problems affecting the score:

Some stages are unclearly described due to grammar and word choice.

A few details are inaccurate or awkwardly expressed (e.g. machines, trays, rollers).

Overviews are present but could be clearer and more concise.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.0‚Äì6.5

üîπ Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äî Band 6.0

Strengths:

Clear separation between the two processes.

Logical progression from beginning to end.

Basic linking words are used (Initially, Then, Finally).

Weaknesses:

Overuse of simple connectors (Then, After that).

Some sentences are very long and not well controlled.

Paragraphing is weak (titles and paragraphs are not clearly separated).

Example issue:

Once blocks are ready they crushed using machine‚Ä¶

This interrupts flow and cohesion.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.0

üîπ Lexical Resource (Vocabulary) ‚Äî Band 5.5‚Äì6.0

Good points:

Uses appropriate process vocabulary:

cultivated, harvested, roasted, compressed, pellets

Meaning is generally understandable.

Major vocabulary issues:

Frequent spelling mistakes:

produsing ‚Üí producing

chokolade / chocolade ‚Üí chocolate

bottels ‚Üí bottles

beansare ‚Üí beans are

fool ‚Üí full

Incorrect word forms and collocations:

placed to ‚ùå ‚Üí placed on

produced plastic pellets ‚ùå ‚Üí produces plastic pellets

Repetition of simple words (beans, bottles, stage).

These errors are noticeable to an examiner and limit the band.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 5.5‚Äì6.0

üîπ Grammatical Range & Accuracy ‚Äî Band 5.5‚Äì6.0

Strengths:

Attempts to use passive voice, which is correct for Task 1.

Uses a mix of simple and some complex sentences.

Frequent grammar problems:

Subject‚Äìverb agreement:

‚ùå they crushed

‚úÖ they are crushed

Missing articles:

‚ùå placed to the large tray

‚úÖ placed on a large tray

Incorrect sentence structure:

‚ùå Another device is produced plastic pellets

‚úÖ Another device produces plastic pellets

Missing punctuation and spacing:

beansare

Errors are frequent but do not completely block understanding, which keeps the score above Band 5.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 5.5‚Äì6.0

‚≠ê Band 6.0

Clear understanding of the diagrams

Logical order

However, frequent grammar and spelling mistakes prevent a higher score

To reach Band 7, you need:

Far fewer spelling errors

Cleaner paragraphing

Stages of produsing chocolade from cacao beans The given diagram describes the stages of chocolate production. Overall, chocolate is produced through a series of interconnected stages, commencing with harvesting cacao beans and culminating in ready liquid chocolate. Initially, cacao trees are cultivated in tropical regions such as South America, Africa and Indonesia. When pods ripen, they are harvested, and the white cacao beans are extracted. The beans are placed to the large tray for fermenting. Then the beans are spread in the sun and are dried naturally. Already dried beans are packed into large sacks. Once beans are dried the sacks are transported to factories by lorry or train. The sacks are taken to factories where beans are roasted at high temperatures up to 300 C. Beans are crushed using a crushing machine to remove outer shell. Finally these beansare placed to a huge mixer with two rollers which make it liquid chocolade. How plastic bottels are recycled The illustration gives information about the recycling stages of plastic bottles. It can be seen from the diagram that there are 9 different stages in the process which began with throwing bottels into bins and finishing with ready items. Firstly, plastic bottles are thrown and collected to the rubbish bins. In the following stage bottels are loaded to the lorries and delivered at the recycling center. Then at this center bottles are sorted manually to the two boxes according to the quality of plastic. After that bottles are compressed into large blocks. Once blocks are ready they crushed using machine with two rollers and washed in a huge container which is fool of liquid. Another device is produced plastic pellets, which is heated and are melted to form raw materials. All this materials are collected to the wooden tray. In the final stage from this row products are made items such as clothing, containers and stationery.

üéÑ Dilnura10/01/2026, 03:49:18
Education should be accessible to people of all economic backgrounds. All levels of education, from primary school to tertiary education, should be free. To what extent do you agree with this opinion? Many people argue that free education should be available for all students, everyone has equal opportunity to learn. I completely agree with the idea that education should be free at all levels, from primary school to university. One key reasons why this view is valid is that free education allows all children to learn, even students from poor families. In many countries some families cannot afford school fees, books or uniforms. If education is free, every child will have the same opportunity to gain knowledge and skills. It helps students improve their lives and benefit society. Skilled people can work in important jobs. In addition, free education encourages talented students to achieve their goals. Another strong argument supporting this idea is that free education reduces social unfairness. When only rich children can attend good schools or universities, poor children have fewer opportunities. By providing free education, the government give everyone a fair chance. This makes society more equal. A well educated population brings many benifits, such as better future for the country. In conclusion, I strongly believe that education should be free for everyone. Free education gives equal opportunities, rudece unfairness and helps society to develop. It is important for both individuals and society.
Word count: 236
Teacher Feedback
üîπ Task Response ‚Äì Band 7.0

What you did well:

You clearly answered the question and stated your opinion.

Your position (‚ÄúI completely agree‚Äù) is consistent throughout.

You provided relevant reasons and examples (poor families, social equality, benefits to society).

The essay is fully developed for a 236-word response.

What could be improved:

Arguments could be developed more deeply with clearer explanations or a specific example (e.g., a country with free education).

Some ideas are repeated (equal opportunity / fairness) and could be made more distinct.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7

Logical progression of ideas.

Good use of linking words:

Another strong argument

In conclusion

Improvements:

Some sentences are a bit short and simple; combining ideas would improve flow.

More varied cohesive devices would help (e.g., As a result, Moreover, Therefore).

üéÑ Turapova Sevinch10/01/2026, 03:16:36
Education is very important for personal growth and for society. Some people think that education should be free for everyone, including university education. I partly agree with this idea. On the one hand, I strongly believe that primary and secondary education should be free for all children. These school years give students basic skills like reading, writing, and maths, which are very important for life and future jobs. If families have to pay for these schools, children from poor families may miss the chance to learn and improve themselves. Free education at this level helps everyone have the same opportunities, no matter how rich or poor they are. On the other hand, I think university education should not be completely free for everyone. Universities need money to pay teachers, maintain classrooms, and provide books and equipment for students. If the government makes university education free for all, it could cause money problems and reduce the quality of teaching. In my opinion, it is also unfair for all people to pay for university through taxes because many people do not go to university at all. I believe it is better to help only students who really need financial support by giving them scholarships or lower tuition fees, instead of making it free for everyone. In conclusion, education should be available for everyone, but only primary and secondary schools should be completely free. University education should be affordable for those who need it, so the system can stay fair and high-quality.
Word count: 249

Could include a specific example or statistic to strengthen the argument, but not strictly necessary for Band 8.

Hello, DEXTER MORGAN!
üéÑ Akramjonov Muslimbek Task 2 essay10/01/2026, 03:09:13
Rubric: Education should be accessible to people of all economic backgrounds. All levels of education, from primary school to tertiary education, should be free. To what extent do you agree with this opinion Essay: There is a growing belief that all levels of education should be provided free of charge for everyone. This essay partly agrees with this view because primary and secondary education must be free, whereas higher education ought to require students to pay tuition fees. One key reason why primary and secondary education must be free is that schools educate for basic skills. Secondary and primary schools provide children with fundamental skills such as literacy and numeracy skills. When schools are free of charge, children could gain basic knowledge and become economically independent in the future by finding a job. In addition, by making primary and secondary education free, governments could gain financial benefits by enlarging the number of qualified workers. In some countries, for instance, such as Uzbekistan and France, school education is free and these countries are economically stable since there are many qualified workers. Therefore, it is significant to make primary and secondary schools free of charge. A major reason why higher education should not be free is that universities are expensive to run. Universities require more money to run as the staff is more qualified and there is state-of-the-art technology compaired to school. Although tertiary education is compulsory, many students apply for it in order to get a higher degree, so making universities completely free could have long-term drawbacks in the future for the economy. Thus, paying fees helps to maintain quality of universities. To sum up, I support the claim that schools should be free. However, in my opinion, tertiary education should not be free, but include scholarships and bursaries.
Word count: 298
Teacher Feedback
üîπ Task Response ‚Äî Band 7.0‚Äì7.5

Strengths:

Clear position: you partly agree and explain why primary/secondary education should be free, while tertiary education should require tuition fees.

Ideas are relevant and developed:

Primary/secondary schools ‚Üí basic skills and economic benefits

Tertiary education ‚Üí cost of universities and maintaining quality

Includes examples (Uzbekistan and France) which strengthen arguments.

Clear conclusion restates your position.

Areas for improvement:

Could explain your reasoning about scholarships more to make your argument stronger.

Some statements are slightly repetitive (primary and secondary education must be free / schools free of charge).

The essay is 298 words, slightly longer than the ideal range (~250 words). Conciseness would improve clarity.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.0‚Äì7.5

üü¢ Overall Estimated IELTS Writing Task 2 Band:
‚≠ê Band 7.0‚Äì7.5

Summary:

Strengths: Clear position, well-structured arguments, academic tone, examples included, logical cohesion.

Weaknesses: Minor grammar/spelling issues, some repetitive vocabulary, slightly long sentences, essay slightly above ideal word count.

This is a solid Band 7 essay. With slightly more sophisticated vocabulary, fewer repetitions, and cleaner grammar, it could reach Band 7.5‚Äì8.0.

üîπ Tips to Improve to Band 8

Avoid repeating words like free and schools; use synonyms or paraphrase.

Include a few higher-level academic phrases (equitable access, human capital, tuition waivers).

Split long sentences to improve grammatical accuracy.

Slightly shorten essay to ~250 words to improve clarity and cohesion.

Correct spelling errors (compaired ‚Üí compared).

üéÅ
üéÑ Ozodbek10/01/2026, 03:01:21
task 1 (first) The picture illustrates how plastic materials are recycled. And there are 9 different stages in the process that is shown in the picture. 

Overall, plastic materials are produced through a series of interconnected stages, commencing with collecting in special recicling bins and culminating in distributing the goods over the shops.

The recycling process begins when the rubbish is thrown into a special recycling bin. Then, the garbage car collects all the rubbish and goes to the recycling factories. Where separation of non-recyclable and compressing recyclable materials into blocks takes place.  After these processes, blocks are crushed in massive toothed rollers and end up in special boxes where they are thoroughly washed, and these materials are crushed and turned into plastic pellets. That's heated to form raw materials. And this process finishes with end products, which would be bought.  (second) The given diagram depicts the stages of liquid chocolate production. It can be seen from the picture that manufacturing liquid chocolate has a ten steps, beginning with harvesting the pods and finishing with pressing in a special circulum machine that produces liquid chocolate.

Ripe red pods, which grow on cacao trees, took place in South America, Africa, and Indonesia, and the harvests are collected and crushed to take white cacao beans. These beans are fermented and dried under the sun. And dried beans are put in sacks.  Collected beans are transported by lorries or trains to the factories where they are roasted and crushed in circular mixers to remove the outer shell. And at the end of this, the inner part is pressed, and liquid chocolate is produced.
Word count: 270
Teacher Feedback
üîπ Task Achievement ‚Äî Band 6.5

Strengths:

Both essays cover all main stages of the processes.

Overall descriptions are included: ‚ÄúOverall, plastic materials are produced through a series of interconnected stages‚Ä¶‚Äù

Chronological sequence is mostly followed.

Technical vocabulary is used: pellets, pressed, crushed, recycled, fermenting, roasting.

Weaknesses:

Some steps are vague or unclear:

‚ÄúWhere separation of non-recyclable and compressing recyclable materials into blocks takes place‚Äù ‚Üí grammar makes it confusing.

‚ÄúThat's heated to form raw materials‚Äù ‚Üí unclear, could specify ‚Äúheated and melted to produce raw plastic material.‚Äù

Chocolate essay: ‚ÄúRipe red pods‚Ä¶took place in South America‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Üí unclear phrasing; should be ‚ÄúRipe red pods grow on cacao trees in South America, Africa, and Indonesia.‚Äù

Some information could be more precise: e.g., size of blocks, pellets, or machines used.

Task 1 requires clarity and formal academic tone; some sentences are informal or fragmented.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5

üîπ Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äî Band 6.5

Strengths:

Logical paragraphing: introduction ‚Üí stages ‚Üí conclusion/overall.

Linking words used: then, after these processes, and, where.

Weaknesses:

Overuse of and at the beginning of sentences: ‚ÄúAnd dried beans are put in sacks.‚Äù

Some sentences are run-on or awkward: ‚ÄúRipe red pods, which grow on cacao trees, took place in South America, Africa, and Indonesia, and the harvests are collected and crushed to take white cacao beans.‚Äù

Cohesion could be improved by using more precise connectors: subsequently, next, following this, finally.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5

üîπ Lexical Resource ‚Äî Band 6.5

Strengths:

Some technical vocabulary used correctly: recycling, pellets, fermented, roasted, pressing, circulated machine, raw materials.

Academic phrases attempted: ‚Äúa series of interconnected stages,‚Äù ‚Äúculminating in distributing the goods.‚Äù

Weaknesses:

Repetition of words: beans, crushed, pressed, recycled.

Some inaccurate phrases: ‚Äútook place in South America‚Äù ‚Üí should be ‚Äúgrow in South America,‚Äù ‚Äúcirculum machine‚Äù ‚Üí unclear term.

Could use more process verbs: molded, shredded, ground, transported, converted.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5

üîπ Grammatical Range & Accuracy ‚Äî Band 6.0‚Äì6.5

Strengths:

Some passive voice used: ‚Äúthese materials are crushed and turned into plastic pellets,‚Äù ‚Äúbeans are fermented and dried.‚Äù

Mix of simple and complex sentences attempted.

Weaknesses:

Subject-verb agreement errors: ‚Äúliquid chocolate has a ten steps‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúliquid chocolate involves ten steps.‚Äù

Article mistakes: ‚Äúin special recycle bins‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúin special recycling bins,‚Äù ‚Äúa circulum machine‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúa special circular machine.‚Äù

Sentence fragments and run-ons: ‚ÄúThat's heated to form raw materials. And this process finishes with end products‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Üí should be one complete sentence.

Some tenses are awkward or inconsistent.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.0‚Äì6.5

üéÑ Ozodbek10/01/2026, 02:55:32
There is a growing belief among the population that there should be no fee for all levels of education and for the families that have financial problems. I completely agree with the view that education should be free.  One key reason why this view is valid is admission benefits. Some alumni whose parents work in the military can have a quota and enter colleges or universities with fewer exams. This clearly demonstrates that children whose parents are military do not study as hard as others, but those who can do everything have no chance to study. I can suggest that education should be free, but also students who study better should be separated. Because when one student studies better than others, they may want to break him or even teach him bad things.  Another strong argument supporting this idea is that these days many people face problems such as low monthly salaries. A lot of children all over the world want to study in educational centers, but because of the low salary, their parents are struggling to get them to educational centers. Michael Faraday, for instance, was one of the genius physicists in history who was born into a poor family but explored electromagnetism. And there are a myriad of scholars who were born in poor families, but they did the thing that many can not even imagine.  In conclusion, I strongly believe that education must be free because the young stars who have bright brains and who can even change the world are wasting their talent at home or working in physical labor. In addition, if the education were free, our planet would have been changed already.
Word count: 278
Teacher Feedback
üîπ Task Response ‚Äî Band 6.5

Strengths:

Clear position stated in introduction and conclusion: ‚ÄúI completely agree with the view that education should be free.‚Äù

Two main reasons are given:

Admission benefits/educational fairness.

Financial difficulties and access for talented children.

Examples are provided: Michael Faraday, children from poor families.

Attempt to justify position logically.

Weaknesses:

Argument 1 is unclear and slightly off-topic: military quota example is confusing and distracts from the main argument.

Some ideas are repetitive or not fully developed: ‚Äústudents who study better should be separated‚Äù ‚Üí unclear reasoning.

Limited discussion of broader societal impact; the essay could include more about economic or social benefits of free education.

Some statements are opinion-heavy but unsubstantiated: ‚Äúif the education were free, our planet would have been changed already‚Äù ‚Üí hyperbolic.

Linking phrases: ‚ÄúOne key reason‚Ä¶,‚Äù ‚ÄúAnother strong argument‚Ä¶,‚Äù ‚ÄúIn conclusion‚Ä¶‚Äù

Weaknesses:

Some sentences are long, awkward, and hard to follow:

‚ÄúBecause when one student studies better than others, they may want to break him or even teach him bad things.‚Äù ‚Üí confusing.

Overuse of and to connect ideas, which affects readability.

Paragraphing could better separate ideas: e.g., each supporting reason could have a topic sentence + supporting evidence + example.

Some repetition: ‚Äúeducation should be free‚Äù repeated several times.

Limited use of precise academic linking phrases: however, consequently, therefore.

Hi
üéÑ Abdullokh10/01/2026, 02:23:57
Many people argue that education at all levels ought to be proided free of charge. This essay argues that this view is misguided. A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that making all levels of education free could have a negative impact on public financial stability.If every educational system were fully funded by the goverment, enormous amonts of money would be required to maintain facilities,pay teachers salaries and invest in moderen equipment and technology.As aresult governments might be forced to raise taxes or rellocate funds from other essential public sectors such as healthcare social welfare and infrastructure.This could ultimately lower the overall qualty of public services and plce an excessive burden on taxpayers. Another factor that challlenges this claim is that may lead to a decline in educational quality.When educational institutions rely entirely on government funding limited budgets can restrict investment in a teaching resources, modern modern facilities, and staff development . Consequently teachers may receive lower salaries which can reduce their motivation and job satisfaction. In addition free education often results in a sharp increase in student numbers causing overcrowded classrooms and less individual attention for learners.

To sum up I strongly believe that free education at all levels would put pressure on public finances and reduce educational quality.
Word count: 212
Teacher Feedback
üîπ Task Response ‚Äî Band 7.0

Strengths:

Clear position: you disagree with free education at all levels.

Two strong arguments are developed:

Pressure on public finances.

Potential decline in educational quality.

Reasoning is logical and mostly relevant, with supporting details: taxes, overcrowded classrooms, teacher motivation.

Overall conclusion clearly restates your position.

Weaknesses:

No acknowledgment of counter-arguments (e.g., the benefits of free education for equal opportunities), which slightly limits task response.

Examples could be more specific or concrete: e.g., mention a country that struggles with free tertiary education to support your point.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.0

üîπ Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äî Band 7.0

Strengths:

Essay has logical paragraphing: introduction ‚Üí two main points ‚Üí conclusion.

Linking words and phrases used appropriately: A major reason, As a result, Another factor, Consequently, In addition, To sum up.

Paragraphs are focused and cohesive.

Weaknesses:

Minor punctuation issues: missing spaces after commas (facilities,pay teachers salaries).

Some sentences are long and could be split for easier readability.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.0

üîπ Lexical Resource ‚Äî Band 7.0

Strengths:

Good use of academic vocabulary: misguided, financial stability, enormous amounts, modern equipment, restricted investment, job satisfaction, overcrowded classrooms.

Variety of formal expressions and collocations: educational institutions rely entirely on government funding, excessive burden on taxpayers, sharp increase in student numbers.

Weaknesses:

Minor spelling errors reduce lexical accuracy: proided ‚Üí provided, goverment ‚Üí government, amonts ‚Üí amounts, moderen ‚Üí modern, qualty ‚Üí quality, plce ‚Üí place, challlenges ‚Üí challenges.

Some repeated words: modern appears twice in one sentence.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.0

üîπ Grammatical Range & Accuracy ‚Äî Band 6.5‚Äì7.0

Strengths:

Complex sentence structures attempted: If every educational system were fully funded‚Ä¶, When educational institutions rely entirely on government funding‚Ä¶

Mostly correct tense usage.

Weaknesses:

Subject-verb agreement: minor errors not noticeable here.

Article usage: investment in a teaching resources ‚Üí investment in teaching resources

Minor preposition issues: put pressure on public finances and reduce educational quality is correct, but could improve fluency with slight rephrasing.

Some punctuation missing or inconsistent (commas after introductory phrases).

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5‚Äì7.0

üéÑ Dilnura10/01/2026, 01:44:01
Plastic bottles The picture illustrates the process of recycling plastic bottles. It can be seen from the diagram that the process consists of 9 distant phases beginning with the collection of plastic bottles and finishing with the production of new products. Firstly, used plastic bottles are thrown in special recycling bins. In the following stage, the bottles are collected by lorry and transported to a recycling center. Once the bottles have been arrived there , they are sorted and unsuitable bottles are removed. The next stage is to compress the selected bottles into large blocks. After that, the blocks are crushed into small pieces and washed. Once the plastic pieces have been cleaned, thy are processed into small pellets. In the final stage, the pallets are heated to form of raw material and this material is used to manufacture new products such as bottles, clothing and stationery Liquid chocolate The picture illustrates the process of producing liquid chocolate. It is noticeable that the procedure includes 10 various steps which begins with growing cocoa trees and ends with the production of liquid chocolate. Firstly, cocoa trees are grown in regions such as South America, Africa and Indonesia. When the cocoa pods are ripe, they are harvested and white cocoa beans are removed. Once the beans have been collected and they are fermented. After that, the beans are spread out on a large tray and dried under the sun. In the following stage, the dried beans are packed into large sacks and transported by lorry to a factory. Then, the cocoa beans are roasted at a high temperature. Next, the roasted beans are crushed and outer shells are removed. Finally, the inner part is pressed and liquid chocolate is produced.
Word count: 288
Teacher Feedback
üîπ Task Achievement ‚Äì Band 7.0

Strengths:

You correctly identify both processes and describe them in a logical sequence.

Each report includes a clear overview stating the number of stages and start/end points.

All key stages are covered for both diagrams.

The tone is appropriately academic and factual.

Issues to improve:

Some inaccuracies in wording:

‚Äú9 distant phases‚Äù ‚Üí should be ‚Äú9 distinct stages‚Äù

A few stages could be explained more precisely (e.g. heating pellets to form raw plastic material).

Minor repetition of sentence structures (many sentences start with Firstly / After that).

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7

üîπ Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äì Band 7.0

What you did well:

Clear paragraphing: each process is separated.

Logical progression from beginning to end.

Appropriate use of sequencing language:

Firstly, In the following stage, After that, Finally

Improvements needed:

Overuse of basic linkers (Firstly, After that).

Some sentences could be combined to improve flow.

Occasional spacing/punctuation issues.

Example improvement:

‚ùå Once the bottles have been arrived there , they are sorted
‚úÖ Once the bottles arrive, they are sorted

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7

üîπ Lexical Resource (Vocabulary) ‚Äì Band 6.5‚Äì7.0

Strong points:

Good topic-specific vocabulary:

recycling bins, pellets, fermented, roasted, crushed

Appropriate formal style.

Errors to fix:

Spelling mistakes:

thy ‚Üí they

pallets ‚Üí pellets

center ‚Üí centre (British spelling preferred in IELTS)

Word choice:

‚Äúhave been arrived‚Äù ‚ùå

‚Äúarrive‚Äù or ‚Äúhave arrived‚Äù ‚úÖ

To reach Band 7+, try to use:

subsequently, thereafter, as a result, prior to

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5‚Äì7

What works well:

Mostly accurate simple and passive structures, which are important for Task 1.

Meaning is always clear.

Frequent grammar issues:

Incorrect verb forms:

‚ùå have been arrived

‚úÖ have arrived

Missing commas and articles:

‚ùå form of raw material

‚úÖ a form of raw material

Some run-on or incomplete sentences:

Once the beans have been collected and they are fermented. ‚ùå

Corrected version:

Once the beans have been collected, they are fermented.

More complex passive structures would raise your score.

üéÑ Turapova Sevinch10/01/2026, 00:49:42
Writing task 1.1 The illustration gives information about the recycling stages of plastic bottles. It can be seen from the diagram that there are 9 different stages in the process, begining with collecting bottles from special bins and finishing with manifacturing items. Initially,plastic bottles are collected from special recycling bins. The next stage is to load bottles from bins onto lorries and transporting them to the factories. After the go through sorting conveyor where bottles are sorted out by a specialist and send through compresser. After a while bottles have been pressed,they are go through double-shaft shedder to be crushed and washed. after which pieces of bottles are ground by a plastic piller machine and turn into pellets. Then pellets are heated to preduce raw materials. They are given rectangular form and connected in blocks of three. Finally, recycled raw materials gives a life for new products in aform of bottles,conteiners,bags,and even clothing. 1.2 The picture illustrates the process of producing liquid chocolate. Overall, chocolate is produced through series of inter connected stages,commencing with cacao trees [which grows mainly in Sauth America, Africa and Indonesia] and culminating in chocolate. Firstly, cacao trees are planted and cared after until red pads ripe. Secondly, red pads are harvested and crushed to obtain white cacao beans. After that, beans are colected in box from wood and fermented for some periods. Once fermented beans have been spreaded under the sun on alarge tray to dry,dryed brawn beans are collected and put in large sacks for transporting. The next stage is to load sacks onto shelves of the trains or lorries for transporting them to the cacao factory. The following stage is to roast beans at high temperatures, to be more specefic in 350 C. By the end of the process roasted beans are crushed in hulling blade where outer shell of them is removed. Finally, they go through by special machine where inner part pressed until it becomes liquid chocolate.
Word count: 326
Teacher Feedback
üîπ Task Achievement ‚Äî Band 6.5‚Äì7.0

Strengths:

All key stages of both processes are mentioned.

Start and end points are clearly identified.

Chronological order is mostly followed.

Some technical vocabulary is used (pellets, double-shaft shredder, roasted, hulling blade).

Areas to improve:

Some stages are unclear or awkwardly described, making the process harder to follow:

‚ÄúAfter the go through sorting conveyor‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Üí unclear, grammar error.

‚ÄúThey are given rectangular form and connected in blocks of three‚Äù ‚Üí confusing; could be simplified.

‚Äúred pads are harvested and crushed to obtain white cacao beans‚Äù ‚Üí inaccurate; cacao pods are opened, not crushed.

Minor factual inaccuracies:

‚ÄúRed pads‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúcacao pods‚Äù

‚Äú350 C‚Äù ‚Üí better: ‚Äúabout 350¬∞C‚Äù or ‚Äúhigh temperature.‚Äù

Overly long sentences make it hard to read.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5‚Äì7.0

üîπ Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äî Band 6.5

Strengths:

Paragraphing is logical: one paragraph per process.

Linking devices are used: Initially, The next stage, After that, Finally.

Areas to improve:

Repetitive connectors; could vary them: Subsequently, Following this, After completion, In the final stage.

Some sentences lack clarity due to grammar and punctuation errors, e.g.:

‚ÄúAfter the go through sorting conveyor where bottles are sorted out by a specialist and send through compresser.‚Äù

Could be split: ‚ÄúThe bottles go through a sorting conveyor, where a specialist removes unsuitable ones. They are then sent to a compressor.‚Äù

Minor lack of cohesion between some sentences; process descriptions need smoother transitions.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5

Strengths:

Some technical vocabulary: compressed, shredded, roasted, fermented, liquid chocolate, pellets, raw materials.

Academic tone attempted.

Areas to improve:

Frequent repetition of words: process, stage, transported, collected.

Incorrect or awkward word forms:

begining ‚Üí beginning

manifacturing ‚Üí manufacturing

spreaded ‚Üí spread

dryed ‚Üí dried

piller ‚Üí pelletizer

Some word choices are awkward: ‚Äúgives a life for new products‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúis used to produce new products.‚Äù

Could use more precise verbs: mold, press, package, transport, ferment.

Weaknesses:

Writing task 1.1 The illustration gives information about the recycling stages of plastic bottles. It can be seen from the diagram that there are 9 different stages in the process, begining with collecting bottles from special bins and finishing with manifacturing items. Initially,plastic bottles are collected from special recycling bins. The next stage is to load bottles from bins onto lorries and transporting them to the factories. After the go through sorting conveyor where bottles are sorted out by a specialist and send through compresser. After a while bottles have been pressed,they are go through double-shaft shedder to be crushed and washed. after which pieces of bottles are ground by a plastic piller machine and turn into pellets. Then pellets are heated to preduce raw materials. They are given rectangular form and connected in blocks of three. Finally, recycled raw materials gives a life for new products in aform of bottles,conteiners,bags,and even clothing. 1.2 The picture illustrates the process of producing liquid chocolate. Overall, chocolate is produced through series of inter connected stages,commencing with cacao trees [which grows mainly in Sauth America, Africa and Indonesia] and culminating in chocolate. Firstly, cacao trees are planted and cared after until red pads ripe. Secondly, red pads are harvested and crushed to obtain white cacao beans. After that, beans are colected in box from wood and fermented for some periods. Once fermented beans have been spreaded under the sun on alarge tray to dry,dryed brawn beans are collected and put in large sacks for transporting. The next stage is to load sacks onto shelves of the trains or lorries for transporting them to the cacao factory. The following stage is to roast beans at high temperatures, to be more specefic in 350 C. By the end of the process roasted beans are crushed in hulling blade where outer shell of them is removed. Finally, they go through by special machine where inner part pressed until it becomes liquid chocolate.

Hello, DEXTER MORGAN!
üéÑ muhammad ( writing task 2)09/01/2026, 12:08:18

Education should be accessible to people of economic backgrounds. All levels of education, from primary school to tertiary education, should be free. To what extent do you agree with this opinion?

Nowadays, it is commonly believed that all sort of educational institutions should be affordable or complimentary for all students despite their financial backgrounds. I entirely disagree with this statement mainly because of source of founding and moral duty of students.

A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that compulsory tuitions fees could be play a role of founding for universities. Most of colleges are totally depending from fees especially the private ones, which can be used for paying stuff‚Äôs salary or for reconstructions purposes of buildings and purchase some state-of-the-art equipment, creating best conditions for study. Furthermore, majority of universities provide a costless amenities such as housing, books and provide with scholarship only because of fees. As a result, tuition fee for many students is not a wasting resources but can be opportunities for obtaining such facilities.

Another factor that challenges this claim is feeling of obligation for study and demonstrate academic gains. Tuition fee can play a crucial role for students especially if they pay it themselves and may encourage them show academic progress and gain some rewards. If education were free, most of students would underestimate of education that might be affect on their behavior to study. Moreover, if students show great academic performance, universities can encourage them financially by providing some grants or fellowship.

In conclusion, although there is claim that education should be completely free, I am convinced, that this view is incorrect due to tuitions fees not only play a significant role in students life encouraging them value the study but also support universities financially.

Word count: 293
Teacher Feedback
üîπ Task Response ‚Äî Band 6.5‚Äì7.0

Strengths:

Clear position: you disagree with the idea of completely free education.

Relevant arguments:

Tuition fees support universities financially.

Tuition fees motivate students to take their studies seriously.

Examples included: university funding, scholarships, grants, state-of-the-art equipment.

Conclusion clearly restates your position.

Areas to improve:

Some ideas are unclear or awkwardly expressed:

‚Äúcompulsory tuitions fees could be play a role of founding‚Äù ‚Üí unclear; should be ‚Äútuition fees provide a crucial source of funding for universities.‚Äù

‚Äútuition fee for many students is not a wasting resources but can be opportunities for obtaining such facilities‚Äù ‚Üí awkward, needs clearer phrasing.

Overly broad statements without strong examples: e.g., ‚Äúmost students would underestimate education‚Äù could be supported by reasoning or evidence.

You do not acknowledge the counter-argument (free education benefits) fully, which slightly weakens Task Response.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5‚Äì7.0

Essay has logical structure: introduction ‚Üí body 1 ‚Üí body 2 ‚Üí conclusion.

Some cohesive devices used: Furthermore, As a result, Moreover, In conclusion.

Ideas are generally ordered logically.

Weaknesses:

Some linking is awkward or repetitive: ‚ÄúAnother factor that challenges this claim is feeling of obligation‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Üí could be simplified.

Some sentences are long and confusing, reducing clarity and cohesion:

‚ÄúIf education were free, most of students would underestimate of education that might be affect on their behavior to study.‚Äù

üéÑ Maqsudjon09/01/2026, 09:40:18
Task 1 topic 1 Plastic Bottle Recycling The given diagram depicts how plastic bottles are recycled through a circular process. Overall, the recycling of plastic bottles involves a series of steps that start with the disposal of used bottles and finish with the production of new items, after which the cycle begins again. First, people place used plastic bottles into special recycling bins. These bottles are then collected by a truck and transported to a recycling centre. At the centre, the bottles are carefully sorted and any unsuitable items are removed. The remaining bottles are compressed into large blocks, which are then crushed into small pieces and thoroughly washed. Next, the clean plastic fragments are processed into small pellets. These pellets are heated and melted to form raw plastic material. In the final stage, this material is used to manufacture new products such as bottles, clothing and packaging, completing the recycling loop. task 1 topic 2 The given diagram describes the stage of producing chocolate from cacao beans. Overall, chocolate production is a linear process consisting of several stages, beginning with growing cacao trees and ending with the production of liquid chocolate. Initially, cacao trees are cultivated in tropical regions such as South America, Africa and Indonesia. When the pods become ripe, they are harvested and split open in order to remove the white cocoa beans inside. These beans are then fermented for a period of time before being spread out under the sun to dry. After drying, the beans are packed into large sacks and transported by either train or lorry to a factory. At the factory, the dried beans are roasted at a high temperature. They are then crushed so that the outer shells can be removed. In the final stage of the process, the inner part of the beans is pressed, producing liquid chocolate which can be used for manufacturing various chocolate products.
Word count: 316
Teacher Feedback

üîπ Task Achievement ‚Äî Band 7.5

Strengths:

You accurately describe both diagrams and include all key stages.

Each process has a clear overview, correctly identifying whether it is circular or linear.

Start and end points are clearly stated.

No irrelevant details or opinions are included.

Minor points to improve:

The phrase ‚Äútask 1 topic 2‚Äù should not appear in an exam answer.

You could slightly reduce repetition of obvious steps (e.g. transport details).

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.5

üîπ Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äî Band 7.5

What you did well:

Very clear paragraphing and separation of ideas.

Logical sequencing of stages.

Effective use of linking devices:

Overall, First, Next, At the factory, In the final stage

Smooth flow between sentences and paragraphs.

Possible improvement:

You could combine one or two shorter sentences for even more natural flow, but this is minor.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.5

üîπ Lexical Resource (Vocabulary) ‚Äî Band 7.5

Strengths:

Strong and accurate process vocabulary:

depicts, compressed, fragments, fermented, roasted, manufacture

Academic and natural tone.

No noticeable spelling errors.

To improve further:

Slight repetition of common words like process and stage.

A few higher-level expressions could push this to Band 8 (e.g. undergoes processing).

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.5

üîπ Grammatical Range & Accuracy ‚Äî Band 7.0‚Äì7.5

Strengths:

Accurate and consistent use of passive voice, which is essential for Task 1.

Good control of sentence structure.

A mix of simple and complex sentences.

Very few minor grammatical slips.

Minor issue:

‚Äúthe stage of producing chocolate‚Äù ‚Üí should be ‚Äúthe stages of producing chocolate‚Äù (plural).

This is a very small error and does not significantly affect the score.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.0‚Äì7.5

üéÑ Maqsudjon09/01/2026, 08:17:05
Education should be accessible to people of all economic backgrounds. All levels of education, from primary school to tertiary education, should be free. To what extent do you agree with this opinion? Many people believe that education should be available to everyone, no matter what their economic background is, and that all levels of education should be free. I agree with this opinion because education plays an important role in personal success and social development. First of all, free primary and secondary education helps create equal opportunities for children. When education is free, children from poor families can go to school and improve their knowledge and skills. This allows them to get better jobs in the future and support themselves and their families. In addition, an educated population is good for the country because it increases productivity and reduces social problems such as crime and unemployment. Moreover, making university education free or affordable is also very beneficial. Many students are unable to continue their studies because they cannot afford high tuition fees. If higher education is free, more students will be able to become doctors, engineers, and teachers who are needed for the development of the country. Although universities need money to operate, the government can support them by using public funds and offering scholarships to students. In conclusion, I strongly believe that education should be accessible to everyone at all levels. Free education creates equal chances for success and helps countries develop economically and socially.
Word count: 246

In the first stage,cocoa trees are grown in tropical regions such as South America and Indonesia.When the pods are ripe,they are picked and cut open to taek out the white cocoa beans.These beans are then fermented and later dried under the sun. After drying,the cocoa beans are placed into large bags and transported to factory by train or lorry.At the factory, the beans are roasted at a high temperature.In the following stage , they are crushed to remove the outer shell.Finally,the inner part of the beans is pressed, and as a result, liquid chocolate is produced.

TASK 1 RECYCLING PLASTIC BOTTLES The illustration gives information about recycling stages of utilied platic bottles.It can be seen from the diagram that there are 9 various satges in the process,which begins with collecting plastic bottles from rubbish bin and ends with making new clothing items,containers and stationery. Initially,usage plastic bottles are collected from rubbish bin by hand.In the following stage plastic bottles are loaded to truck,and transported to recycling centre.At the recycling centre the bottles are carefully sorted by hand.The next stage is to comperss plastic bottles into huge block. After these steps,plastic bottles are crushed into small pieces by special machine,which has two rollers and crushed plastic bottles is washed and made into plastic pellets.The following stage is the pellets are heated to form raw material.Then this raw material is stored and preapered for manufacturing.Finally,new plastic products are produced from the recycled material.
Word count: 145
Teacher Feedback
üîπ Task Achievement ‚Äî Band 6.5‚Äì7.0

Strengths:

You describe all the key stages of the recycling process.

The overall process is summarized in the introduction and conclusion: ‚ÄúIt can be seen from the diagram‚Ä¶ends with making new clothing items, containers and stationery.‚Äù

Chronological order is followed: collection ‚Üí transport ‚Üí sorting ‚Üí compression ‚Üí crushing ‚Üí pellet formation ‚Üí heating ‚Üí new products.

Use of passive voice attempted: ‚Äúcrushed into small pieces by special machine‚Äù.

Weaknesses:

Some steps are unclear or grammatically inaccurate:

‚Äúcrushed plastic bottles is washed and made into plastic pellets‚Äù ‚Üí should be ‚Äúthe crushed plastic bottles are washed and processed into plastic pellets.‚Äù

‚Äúthe pellets are heated to form raw material‚Äù ‚Üí slightly vague; could say ‚Äúheated and melted to produce raw plastic material.‚Äù

Some steps are oversimplified or could be more precise: e.g., the stage where blocks are compressed could mention ‚Äúforming large blocks for easier handling.‚Äù

Overall, description is adequate but could be more detailed and precise for higher band.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5‚Äì7.0

üîπ Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äî Band 6.5‚Äì7.0

Strengths:

Logical paragraphing: introduction ‚Üí stages ‚Üí final product.

Linking words used: Initially, In the following stage, After these steps, Finally.

Weaknesses:

Some sentences are choppy or over-simplified; combining or restructuring would improve cohesion:

‚ÄúIn the following stage plastic bottles are loaded to truck,and transported to recycling centre.‚Äù ‚Üí smoother as: ‚ÄúNext, the bottles are loaded onto a truck and transported to the recycling centre.‚Äù

Minor punctuation errors: missing spaces after commas (truck,and transported).

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5‚Äì7.0

üîπ Lexical Resource ‚Äî Band 6.5

Strengths:

Some technical terms used: recycling centre, compressed, plastic pellets, raw material, manufactured.

Academic tone attempted: ‚ÄúIt can be seen from the diagram‚Ä¶‚Äù

Weaknesses:

Repetition of words: plastic bottles appears in almost every sentence; can be replaced with these items, the bottles, them.

Minor spelling mistakes: utilied ‚Üí utilized, platic ‚Üí plastic, satges ‚Üí stages, comperss ‚Üí compress, preapered ‚Üí prepared.

Could use more precise process verbs: molded, heated, melted, processed, transformed.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5

üîπ Grammatical Range & Accuracy ‚Äî Band 6.0‚Äì6.5

Strengths:

Use of passive voice in places: ‚Äúcrushed into small pieces by special machine‚Äù.

Mix of simple and compound sentences.

Weaknesses:

Subject-verb agreement errors: ‚Äúcrushed plastic bottles is washed‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúcrushed plastic bottles are washed‚Äù.

Article errors: ‚Äúfrom rubbish bin‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúfrom a rubbish bin‚Äù, ‚Äúto truck‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúonto a truck‚Äù.

Verb forms: ‚Äúpreapered for manufacturing‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúprepared for manufacturing‚Äù.

Some sentences could be split or restructured for clarity and grammar accuracy.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.0‚Äì6.5

üéÅ
üéÑ Farida09/01/2026, 05:24:46
Education should be accessible to people of all economic backgrounds. All levels of education, from primary school to tertiary education, should be free. To what extent do you agree with this opinion? (common question) Many people argue that education in institutions should be free of charge for all economic statuses. This essay fully agrees with this perspective because it could help entire population have same access to the education process. One key reason why this view is valid is that free education ensures equal opportunities for all backgrounds. It means that people from low-income families will have the same opportunities as those from wealthy. When tuition fees are removed, talented students are not forced to abandon their studies due to financial problems. As a result, education becomes a tool which will be available to everyone. Moreover it could help to reduce long-term inequality in society which is a common problem nowadays. Thus different families have not same living standards, because of contrasting levels of knowledge. Another strong argument supporting this idea is that it provides economic and social benefits in the long run. Investing in free education creates a high skilled workforce, which directly help to economic growth. Well-educated individuals are more likely to work in prestigious places and have higher income. Therefore they will pay higher taxes and rely less on government support. Moreover, an educated society is more likely to produce new innovations. This include introducing new technologies and devices, which will definitely change society overall. To sum up, I fully support the view that academic development should be cost-free and accessible for everyone. As all families should have same opportunities to study and also to build an academiclly educated society.

üéÅ
üåöüåù
üéÑ muhammad (writing part1)09/01/2026, 04:46:05

Writing Task 1 ‚Äì Recycling of plastic bottles

The picture illustrate how utilized plastic bottles is recycled to produce essential items for avoiding environment degradation. It can be seen from the diagram that there are 9 various stages in the procedure beginning with collection plastic products in special recycle bins and finishing recycling of plastic to produce necessary products.

Initially, usage plastic bottles are collected in special bins, where any sort of plastics throw away by citizens. In the following stage waste collection vehicle is picked bottles from bins using a lifter and transporting them to recycling center. The next stage is sorting plastic products manually based on quality. After that, graduated bottles are pressed into excessive blocks.

Secondly, these blocks are crushed by shredder and rinsed into liquid in order to remove impurities. Then, crushed plastics are subjected to grinding, as a result obtaining pellets. Once pellets have been obtained, raw materials have been manufactured by heating pellets and have been given shape. Finally, products such as clothing, containers and stationeries are processed by raw material.

Overall, it is seen that refining of plastic products is a complex process involving several steps by using different equipment.

Writing Task 1 ‚Äì Producing liquid chocolate

The picture illustrate how processed liquid chocolate from cacao beans. It can be seen from the picture that there are 10 various and complex steps in the procedure beginning with harvesting ripe rede pods from cacao tree and finishing with compressing beans to obtain chocolate product.

Initially, ripe red pods are picked from cacao tree which are mostly grown in Africa, Indonesia and South America with sweltering climate. In the following stage collected pods are crushed and peeled in order to obtain white cocoa beans. The next stage is fermenting in special boxes. Then, these beans are spread on a large tray under the sun to dry. After that, dried beans are put into a large sacks for storing and for the next steps.

After above phases packaged beans are delivered by large vehicle to factories. When beans have been taken to factory, they have been roasted at 350-degree Celsius temperature. After roasting, beans are crushed in special machine to remove outer shell. Finally, inner parts of beans are pressed, accordingly, obtain liquid chocolate product.

Overall, it is seen that manufactured liquid chocolate is a complex process involving several steps by using different equipment.

Word count: 398
Teacher Feedback
üîπ Task Achievement ‚Äî Band 6.5‚Äì7.0

Strengths:

You describe all the key stages for both processes (plastic recycling and chocolate production).

Start and end points are clearly identified.

Time order is mostly logical.

You include some technical vocabulary: pellets, shredder, fermenting, roasted, compressing, outer shell.

Both essays include an overall statement at the end.

Weaknesses:

Some descriptions are unclear or awkwardly phrased, which reduces accuracy:

‚Äúusage plastic bottles are collected in special bins, where any sort of plastics throw away by citizens‚Äù ‚Üí should be ‚Äú‚Ä¶where citizens dispose of used plastic products.‚Äù

‚Äúcrushed by shredder and rinsed into liquid‚Äù ‚Üí plastic is washed, not ‚Äúrinsed into liquid.‚Äù

‚Äúcrushed in special machine to remove outer shell‚Äù ‚Üí should be ‚Äúhulling machine‚Äù or ‚Äúcrushed to remove the outer shell.‚Äù

Minor factual inaccuracies: e.g., cacao pods are opened, not ‚Äúcrushed and peeled‚Äù initially.

Some steps could be explained more clearly to show the process sequence logically.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5‚Äì7.0

üîπ Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äî Band 6.5

Strengths:

Logical paragraphing: one paragraph per process.

Chronological connectors used: Initially, In the following stage, After that, Finally, Overall.

Weaknesses:

Some sentences are too long and awkward, affecting readability:

‚ÄúAfter above phases packaged beans are delivered by large vehicle to factories‚Äù ‚Üí could be split into two sentences.

Minor repetition of linking words (After that, Finally, In the following stage).

Some sentences lack smooth cohesion between ideas: e.g., ‚ÄúThen, crushed plastics are subjected to grinding, as a result obtaining pellets.‚Äù ‚Üí awkward transition.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5

Strengths:

Technical vocabulary is present: shredder, pellets, fermenting, compressing, roasting, outer shell, raw material.

Academic tone attempted.

Weaknesses:

Some phrases are awkward or incorrect collocations:

‚Äúusage plastic bottles‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúused plastic bottles‚Äù

‚Äúhave been given shape‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúmolded into shape‚Äù

‚Äúobtaining pellets‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúproducing pellets‚Äù

‚Äúcompressing beans to obtain chocolate product‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúpressing the beans to produce liquid chocolate‚Äù

Repetition of words: process, stage, step, obtain, used, beans.

Could use more precise verbs for process description: mold, press, ferment, grind, transport, package.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5

üîπ Grammatical Range & Accuracy ‚Äî Band 6.0‚Äì6.5

Strengths:

Mix of simple and complex sentences.

Some passive voice attempted: ‚Äúbeans are spread on a large tray under the sun‚Äù, ‚Äúpellets have been heated‚Äù.

Weaknesses:

Grammar errors reduce clarity:

Subject-verb agreement: ‚ÄúThe picture illustrate‚Äù ‚Üí ‚ÄúThe picture illustrates‚Äù

Articles missing: *‚Äúcollected in large sacks‚Äù ‚Üí correct, but ‚Äúput into a large sacks‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúput into large sacks‚Äù

Prepositions incorrect: ‚Äúdepending from fees‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúdepending on fees‚Äù (from previous essay)

Awkward sentence structures: ‚ÄúSecond, these blocks are crushed by shredder and rinsed into liquid in order to remove impurities‚Äù ‚Üí could be simplified to ‚ÄúNext, the blocks are shredded and washed to remove impurities.‚Äù

Overuse of past participles in awkward constructions: ‚Äúhave been obtained, have been given shape‚Äù.
