üéÅ
üéÑ Akramjonov muslimbek Task 1 essays09/01/2026, 00:09:28
Recycling plastic bottles: The illustration gives information about recycling stages of utilized plastic bottles. Overall, it can be seen from the diagram that there are 9 different stages in the process beginning with collecting them and finishing with manufacturing clothes, containers and stationery. Firstly, used plastic bottles are collected from a rubbish bin by hand. Once plastic bottles have been loaded on truck and transported to recycling center, sorting out them to good or bad ones is done manually. The next stage is to compress and give a shape of huge block. In the following stage crushing by using special equipment, which has two big rollers, and washing in a big container is done. After all of these procedures, producing plastic pellets with usage of special machine which grinds washed particles of a cube is done. Pellets have been heated, after which raw material is shaped. The last stage is to obtain final products including new bottles and stationery. (151 words) Liquid chocolate production: The given diagram describes the stages of liquid chocolate production. Overall, it can be seen form the diagram that the procedure includes ten various steps beginning with growing red pods and finishing with manufacturing liquid chocolate. Initially, ripe red pods are grown in the tree which grows well in South America and Africa. Once pods have been harvested and broken, white cocoa beans are fermented. The next stage is to spread these beans under the sun in a big tray in order to dry. In the following stage dried beans are packed in a large sack manually. After all of these steps, packages are loaded on a truck or a train to send them to the factory. When beans are transported to the factory, they are roasted at a three hundred fifty degrees in Celsius. The next stage is to crush and remove the peel of cocoa beans using a special machine. The last stage is to press inner part using special equipment which has two huge rollers, and obtaining a liquid chocolate. (173 words)

Areas to improve:

‚Äúproducing plastic pellets with usage of special machine which grinds washed particles of a cube is done‚Äù ‚Üí unclear; could be simplified.

The chocolate essay mentions ‚Äúthree hundred fifty degrees in Celsius‚Äù, which is overly specific; rounding to 350¬∞C or high temperature is more natural.

üü¢ Overall Estimated IELTS Writing Task 1 Band:
‚≠ê Band 6.5‚Äì7.0

Summary:

Strengths: Covers all stages, chronological order, basic technical vocabulary, overview included.

Weaknesses: Awkward phrasing, repetitive vocabulary, minor grammar errors, sentences sometimes unclear or overly long.

This is a solid Band 6.5 response. With improved clarity, vocabulary variety, grammar accuracy, and more concise sentences, it could reach Band 7.5.

üîπ Tips to Improve

Use more precise verbs: crush, mold, press, sort, transport instead of ‚Äúdo‚Äù or ‚Äúusage of special machine.‚Äù

Avoid repeating stage/steps; use phase, process, procedure, step interchangeably.

Simplify overly long or awkward sentences.

Check article usage and prepositions: in a big container ‚Üí in a large container, on a truck ‚Üí by truck.

Maintain consistent passive voice for all process descriptions.

üéÑ muhammad08/01/2026, 10:18:36
Some people believe that teaching children at home is best for child‚Äôs development while others think that it is important for children to go to school. Discuss the advantages of both and give your own opinion. Nowadays, it is commonly believed that pursue education at home could be much convenient for teenagers, while others convince that study at educational institutions is far essential for pupils in point of experience and improving social skills. This essay will examine both sides and explain why I support the idea that learning out of school can be more beneficial. On the one hand, there is a belief that pursue education at school might carry more upsides. The most common advantages of this trend is gaining social skills. Most children who are attending at school classes are prone to engage in team groups, teambuildings or even overcome some complex assignment together in order to build relationship between group colleges or just to achieve academic performance. As a result, such activities build pupil‚Äôs social skills and help enhance their self-esteem as well. Moreover, these social experiences might have substantial role for employer to appoint. In addition, schools offer a better overall educational experience. If children study at school, they will learn how to get on with each other especially with various teachers who are teaching various discipline. Moreover, schools offer unforgettable events for broadening children‚Äôs horizons. On the other hand, home-schooling may carry more upsides as well as I firmly believe. One main benefit is that one-to-one lessons allow much faster progress. Many of children who are studying at home feel themselves more comfortable due to their own place, which allows them being less stressful especially if they are introvert. For instance, when students practice at home they have full teacher‚Äôs attention, allowing asking question without hesitation. Furthermore, I believe that majority of families are not satisfied with local schools so that many parents provide best condition for their children‚Äôs future. In this way, it not only allows parents control their academic performance but also support them to tackle some issues. In conclusion, although traditional teaching may provide some social advantages with school experiences, I strongly believe that home-schooling offers more benefits and convenience for free study.

AI Feedback
üéÅ
üéÑ Turapova Sevinc08/01/2026, 04:59:08
There is an ongoing debate about whether children should be educated at home or attend school, as both methods have unique advantages. While some people believe that homeschooling provides the best environment for a child‚Äôs development, others argue that attending school is essential for social and academic growth. Supporters of homeschooling often claim that it allows education to be tailored to a child‚Äôs individual needs and pace. Parents can focus on subjects their child finds challenging, ensuring a deeper understanding and reducing unnecessary pressure. Moreover, homeschooling can protect children from negative influences, such as bullying, and offer a safe, flexible learning environment. On the other hand, attending school provides children with opportunities that are difficult to replicate at home. Schools encourage social interaction, teamwork, and communication skills, which are essential for personal development. Children also benefit from exposure to professional teachers, structured routines, and a diverse range of subjects and extracurricular activities. These experiences prepare them for future challenges in both higher education and the workplace. In my opinion, while homeschooling can be beneficial for specific circumstances, attending school offers a more balanced development for most children. It combines academic learning with social growth, fostering independence and resilience that are crucial in adulthood. In conclusion, both homeschooling and formal schooling have advantages. However, considering the long-term social and educational benefits, attending school is generally more effective in supporting a child‚Äôs overall development.

Both methods offer certain benefits, but I believe traditional school plays a more significant role in a child‚Äôs social development. Firstly, homeschooling can be very beneficial for child‚Äôs development. One major advantage is that children receive individual attention from tutors. This allows child learn faster and can improve understanding and confidence. In addition, learning at home provide a safe and comfortable environment. Children are less likely to face problems such as bullying which can negatively affect their mental health. However, attending school offers many important benefits that homeschooling cannot fully provide. Schools help children develop social skills by interacting with classmates and teachers. This interaction teaches teamwork and communication. Furthermore, schools usually have trained teachers and better educational resources such as laboratory and sport facilities. These facilities help students gain both academic knowledge and practical skills. Schools also prepare children for real life situations, where they must fallow rules, manage time and work with others. In my opinion, although homeschooling has some advantages, attending school is more beneficial for most children. Schools not only provide quality education but also help children grow socially. In conclusion, both homeschooling and traditional schooling have their benefits. However, I believe that schools offer a more complete education for children‚Äôs overall development.

In my view, although studying remotely may seem like the best way of education, I strongly believe that traditional schools help students learn cooperation and the achievement of long-term goals. On the one hand, it is commonly believed that online learning is one of the most effective ways of studying. Due to the fact that when teachers have one-to-one lessons, it is easier for learners to understand topics better and make faster progress. Another factor why some choose homeschooling is that not all families have access to high-quality schools, mostly because of poor transport. Therefore, parents can respond to what their children need and how they learn best. On the other hand, many people, as well as I, claim that offline schools are a better option for youngsters. When learners study face-to-face with their teachers and classmates, they learn teamwork and cooperation. These skills will definitely help them find suitable jobs in the future and also help them not struggle to get along well with colleagues in the workplace. The biggest advantage of traditional schools is that they have multiple professionals in every subject. Therefore, it is really helpful for poorer families because they do not have to find expensive tutors or experts for their children. To conclude, although online learning could be helpful for some children who do not have access to schools, I believe that attending physical schools is more beneficial for children‚Äôs development and overall educational experience.

Some people hold the view that home-schooling is good for children‚Äôs development, while other claim that schools play more important role in child‚Äôs life. This essay intends to discuss both of these views and explain why I agree with the latter. There some reasons why many parents believe that home-schooling is the best option. The main reason would be changing education program. Parents could respond to what their children need to know and how they learn best by teaching them at home. Another reason supporting this argument would be working without distractions. When children study in their own room or at home, they pay more attention to the lesson as there is no distractors such as noisy classmates. Children who study at school, for instance, show lower academic performance rather that those who study at home. Despite these arguments, there are many people, including myself, who argue that schools play crucial role in children‚Äôs development. The most significant reason why it is better to study at school rather than at home will be developing communication skills. Schools offer social experience by encouraging children to communicate with their classmates or teacher during school day. For example, when children went to school, they would improve confidence and reduce shyness by chatting with classmates. In addition, home-schooling could bring also financial pressure. In order to teach children at home, one parent must give up work or hire a private tutor which may cost really expensive. I strongly believe that learning how to communicate and study with qualified teachers at school would help children to develop good habits from a young age. To sum up, despite some positive aspects of home-schooling such as flexible education program and study without distraction, I believe that benefits of schools including improved social skills and confidence.

üéÅ
üéÑ Maqsudjon07/01/2026, 10:15:17
Rubric: Some people believe that teaching children at home is best for child's development while others think that it is important for children to go to school. Discuss the advantages of both methods and give your own opinion. Some people believe that educating children at home is the best way to support their development, while others argue that attending school is more important. Both methods offer significant advantages, and in my opinion, a combination of the two is the most effective approach. On the one hand, home education allows parents to respond directly to their children‚Äôs individual needs and learning styles. One-to-one instruction enables faster progress, as lessons can be adapted to the child‚Äôs pace and interests. In addition, children can work at their own pace without pressure from classmates, and discipline problems are often avoided in a home environment. This method is especially helpful for families living in remote areas with poor access to schools or for children who struggle in large classrooms. On the other hand, school education provides benefits that are difficult to replicate at home. Schools employ trained teachers who possess specialized knowledge and experience in different subjects. Furthermore, children develop essential social skills by interacting with peers, learning cooperation, communication, and conflict resolution. Schools also prepare children to become responsible members of society by teaching moral values such as tolerance, respect, and sharing. In many cases, the structured environment of schools promotes motivation and consistency in learning. In my view, although home schooling offers valuable flexibility and personalized education, traditional schools provide a broader educational experience. Social development, exposure to diverse ideas, and access to professional instruction are crucial for a child‚Äôs long-term success. Therefore, I believe the most effective system is one that combines both approaches, where parents actively support learning at home while children benefit from formal education at school.

don‚Äôt break your neck
üéÑ ozodbek25/12/2025, 04:43:54
Nowadays, plastic waste has become a serious problem in many countries around the world. Due to the widespread use of plastic products, the amount of waste is increasing rapidly and harming the environment. However, this issue can be addressed through government action and changes in individual behaviour. One of the main solutions is introdusing stricter laws to reduse plastic usage. Government could ban or limit single use plastic items such as bags, bottels and straws, which are major contributors to pollution. For example, charging consumers for plastic bags has proven successful in many countries, as it encourage people to use reuseable alternatieves. In addition, companies should be required to use eco friendly packaging materials. Another effective way to solve this problem is improving recycling systems. Many countries still lack propper recycling facilities, which leads to plastic waste ending up in oceans. Government should invest in modern recycling technologies and make waste separation compulsory. If people are educated on how tho sort their waste correctly, recycling rates can increase significantly. Furthermore, raising public awareness plays a crucial role. People often use plastic carelessly because they are unaware of its long term environmental impact. Educational campaigns at school and through media can help individuals understand the dangers of plastic pollution and encourage more responsible consumption habits. In conclusion, plastic waste is a growing global issue, but it can be redused through strict regulations, better recycling system and increased public awareness.
Word count: 238
Teacher Feedback
üîπ Task Response ‚Äî Band 7.0

Strengths:

Clear position is stated and maintained throughout: the essay argues that plastic waste is a serious problem and proposes solutions.

Three clear solutions are presented:

Stricter laws and regulations

Improved recycling systems

Raising public awareness

Relevant examples included: ‚Äúcharging consumers for plastic bags has proven successful in many countries.‚Äù

Causes of the problem are briefly explained.

Weaknesses:

Could include a link between the problem and solutions more explicitly in each paragraph: e.g., explain how limiting single-use plastics directly reduces environmental damage.

The essay slightly lacks depth in evidence; one or two more specific examples would strengthen arguments.

Some minor repetition of words: ‚Äúplastic‚Äù appears frequently; could vary with polymer waste, plastic products, synthetic materials.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.0

üîπ Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äî Band 7.0

Strengths:

Logical structure: introduction ‚Üí problem ‚Üí three solutions ‚Üí conclusion.

Clear paragraphing.

Linking words are used: however, for example, in addition, furthermore, in conclusion.

Weaknesses:

Some connectors could be more precise: ‚Äúit encourage people‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúthis encourages people, thereby reducing reliance on single-use plastics.‚Äù

Minor awkward phrasing: ‚Äúwhich leads to plastic waste ending up in oceans‚Äù ‚Üí could be more formal: ‚Äúresulting in plastic waste entering oceans.‚Äù

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.0

üîπ Lexical Resource ‚Äî Band 7.0

Strengths:

Weaknesses:

Some words are misspelled or misused:

‚Äúintrodusing‚Äù ‚Üí introducing

‚Äúreduse‚Äù ‚Üí reduce

‚Äúbottels‚Äù ‚Üí bottles

‚Äúreuseable alternatieves‚Äù ‚Üí reusable alternatives

‚Äúpropper‚Äù ‚Üí proper

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.0

üîπ Grammatical Range & Accuracy ‚Äî Band 6.5‚Äì7.0

Strengths:

Mostly correct sentence structures; mix of simple and complex sentences.

Passive voice and conditionals are attempted: ‚ÄúGovernment should invest in modern recycling technologies‚Äù; ‚ÄúIf people are educated‚Ä¶recycling rates can increase.‚Äù

Weaknesses:

Errors in article use: ‚ÄúGovernment could ban or limit single use plastic items‚Äù ‚Üí ‚ÄúThe government could ban or limit single-use plastic items.‚Äù

Minor subject-verb agreement errors: ‚Äúit encourage people‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúit encourages people.‚Äù

Minor spelling and punctuation issues: ‚Äúreuseable alternatieves, propper recycling, bottels.‚Äù

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5‚Äì7.0

AI Feedback
üéÅ
I wish you merry Christmas üéÑüéÅ thank you same wishes to you üíê
üéÑ Sevinch Turopova)25/12/2025, 04:38:20
Rubric More and more countries have a problem with plastic waste. How can this problem be solved? Essay Plastic waste has become a growing concern in many countries, as it causes serious damage to the environment and threatens both wildlife and human health. This issue can be addressed through effective government policies and responsible individual behaviour. One practical solution is for governments to regulate the production and use of plastic. Laws that ban single-use plastics, such as bags and straws, can greatly reduce waste. Moreover, imposing higher taxes on plastic packaging encourages companies to switch to sustainable materials. Governments should also invest in modern recycling systems to ensure plastic waste is processed efficiently. Another way to tackle this problem is by increasing public awareness. Many people continue to rely on plastic because they are unaware of its long-term consequences. Educational programmes in schools and public campaigns can teach citizens how to reduce, reuse and recycle plastic products. When people understand their role in environmental protection, they are more likely to change their habits . In addition, businesses should be encouraged to take responsibility for their environmental impact. Companies can reduce plastic waste by using biodegradable packaging and offering reusable alternatives. Not only does this reduce pollution, but it also improves their public image and customer trust. In conclusion, plastic waste can be reduced by combining strict government regulations, public education and corporate responsibility. If all sectors of society work together, this global problem can be effectively controlled.
Word count: 247

üéÑ Farida25/12/2025, 04:37:39
More and more countries have a problem with plastic waste. How can this problem be solved? In resent years,plastic waste has become a groving environmental concern in many countries. There are a number of practical measures that government and individuals can take to address this issue. One effective way to tackle the issue would be introduce striced regulations on plastic use. This can be achived by banning single-use plastics such as bags and straws. In addition, by imposing higher taxes on plastic products, government can discourage their excessive consumption. As a result, overall amount of plastic waste would be significantly reduced, and people would be more likely to use eco-friendly alternatives such as reusable bags and containers. In addition, individuals and businesses play a crucial role in reducing plastic waste. If people actively participate in recycling programs,waste can be managed more effectively. This means separating rubbish according to its recycling value, such as plastic paper glass. This method is widely used in many countries, including Korea, where recycling systems are well-organised and efficient.Furthermore, businesses can contribute by using sustainable packing materials and recycling unnecessary plastic wrapping. In conclusion,although plastic waste is a serious global problem,it can be effectively solved through a combination of government regulations and individuals responsibility. By limiting plastic use and encouraging recycling, countries can significantly reduce plastic pollution and protect the environment.

Rubric: More and more countries have a problem with plastic waste. How can this problem be solved? Essay: There is a growing concern about plastic waste in many countries. Despite the seriousness of the problem involved, a combination of policy intervention and public awareness can help to address this issue effectively. One possible solution could be public awareness. Many individuals are continuing to use plastic products as they may be unaware about its causes such as ocean pollution and harm to wildlife. Governments could organize educational programmes and social media campaigns to explain these dangers clearly. When people understand that their daily choices directly affect the environment, they are more likely to change their behavior voluntarily rather than relying on laws. Schools, for instance, could include environmental education in order to teach students how to reduce plastic waste. Therefore, it is important to aware people about the harmful effects of plastic which they use in their daily life. Another efficient way to address this problem would be recycling. Authorities should invest in modern recycling plants in order to reduce plastic waste. The main advantage of this is financial benefits. When old plastic is recycled into new, it could be reused reducing the demand for production of new products. Moreover, governments could encourage people to collect plastic by giving bonuses such as money. By doing this, they could reduce expenses without hiring anyone to collect it. Thus, investment in recycling industries could be beneficial for both the environment and individuals. To sum up, there are sensible and well-designed solutions such as public awareness and government funding for recycling plants which have the potential to improve conditions considerably.

Rubric:More and more countries have a problem with plastic waste. How can this problem be solved? In recent years, plastic waste has become a serious environmental issue in many countries, affecting both natural ecosystems and human health. Although this problem is complex, several possible solutions exist which can significantly reduce its impact. This essay will discuss two effective measures and explain how they can be implemented. One effective way to tackle the issue would be to develop the recycling industry. This solution can be implemented by the government offering tax incentives and financial support to recycling companies. Moreover, authorities should encourage people to contribute to the process by separating waste at home. If cooperation is achieved, better results will be seen soon. As a result, less plastic will be sent to landfills, which will help to protect the environment. Another effective approach would be raising public awareness. This can be done by governments and advertising agencies through educational programs, social media campaigns and school projects. When people understand the dangers of plastic pollution, they are more likely to reduce plastic usage and choose eco-friendly products. This will eventually lead to both governments and businesses becoming more environmentally responsible, as the public will be more involved in these projects. However, the most effective solution is introducing strict laws on plastic production and consumption. Single-use plastic products should be banned, and companies must be required to use recyclable materials. Despite the fact that such regulations may initially face resistance, in the long term they will lead to a cleaner environment and a more sustainable economy. In conclusion, plastic waste is a global problem that requires immediate action. While developing recycling systems and raising awareness are helpful, the best results will be achieved if strict regulations are enforced. If these solutions are applied together, this serious environmental threat can be significantly reduced.

üéÑ Sevinch Turopova23/12/2025, 05:25:37
Essay In many countries, teachers and parents are increasingly concerned that children struggle to concentrate and maintain attention at school. This problem arises from several modern influences, but it can be addressed through coordinated efforts by families and educational institutions. One of the main reasons for poor concentration among children is excessive exposure to digital devices. Smartphones, tablets, and video games provide constant stimulation, which makes traditional classroom activities seem dull in comparison. As a result, children become easily distracted and lose the ability to focus for extended periods. Another contributing factor is a lack of sufficient sleep, often caused by late-night screen use or heavy academic pressure, which negatively affects children‚Äôs cognitive performance during lessons. To tackle this issue, parents and schools must work together. Parents should set clear limits on screen time and encourage healthy routines, such as regular sleep schedules and physical activity. Reading and creative hobbies can also help children develop longer attention spans. At the same time, schools can adopt more engaging teaching methods, including interactive lessons and group activities, which help maintain students‚Äô interest and motivation. Providing short breaks during lessons may further improve concentration levels. In conclusion, children‚Äôs difficulty in focusing at school is largely caused by digital distractions and unhealthy lifestyles. However, by promoting balanced habits at home and creating stimulating learning environments at school, this problem can be effectively reduced.

Children find it difficult to concentrate on or pay attention to school. What are the reasons ? How can we solve this problem? Nowaday‚Äôs, teenagers seem to constantly have trouble staying focused, which can led to several pressing concerns in school and in their everyday life. Despite the seriousness of the problem involved, a combination balanced home works and temporary limitation from media platforms can address them effectively. To begin with, there are numerous setbacks created by this trend. One of the most serious problem encounter pupils is the poor quality of rest. Many students feel the pressure from both their parents and teachers to perform academically and socially which might be overwhelming at times. Therefore, most of students in order to accomplish their assignments or household chores they are restrict from taking a sleep. As a result, if a pupil is not getting their recommended 8 hours of sleep, they are prone to feel lethargic, needing sufficient energy to focus in class. Moreover, this type of lifestyle could have endless medical impacts such as anxiety, depression, bipolar disorder, insomnia, etc. Another substantial issue is addiction to social media, which is more entertaining than average classes. Children‚Äôs brain mostly want social connection, excitement and devices play into those desires. From time to time checking a notification can provide a small hit of dopamine, creating a sense of coming back for more. As a result, more they give in to temptation by pausing a task to check up the phone, the less productivity they would be. Although there are several negative consequence associated with concentration in educational institutions, there are some steps to address this situation. First and foremost, teachers and parents should set a reasonable tasks and expectations and provide support, otherwise, they may burnt out and mentally exhausted which is lead to being unable to focus, performing worst academic results. Another the second solution is restriction of using mobile phones during the lessons. By limiting using of smartphones, not only do students perform actively at classes but it also effects on academic performance positively. In conclusion, I would like to state that although with so many distractions its really hard to pay attention all time the time, it can be alleviated with the support from teachers and parents by limit smartphone usage and giving reasonable quantity of schoolwork

üîπ Task Response ‚Äî Band 6.5‚Äì7.0

Strengths:

Examples and explanations included: dopamine effect, mental health issues, and consequences of overwork.

Conclusion summarizes the main idea and reiterates solutions.

Weaknesses:

Some ideas are repetitive or unclear:

‚Äúmore they give in to temptation by pausing a task to check up the phone, the less productivity they would be‚Äù ‚Üí awkward phrasing.

Some sentences could be split to improve clarity.

Could discuss more solutions beyond phones and workload to improve task response: e.g., sleep routines, classroom strategies, parental guidance.

Some arguments are slightly exaggerated without support: ‚Äúendless medical impacts‚Äù ‚Üí could be phrased more academically: ‚Äúpotential mental health impacts.‚Äù

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5‚Äì7.0

Paragraphing is generally appropriate.

Weaknesses:

‚Äúwhich is lead to being unable to focus‚Äù ‚Üí awkward, breaks cohesion.

Minor punctuation issues: missing commas in complex sentences.

üéÑ Vladimir22/12/2025, 07:19:55
Children find it difficult to concentrate on or pay attention to school. What are the reasons? How can we solve this problem? In many countries, teachers and parents increasingly report that children have difficulties in concentrating and maintaining attention at school. This issue has several causes, including technological distractions and changed educational and lifestyle factors. However, with suitable measures, children‚Äôs focus and learning achievements can be improved. One main reason for deconcentration among children is the overuse of digital devices. Smartphones, tablets, and video games offer stable entertainment, which can make it harder for children to focus on activities such as classroom lessons. Consequently, many students become easily distracted or lose interest during classes. Another contributing factor is the teaching approach. In some schools, lessons are too theoretical, repetitive, or not deal successful with different learning styles, which reduces students motivation and attention. Moreover, a lack of sleep and unhealthy daily routines also play a significant role. Long screen time often leads to poor sleep patterns, which negatively affects childrens ability to concentrate and study well at school. To tackle this problem, several solutions can be considered. Firstly, parents should control the amount of time children spend using digital devices by setting clear limits and encouraging other activities such as reading, sports, or creative hobbies. These alternatives can help children develop better concentration skills. Secondly, schools should use more interactive teaching methods. For example, group work, practical tasks, and visual materials can make lessons more interesting and help students stay focused. In addition, promoting healthy lifestyles is essential. Ensuring enough sleep, eat balanced meals, and follow regular routines can greatly improve their attention and academic results. In conclusion, lack of concentration at school is mainly caused by excessive use of technology, ineffective teaching methods, and unhealthy lifestyles. By combining parental control, improved educational methods, and healthier daily habits, this issue can be reduced, leading to better focus and improved learning outcomes.

In conclusion, although this issue poses several serious challenges, a set of practical measures can significantly reduce its impact if applied consistently. Essay: Recently, children‚Äôs lack of concentration at school has become a widespread issue. While this can be attributed to a number of factors, I believe that this problem can be tackled in a number of ways. One significant factor contributing to this issue is excessive use of technology. Many children overuse digital devices by playing games or scrolling through social media. As a result, they develop a short attention span, which makes classroom lessons seem long and monotonous for them. Another cause behind this problem is an overloaded school programme. Many teachers give too much homework, forcing school children to stay up late doing homework. Since they did not get enough sleep, they cannot focus on lesson. Parents must control their children by checking how much did their children spend using phone, especially before bedtime. Reducing screen time helps to improve sleep quality and develop better focus. Another effective measure would be restricting amount of homework. Schools ought to control amount of homework given by teachers and focus on quality rather than quantity. Reinforcing learning without overwhelming students would give them to get adequate sleep. In addition, regular physical activity such as running, helps to improve concentration during school lessons. To sum up, while there are several reasons why children lose their focus during lessons, sensible and well-developed solutions including monitoring children‚Äôs activity and reducing amout of homework, have the potential to improve conditions considerably.

Hi
üéÑ Turapova Sevinch20/12/2025, 04:27:54
In many developed countries, people are living longer than ever before. While this trend reflects improvements in healthcare and living standards, it also creates a range of problems for both individuals and society. However, there are several measures that can help reduce the negative impact of ageing populations. One major problem for individuals is declining health in old age. Elderly people are more likely to suffer from chronic illnesses, which can reduce their quality of life and increase dependence on family members or caregivers. From a societal perspective, an ageing population puts pressure on healthcare systems and pension schemes. As the number of retirees grows and the working population shrinks, governments may struggle to fund public services and social welfare programs Another significant issue is a potential shortage of workers. With fewer young people entering the workforce, productivity may decline, slowing economic growth. This situation can lead to higher taxes on working-age citizens, which may cause financial stress and social dissatisfaction To address these challenges, governments can take several effective measures. One solution is to gradually raise the retirement age, allowing healthy older adults to remain economically active for longer. Additionally, investing in preventive healthcare can help reduce medical costs by keeping elderly people healthier. Encouraging higher birth rates through family-friendly policies and accepting skilled immigrants are also practical ways to balance the population structure . In conclusion, although increasing life expectancy brings serious challenges, these problems can be managed through thoughtful planning and long-term policies. With appropriate measures, societies can support older generations without harming economic stability.

There is growing concern about the fact that average life expectancy is rising in many developed countries. Recently, population ageing has become a widespread issue, and this trend has led to several problems that affect both individuals and society as a whole. Even though this issue presents several major challenges, I believe that these problems can be tackled in a number of ways. There are several problems associated with this trend. One major problem of an ageing population is that many elderly people suffer from poor health and long-term illnesses. As people grow older, they often require continuous medical care, which can reduce their independence and quality of life. A significant issue related to this is loneliness, as retired individuals may have fewer social interactions, leading to mental health problems such as stress and depression. Another concern is that the rate of pressure on healthcare and pension systems is increasing, which places a heavy financial burden on governments and working-age citizens. There are a number of ways to mitigate these problems. One possible solution could be to gradually increase the retirement age, allowing older people to remain economically active for longer. This would reduce the pressure on pension systems and help maintain a stable workforce. Another effective measure would be to invest more in healthcare services and preventive care, so that elderly people can stay healthier and independent for a longer period of time. In addition, governments can raise public awareness about healthy lifestyles, which may reduce healthcare costs in the long term. In conclusion, although this issue poses several serious challenges, a set of practical measures can significantly reduce its impact if applied consistently for a long time. To sum up, while the situation has led to a number of difficulties, sensible and well-designed solutions have the potential to improve conditions considerably.

Rubric: In the developed world, average life expectancy is increasing. What problems will this cause for individuals and society? Suggest some measures that could be taken to reduce the impact of ageing populations. Essay: Recently, longer lifespan has become a widespread issue. Although the problem manifests in more than one way, each aspect can be addressed through a measure that targets its specific consequences. One major problem of this trend is pension pressure. Since there may be more elderly people due to longer life, governments would be forced to pay pensions which will lead to economical problems and financial pressure. In japan, for instance, the workspace is shrinking because japan is a country with one of the highest life expectancies in the world. To solve this problem, authorities should raise retirement age. Keeping older people in work longer, helps to maintain the workspace and support pension system. Thus, increasement in life expectancy could have major effects on economics Another concern related to this issue is healthcare overload. When people live longer, there would be an increase in chronic and age-related diseases such as dementia. These problems would cause healthcare systems to be overstretched. As a result, many individuals such as youngsters could not get treatment in hospitals. The most efficient way to address this problem is investment in preventive healthcare, such as regular medical check-ups, vaccination programmes, and health education, to reduce the number of chronic diseases among older people. Therefore, longer life could have many impacts on healthcare which can be tackled by authorities. To sum up, while the situation has led to a number of difficulties such as economic pressure and healthcare overload, sensible and well-designed solutions have the potential to improve conditions considerably.

üéÅ
ü©µü©µü©µüíòüíò
üéÑ –í–ª–∞–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä20/12/2025, 01:44:49
In many developed countries, people are living longer than ever before due to improvements in medicine and living standards. While this is a positive sign, increasing life expectancy also creates a number of problems for both individuals and society. However, there are several measures that governments and citizens can take to reduce the negative impact of ageing populations. For individuals, longer life expectancy often brings health-related challenges. As people getting older, they are more likely to suffer from chronic illnesses such as heart disease, diabetes, or dementia, which can reduce quality of life and independence. Many elderly people also face loneliness and social isolation, particularly if they lost their partners or family members. Financial insecurity is another concern, as savings and pensions may not be enough to support a longer period after retirement. From societal perspective, ageing populations make significant pressure on healthcare systems and public finances. Governments must spend more on pensions, healthcare, and social services, while the proportion of working-age people paying taxes decreases. This imbalance can slow economic growth and create labour issues in key sectors. In addition, younger generations may face a heavier tax level to support the growing elderly population, potentially leading to intergenerational tensions. To salve these challenges, several measures can be introduced. Raising the retirement age is one effective solution, as it allows healthy older adults to remain in the workforce and continue maintain the economy by their taxes. Governments can also promote healthy lifestyles to reduce medical expenses for old people. Encouraging flexible work time can help older people stay socially engaged and economically active. In conclusion, although increasing life expectancy creates serious challenges, policies and social decisions can reduce its negative effects and allow societies to take benefits from aged people.
Word count: 290

üéÑ muhammad19/12/2025, 12:03:52
People who live in large cities face a range of problems in their daily life. What are the main problems people in cities face, and how can these problems be tackled? Nowadays, thousands of citizen‚Äôs lifestyles in metropolitan areas are becoming a widespread issue due to some obstacles. This trend has led to several pressing concerns for their life. Despite the seriousness of the problem involved, a combination traffic restriction and cutting prices down of properties can address them effectively. To begin with, there are numerous troubles created by this trend in any heart of the city. One of the most serious problem encounter urban citizens is the heavy traffic congestion. Many families opt for driving vehicles instead of commute by public transport or on bike due to convenience and extortionate cost of public transport, accordingly, it can serious impact on rising traffic jams. Moreover, as millions of vehicles are running on fuel, which have harmful impact not only on environment but also could lead to respiratory illness among people. Another substantial issue is high property prices in most of developing cities. In many towns, for instance, renting a small apartment for average employee is too costly. As a result, majority of families force them to live in suburban areas, where living costs are far more reasonable. Although there are several setbacks associated with lifestyle in city, there are some steps the government need to take in order to address this situation. First and foremost, authorities should build affordable houses for citizens. These accommodations would create financial support for whom someone cannot afford to purchase property. Another the second solution is restriction traffic. The government should totally restrict utilizing fuel engine vehicles to reduce air pollution and number of vehicles on the road. By cutting down traffic levels, we can decrease air pollution. In conclusion, I would like to state that although most of residents face with a few difficulties, such as traffic jams and unaffordable housing , it can be alleviated with the support of the government by building reasonable houses and introduce vehicle limitation.

The rising life expectancy in developed countries has led to various problems for both individuals and society.even though this issue presents several major challenges ,I believe that these problems can be tackled in number of ways. There are several problems associated with this trend.One significant issue faced by individuals is the deterioration of health. As people live longer, they are more likely to suffer from chronic illnesses such as heart disease, diabetes, or arthritis, which can reduce their quality of life and increase dependency on others.Another significant issue for society is the shortage of skilled workers. As the population ages a larger proportion of people retire leaving fewer individuals in the workforce. This can lead to reduced economic productuvity and place a heavier burden on the younger generation to support social services. There are a number of ways to migitate these problems.One possible solution to reduce the impact of ageing populations is to improve healthcare services. Governments can invest in hospitals, medical staff, and preventive care programs. This will help older people stay healthier for longer, which reduces their dependency on others and lowers the cost of treatment. Additionally, raising the retirement age can allow elderly individuals to continue working, which will help solve the problem of labour shortages. These measures are practical and can benefit both individuals and society. In conclusion although this issue poses several serious challenges a set of practical measures can significantly reduce its impact if applied consistently

Rubric: In the development world, average life expectancy is increasing. What problems wil this cause for individuals and sociaty? Suggest some messures that could be taken to reduce the impact of ageing popullations. Essay: In many developed countries, average life expantancy is increasing, and this trend has become a major social issue. Although living longer is genarally considered apositive development, it has led to severakl serious problems foir both individuals and society. Nvertheless, there are effective and practical measure that can be implemented to lessen the impact of ageing popullations. One signaficant problem caused by rising life expectancy is the growing strain on healthcare systems. Older people are more likely to suffer from chronic and age-related ilnesses, which require long-term treatment and constant medical support. As a result, governments face rising heathcare cost, whileelderly individuals may experience reduced quality of life due to ongoing health problems. Another major challenge is the decline in the working-age popullation. As more people retire, fewer workers are available to support economic productuvity, which can lead to slower economic growth and increased pressure on pension systems. Despite the seriousness of these issues, a number of effective solutions canbe adobted. One possible measure is to gradually raise the retirement age and ecourage flexibile employment for oloder workers. This approach would allow experienced indivudials to remain economically active and reduce the financial burden an the younger popullation. Another practical solution would be to invest in preventive healthier lifestyles and early medical intervention, governments can reduse the long-term costs of treating age-related diseases. In conclution, although increasing life expectancy presents several pressing concerns, particularry in terms of healthcare and economic sustainability, these problems can be adressed through well-designed policies. By extending working lives and strenthening preventive healthcare systems, societies can successfully manage the challenges associated with ageing populations.

üéÑ Turapova Sevinch18/12/2025, 05:11:58
Many urban citizens are affected by several issues in their daily lives. Although living in large cities presents major challenges, I believe that these problems can be tackled in a number of effective ways. One of the key issues faced by city residents is health problems caused by air pollution. In big cities, emissions from factories and vehicles significantly reduce air quality, which can lead to respiratory diseases and long-term health conditions. As a result, urban dwellers are more vulnerable to illnesses compared to those living in rural areas Another serious concern is traffic congestion, which is caused by the overwhelming number of vehicles on the roads. Heavy traffic not only wastes time but also increases stress levels and contributes further to air pollution. This problem has become especially severe during peak hours in major metropolitan areas There are several ways to alleviate these problems, one of which is improving the public transport system. For example, China has invested heavily in high-speed and efficient train networks, which allow people to travel quickly and comfortably without relying on private cars. This approach helps reduce congestion and pollution at the same time Another effective measure would be reducing the number of motor cars by encouraging people to use public transport, bicycles, or walk for short distances. Governments can also introduce higher taxes on private vehicles and provide incentives for eco-friendly transportation. These steps would significantly improve both traffic flow and public health.
In conclusion,the problems caused by this trend are significant,but there are realistic steps that can be taken to address them, including improving traffic system and reducing motor cars.

Rubric: people who live in large cities face a range of problems people in cities face, and how can these problems be tackled? Many people are affected by many urban challenges in their everyday life. Even though this issue presents several major challenges, I believe that these problems can be tackled in a number of ways. One major problem of this trend could be health problems of urban residents. Bad health conditions are mainly caused by air pollution which frequently causes several respiratory diseases such as asthma and bronchitis soaring. Poor air quality might be the result of cars emitting harmful gases into the air and factories. Another concern is traffic congestions. For many urban citizens daily commute to work may be the main source of stress and frustration as they often are late to work. Traffic jams, for instance, might cancel or delay important meetings. The most efficient way to address this problem is to reduce the number of cars which emit exhaust fumes. Authorities should encourage people to replace their cars with eco-friendly ones by giving them bonuses for buying electric cars such as paying half of the prices or giving discounts. Another effective measure would be to balance road use and demand. In order to reduce traffic jams, governments ought to boost public transport by replacing it and reducing the time by increasing amount of buses and subways. Therefore, these issues could be solved by mentioned reasons. To sum up, while the situation has led to a number of difficulties such as health issues and traffic congestions, sensible and well-designed solutions, including reduce cars which produce toxic gases and increase public transport, have the potential to improve conditions considerably.

People who live in large cities face a range of problems in their daily life. What are the main problems people in cities face, and how can these problems be tackled? Many people are affected by living in large urban areas. This trend has led to several problems including traffic congestion and air pollution. Even though this issue presents several major challenges, I believe that these problems can be tackled in a number of ways. There are several problems associated with this trend. One major problem for city residence is overcrowded roads. Due to the fact that most people commute to work by private cars, it becomes usual to experience rush hour on regular basis. This leads to more stressed and irritable people because even after a long day at work, they have to wait in traffic jams. Another significant issue is the harmful emissions in the air, which lead to several health problems. These problems includes respiratory and cardiovascular illnesses, which has a real effect on the way we think and for overal well being. There are number of ways to mitigate these problems. One possible solution could be improving public transport because people will start using them more willingly. If people start use buses and undergrounds more it could really help reduce traffic on the roads. Another effective measure would be to introduce rules, which will include no more than one car per person or encouragement to ride a bicycle. All these things will help decrease amount of toxic gases which conscious by vehicles. In conclusion, although this issue poses several serious challenges, a set of practical measures can significantly reduce its impact if applied consistently. By improving quality of public transport and introducing new rules, which will really help to improve the quality of life for city residents.

People living in large cities often face various difficulties in their everyday lives. These problems are mainly related to transport, pollution, and stress. However, this trend has created several pressing difficulties, there are practical steps that governments and individuals  can take to lessen its impact.  There are several issues associated with this trend, and one of the main problems in big cities is traffic congestion. Many people rely on private cars, which causes long traffic jams, especially during rush hours. As a result, commuters waste a lot of time traveling to work, which increases stress and reduces productivity. This problem can be tackled by improving public transport systems and encouraging people to use buses, trains, and bicycles instead of cars. Another concern is environmental pollution. Large cities produce a high level of air and noise pollution due to factories, vehicles, and construction work. This has a negative effect on people‚Äôs health, leading to respiratory diseases and sleep problems. The most efficient way to address this problem is for governments to introduce stricter environmental laws and promote the use of renewable energy sources. In conclusion, traffic, pollution, and stress are major problems faced by city residents. With better urban planning and effective government policies, these challenges can be reduced. Furthermore, city life is often stressful. Fast-paced lifestyles and competitive working environments can cause mental health problems. One way to deal with this is by creating more green spaces, such as parks, where people can relax and escape from daily pressure.

People who live in large cities face a range of problems in their daily life What are the main problems people in cities face, and how can these problems be tackled? People who live in big cities face different issues every day. While cities provide more facilities, they also create challenges for residents. There are two clear drawbacks linked to this issue , but both can be reduced by applying solutions that directly relate to their causes. Urban population continue to grow rapidly , these issues are becoming more urgent. One significant issue related to this is traffic congestion. Many people travel to work or school at the same time, which cause crowded roads and long delays. This situation increases stress and waste a lot of time. In addition, air pollution caused by cars and can lead to serious health problems, especially for children and the elderly. One possible solution could be improve public transports such as buses and trains. If public transport is faster, cleaner and cheaper, more people will use it and it will reduce traffic on roads. Encouraging flexible working hours could also help reduce vehicles during rush hours. Another concern is that large cities are high living costs. Housing, food and transportation are very expensive and many people struggle to efford this needs. This can lead to financial stress and lower quality of life. As a result, some residents are living far from city centers or overcrowded places. The most effective way to address this problem is build affordable houses. Governments should build more affordable housing and control prices. Providing support for low-income families can help people live more comfortably in cities. In conclusion, the problems caused by this trend are significant, but there are realistic steps that can be taken to address them including traffic congestion and high living costs. With better planning and government action these problems can be reduced, making city life easier and more enjoyable

üéÑ –í–ª–∞–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä17/12/2025, 16:50:11
People who live in large cities often face various problems in their daily lives. Among the most significant issues are traffic congestion, pollution, and the high cost of living. However, these problems can be addressed through effective planning and government intervention. One major problem in big cities is traffic congestion. The increasing number of private vehicles leads to long commuting times and stress for residents. This issue can be tackled by improving public transportation systems, such as expanding metro lines and bus networks, and encouraging people to use them instead of private cars. In addition, promoting cycling can help reduce traffic on the roads. Another serious problem is environmental pollution. Air and noise pollution caused by vehicles and industrial activities negatively affect people`s health. Governments can reduce pollution by enforcing stricter environmental regulations, investing in green energy, and creating more green spaces such as parks. These measures not only improve air quality but also enhance the overall quality of life in cities. Lastly, the high cost of living in large cities makes it difficult for many people to afford housing and basic necessities. To tackle this problem, authorities can build more affordable housing and control rental prices. Providing financial support or subsidies for low-income residents can also help ease the burden. In conclusion, although city life presents challenges such as traffic, pollution, and high living costs, these problems can be effectively managed through better urban planning, improved public services, and strong government policies.

Rubric: People who live in large cities face a range of problems in their daily life.What are the main problems people in cities face, and how can these problems be tackled? Essay: Recently, living in large cities has become a widespread issue. Many people are affected by several problems in their daily lives due to rapid urban growth. Although city life offers better job opportunities, it also creates serious difficulties that need practical solutions. One major problem people face in large cities is traffic congestion. Because of the large number of vehicles on the roads, people often waste a lot of time in traffic jams. This situation causes stress and tiredness and also increases air pollution. One possible solution to this problem is to improve public transportation. Governments should invest in buses and metro systems so that people can travel more easily without using private cars. In addition, encouraging people to use bicycles or public transport can help reduce traffic problems. Another significant issue in big cities is the high cost of living, especially housing. Many residents struggle to pay rent because prices are very high. As a result, some people are forced to live in small or overcrowded homes. An effective way to tackle this issue is for governments to provide more affordable housing. Building low-cost apartments and offering financial support to low-income families could help solve this problem. Moreover, developing residential areas outside city centres may reduce housing pressure. In conclusion, although people living in large cities face serious problems such as traffic congestion and high living costs, these issues can be reduced through practical measures. Improving public transport and increasing affordable housing can significantly improve urban life if applied properly.

Wild animals have no place in the 21st century, so protecting them is a waste of resources. To what extent do you agree or agree? Nowadays, it is commonly believed that fauna does not play a role in this century, and many of amateurs find it is squandering of resources. I completely disagree with the view that, wildlife have no place in modern world. In my opinion, wild animals maintain key role in ecosystem and play a crucial role for gaining knowledge. One major reason why wildlife play a vital role in twenty first century is that wild animals maintain the balance of nature. All sort of animals play a key role in nature, contributing to biodiversity. If one type of animal disappear, it may affect harmfully on food chain and effect to the nature can be irreversible, so protecting them not just a moral choice but also necessity for keep our system is balanced. Furthermore, more and more wild animals are becoming on the brink of extinction, that actually the most significant question in the world. Rare species of animals play a crucial ecological role, so protecting and preserving them is the first step toward long-term environmental protection. In addition, to major role feral animals in nature, they are important for students and children for obtaining knowledge about wildlife. Exploring wild animals such as in zoos or even in wild nature providing the easy way to find out about their conservation, habitat, and about animal. Moreover, visiting zoos or safari parks can be much more enjoyable for children, which offer them unforgettable experience with wildlife. In conclusion, even though some individuals argue that wildlife does not mean anything and preserve them is wasting of resources, I strongly disagree. Wild animals help keep ecosystem balanced and have a key role in education and entertainment purposes. Therefore, nowadays-wild animals have a crucial place.

üéÅ
üéÑ sevinch16/12/2025, 04:40:30
Rubric: Wild animals have no place in the 21st century, so protecting them is a waste of resources. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Some people argue that wild animals are no longer relevant in the modern world and that spending money on their protection is unnecessary. However, I strongly disagree with this view, as wildlife plays a vital role in maintaining ecological balance and provides long-term benefits for humanity. Firstly, wild animals are an essential part of natural ecosystems, and their disappearance can lead to serious environmental consequences. Many species help regulate food chains, pollinate plants, and maintain biodiversity. If these animals become extinct, ecosystems may collapse, which can result in climate instability, food shortages and the spread of diseases. Therefore, investing resources in wildlife protection is not a waste but a preventative measure to protect the planet. Secondly, protecting wild animals also brings economic and educational advantages. Wildlife conservation supports industries such as eco-tourism, which creates jobs and generates income for local communities. In addition, animals provide valuable opportunities for scientific research and help future generations understand the importance of environmental responsibility. These benefits clearly outweigh the costs of conservation programs. In conclusion, although modern society faces many urgent challenges, protecting wild animals should remain a priority. Wildlife conservation safeguards ecosystems, supports economies, and ensures a sustainable future. For these reasons, I completely disagree with the idea that protecting wild animals is a waste of resources.

In the 21st century, many wild animals are struggling to survive because of insufficient natural space, and it is commonly believed that protecting them is a type of wasting resources. I completely disagree with the claim that they should not be protected.  A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that the factories are destroying the natural habitats, and the animals pay for it. Many companies are expanding and logging. Deforestation, for example, is cutting down the trees to build new furniture, and they cause deforestation. Unfortunately, rapid urbanisation and intensive agriculture leave animals with shrinking habitat. As a result, people's egoism leads to the extinction of wild animals.  Another factor that challenges this claim is that some people argue that these animals should not be protected, especially when society faces serious issues such as poverty, healthcare, and education. However, I strongly disagree with this view. Wild animals are a vital part of the ecosystem, and their disappearance can cause serious environmental imbalance. For example, predators control the population level, while insects and birds contribute to biodiversity.  In conclusion, I can not agree with this idea that protecting wild animals is wasting resources. On the contrary, it is essential for ecosystems and ensuring a sustainable future for both people and nature.

Wild animals have no place in the 21st century, so protecting them is a waste of resources. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Many people argue that wild animals are no longer important and protecting them waste valuable resources. I firmly reject the idea that wild animals should be neglected because they are essential for environment and provide many benefits to humans. A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that wild animals play an important role in the environment. Every species whether big or small, has a special role in the ecosystem. For instance, predators control the population of other animals while insects and birds help with pollination. If wild animals dissapear, natural world may collapse and leading to serous problems such as food shortages and environmental damage. Therefore, protecting wildlife is not a waste but a necessary investment. Another factor that challenges this claim is that wild animals are valuable to humans in many ways. Many medicines are developed from plants and animals found in the wild. In addition, wildlife attract tourists, which creates jobs and brings income to local communities. National parks also offer educational opportunities and help people understand the importance of nature. Without wild animals, these benefits may be lost. In addition, humans have big responsibilities to protect wild animals. Deforestation , pollution and climate change are caused by human activities. It would be unfair to allow animals to become ixtinct because of our actions. Protecting animals shows respect for life. In conclusion, I cannot agree with the idea that wild animals have no role in the modern world. Protecting them is essential for humans and environment.

üéÑ Abdullokh16/12/2025, 02:00:59
Some people believe that wild animals have no place in todays world and that spending resources on their protection is a waste. However, this essay disagrees with this opinion, arguing that wild animals are essential for preserving ecosystems and ensuring environmental sustainability A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that wild animals play a crucial role in maintaining ecological balance. Many species help control population levels, support food chains, and contribute to natural processes such as pollination and seed dispersal. If wild animals were not protected ecosystems could become unstable, leading to serious environmental problems such as species extienction and habitat degradation. Therefore, protecting wildlife is not a waste of resources but a necessary investment in the health of the planet. Another important reason to protect wild animals is that humans benefit directly and indirectly from biodiversity. Many medical discoveries are based on compounds found in animals and plants living in the wild. In addition, wildlife tourism creates jobs and generates income for local communities, especially in developing countries. If animals disappear due to a lack of protection future generations may lose valuable resources and economic opportunities. As a result, investing in wildlife conservation brings long-term benefits to society rather than wasting resources. In conclusion, although some people argue that wild animals have no place in the modern world, this essay strongly disagrees with this view. Wild animals are essential for maintaining ecosystems supporting human well-being, and ensuring environmental sustainability.

Wild animals have no place in the 21st century, so protecting them is a waste of resources. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Some people hold the view that ensure the survival of wild animals is a poor use of resources in todays world. I entirely disagree because humans are responsible for its wildlife loss and they also play a key role in our ecosystem and eco-tourism as well. A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that most species are threatened. Because of human activities such as deforestation, pollution, and illegal hunting. All these activities lead to species lose their habitats and many of rare animals disappear which is lead to catastrophes. Since humans cause this problems, we have moral responsibility to protect them. Ignoring wildlife protection would mean avoiding responsibility for environmental damage that we cause. Another factor that challenges this claim is that wild animals play crucial role in maintaining ecological balance. Many of this animals pollinate plants and support food chains, which helps maintain species balance. If animals disappear, ecosystems collapse, which can harm agriculture, climate stability, and human survival because we will lose our food sources. Protecting wildlife is therefore an investment for us, not a waste. A further point supporting this disagreement is that protecting wildlife contributes to economic growth through eco-tourism. Kenya and Australia for example attract most of their tourists using safaris and national parks. Government programs there aim to conserve biodiversity and ecosystem which also helps boost their economy. In conclusion, I can not agree with the idea that protecting animals is inefficient use of resources. Due to our responsibility to take care of wildlife and their help to our ecosystem and countries to attract tourists.

Essay: Some people hold the view that wild species are no longer relevent in modern society and wildlife protection is an unnecessary investment.I completly disagree with the claim that a wildlife plays a vital role in sustaining ecosystems and provides signaficant benifits to humans. A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that wild animals are key to the survival of natural environments. Every species contributes to balance of ecosystems, whether by regulating population number or maintaining food chains. If wildlife were disappear, nature would become unstable, causing serious environmental concequences. For instance, the lost of predators can lead to an increase in herbivore populations, which may damage forest and farmland. üéÑ –í–ª–∞–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä15/12/2025, 06:38:46
Some people argue that wild animals have no place in the modern world and spending money to protect them is unnecessary. I disagree with this opinion because wild animals are important for the environment and continue to bring many benefits to human society. Firstly, wild animals play essential role in maintaining the balance of nature. Every species has a purpose, such as controlling the population of other animals, spreading seeds, or helping plants grow. When animals disappear, ecosystems can become unstable, which may lead to serious problems like climate change, soil damage, and food shortages. These environmental problems can directly affect human life. Therefore, protecting wild animals should be seen as an investment in a healthy planet rather than a waste of resources. Secondly, wild animals provide economic and educational benefits. Wildlife tourism, including safaris, national parks, attracts millions of visitors each year. This creates jobs and provides income for local communities, especially in developing countries. In addition, wild animals are important for scientific research and education. Scientists study animals to better understand nature and to develop new medicines and technologies. It is true that as cities expand and land is used for farming or factories, animals have fewer places to live. However, this does not mean that wild animals have no place in the 21st century. Instead, it shows that humans must take responsibility to protect the environment. With proper planning, it is possible to balance economic growth and wildlife conservation. In conclusion, I strongly disagree with the idea that protecting wild animals is a waste of resources. Wild animals remain an important part of the natural world, and protecting them benefits both the environment and human society.

üéÑ Muhammad14/12/2025, 10:57:32
Learning at university would be more effective if women and men were taught separately. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion

It is commonly believed that studying at educational institutions could be far efficacious if male and female were educated independently. I entirely disagree with this view due to social opportunities and reducing gender inequality.

A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that students may gain significant benefits, if they are educated in a coeducational format. Most students may exposed to opposite gender in social aspects. Mixed-gender education might develop their communication skills especially in teamwork which helps both male and female collaborate confidently in mixed professional environments after graduation. These sort of  collaborative tasks are beneficial in educational process that reflects real workplace conditions, broadening their viewpoints,as either of gender can have various perspectives. It is quite clear, due to gender‚Äôs difference , individuals may have various mindset and eventually this can lead to diverse viewpoints. As a result, understanding both side‚Äôs opinion will enhance respect and promote critical thinking in complex cases.

Another factor that challenges this claim is that mixed-gender classes help diminish gender inequality. Educating men and women together promotes equal condition for participation. In mixed classrooms, students are evaluated based on their abilities rather than their gender, which creates a fairer learning environment. In contrast, gender-segregated education may reinforce outdated social norms and limit opportunities for cooperation, especially in traditionally male-dominated fields.


In conclusion, I strongly disagree with this claim that gender-segregated education would be more beneficial for university education. Co-educational universities not only enhance social aspects but also play a crucial role in reducing gender instability.

üéÑ AKRAMJONOV MUSLIMBEK opinion wild animals14/12/2025, 10:02:51
Rubric: wild animals have no place in 21st century, so protecting them is a waste of resources. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Essay: There is a growing belief that conservation of wild animals is misuse of resources in today‚Äôs world. This essay argues that this view is misguided due to financial and medical benefits of wild animals. A major reason why this claim is unconvincing is that wild animals might have economic benefits. When wildlife is protected, many zoos and safari parks could expand attracting visitors and creating jobs for local residents. In addition, it may encourage authorities to invest more in them to attract more and more tourists and generate income. For example, because of rapid increase in number of tourists, government would build better tourist centre or new zoos. Therefore, protection of wild animals has financial benefits. Another factor that challenges this view is medical value of wildlife. Conservation of wild animals has not only positive aspects for economy, but also for creating new medical treatments by conducting research on animals ranging from monkeys, who are more similar to humans, to snakes. These studies help scientists to understand diseases and test medicines safely before experimenting on human and mass production. Certain animal toxins, for instance, had been used to create painkillers and heart medications. Thus, losing animal species would not only have negative economical impacts, but also reduce opportunities for future medical breakthroughs. To sum up, I am convinced that this view is incorrect due to positive aspects of wild animals on finance and medical researches and experiments. If well protected, wild animals could help for many medical breakthroughs in long-term.

There is a growing belief that the studies at university would be more practical if the two genders studied separately. This essay argues that this view is misguided because the teaching is the same and does not matter if it is a girl or boy.  A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that the competitive spirit may fade away. Many of the students thirst for competitions, not only in physical but also in educational games that take place during the lessons. The woman's, for example, is well-being in studying, whereas the man's is in physical activities. Moreover, many teachers are  not teaching as well as they were in the past. For this reason, a few students feel discomfort and become lazier and sleep during the lessons. In some cases, division of students may have a significant impact on the learning abilities of boys.  Another factor that challenges this claim is that the communication and independence skills may make it difficult for individuals. A lot of skills are appearing in the lesson time when everyone should copy off assignments and homework so teachers do not have to notice. As we know from childhood, doing exercises for males is always unpleasant, but they copy it every time from females. In my point of view, working not as schoolmates but as friends is the most important side of university time.  In conclusion, I cannot agree with the idea that separating boys and girls would be an effective way to teach, although it can bring more negatives to the study of men. And every professor teaches their students equally.
