üéÑ Maqsudjon13/12/2025, 04:34:36
Rubric: Learning at university would be more effective if women and men were taught separately. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion? Essay: Some people believe that university education would be more effective if men and women were taught separately. While this idea may have certain advantages, I mostly disagree with this opinion because mixed-gender education better prepares students for real life and promotes equal opportunities. On the one hand, teaching men and women separately could help some students feel more comfortable in class. For example, in single-gender classrooms, learners might feel less distracted and more confident to express their opinions, especially in cultures where interaction between genders is limited. As a result, academic performance may improve for certain individuals. In addition, teachers could adjust their teaching methods to suit the learning styles that are more common among one gender. On the other hand, I believe that studying together is more beneficial overall. In modern society, men and women are expected to work, communicate, and solve problems together. Universities should reflect this reality by encouraging cooperation between genders. Mixed classrooms help students develop social skills, mutual respect, and teamwork, which are essential in professional environments. Moreover, separating students by gender could reinforce stereotypes and limit equal participation in academic and leadership roles. In conclusion, although separate education may offer short-term academic benefits for some students, I strongly believe that mixed-gender learning is more effective in the long run. Universities should focus on creating respectful and inclusive learning environments rather than dividing students by gender.

üéÑ akramjonov muslimbek opinion essay13/12/2025, 04:30:12

Rubric: learning at university would be more effective if women and men were taught separately. To what extent do you agree or disagree with the oppinion.

 Essay:

There is a growing belief that male and female students should be taught separately. This essay argues that this view is misguided because the advantages of mixed-gender education are more significant.

A major reason why this claim is unconvincing is real-world preparation. In modern society, most workplaces men and women are collaborating on projects and share responsibilities. Studying in mixed classes helps students to develop these important skills from an early age. By interacting with classmates of opposite gender, students learn how to express their ideas clearly and respect different viewpoints. For instance, in many universities male and female students are required to work in coordination on group projects and presentations. Through this collaboration they learn essential collaborative skills such as making joint decisions. Therefore, it is important to study in mixed classes is beneficial.

Another key factor that challenges this view is better social skills development. University is a place not only for academic study, but also for creating social confidence skills. Frequent interaction with the opposite gender classmates might help to communicate appropriately and respect each other‚Äôs views. For example, in group discussions, a shy student could get confidence by sharing his ideas with both boy and girl classmates which will help to build communication skills useful in workplace. Thus, mixed-gender education is important for future life and careers.


To sum up, I refute the idea that men and women should be separated to gain knowledege better as mixed classes are significant for developing necessary skills such as collaborative and social.

üéÑ Sevinch Turopova13/12/2025, 04:21:28
Rubric: learning at university would be more effective if women and men were taught separately. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Some people argue that university education would be more effective if male and female students were taught in separate classes. Although this approach may offer certain academic advantages, I largely disagree with this opinion because mixed-gender education better supports both learning outcomes and personal development. Those who support single-gender education believe that students can focus better without the presence of the opposite gender. They argue that distractions are reduced, which may lead to improved concentration and academic performance. In addition, some students may feel more confident expressing their ideas in a same-gender environment, especially in societies where interaction between men and women is limited. This structure may also reduce anxiety , encourage participation and improve academic confidence among some shy students. However, teaching students together provides more significant long-term benefits. Universities play a crucial role in preparing individuals for the workplace, where cooperation between men and women is essential. Studying in mixed-gender classrooms helps students develop communication, teamwork and social skills. Furthermore, exposure to diverse viewpoints encourages critical thinking and creates a more balanced learning environment.This experience also promots tolerence, reduces stereotypes and help students adopt more easily to diverse professional environments in real life. In conclusion, while separating male and female students may help some learners concentrate, I believe that mixed-gender education is more effective overall. It not only reflects real-life situations but also equips students with essential skills needed beyond university.

THE WINNER TAKES IT ALL
üéÑ Farida13/12/2025, 04:10:29
Some people believe that separating male and female students at university would lead to more effective learning. While this idea may have certain benefits, I strongly disagree with this opinion because mixed-gender education improves social skills and promotes equality, which are essential in modern society. One major reason for disagreeing with gender-segregated education is that studying together helps students develop important social and communication skills. Universities prepare young people not only academically but also professionally. In most workplaces, men and women work side by side, and mixed-gender classrooms allow students to learn how to cooperate, share ideas, and respect different perspectives. This interaction also helps students become more confident and open-minded. If students are taught separately, they may find it more difficult to interact confidently with the opposite gender in real-life situations. Another important argument against separating genders is that it supports equality and prevents discrimination. Teaching men and women together ensures that all students receive the same quality of education and equal access to resources. This creates a fair academic environment where ability matters more than gender. Gender-segregated education may strengthen stereotypes, such as the belief that males and females learn differently or have unequal abilities. Co-education, on the other hand, creates a balanced learning environment where students are judged based on their performance rather than their gender. In conclusion, mixed-gender education is more beneficial because it develops social skills and promotes equality. Therefore, I disagree that separating men and women at university would make learning more effective.

Some people hold the view that learning at colleges and universities would be more effective if men and women studied separately. I completely agree with the opinion that single-gender education leads to better learning outcomes. One key reason why this view is valid is that students are able to concentrate better in single-gender classes, as they are less likely to feel distracted by the presence of the opposite sex. In mixed-gender clasrooms, some learners may focus more on social interactions rather than academic tasks. By contrast, when men and women are taught separately, they often feel more comfortble and confident in the learning environment. This encourages them to ask questions freely, take part in discussions, and express their opinions without fear of judgment. As a result, the overall quality of learning improves and students are more likely to achieve better academic outcomes. Another strong argument supporting this idea is that single-gender education can create a more comfortable and less pressurised learning environment. In mixed-gender universities, some students may feel anxious about being judged by the opposite sex, which can negatively affect on their academic performance. When men and women are taught separately learners are more likely to particpate actively make mistakes, and learn from them without embarrassment. Consequently this supportive atmosphere encourages deeper learning and helps students reach their full academic potential. In conclusion, I strongly believe that teaching men and women separately at universities leads to a more focused and supportive learning environment, which ultimatly improves students academic performance.

Many people argue that university education would be better if male and female students studied in separate classes. I entirely disagree, mainly because mixed education has more advantages for students and society. A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that studying together helps students develop social skills. In real life, men and women work together in offices, companies and almost all workplaces. If students only study with the same gender, they may feel shy or uncomfortable when they need to work with other gender. Mixed classes allow students to share ideas, communicate better and learn how to respect different opinions. This makes them feel more confident and prepare for future jobs. Also, studying together helps students understand each other and reduce unfair ideas about the opposite gender. Another factor that challenges this claim is that mixed education creates a more natural and balanced educations. Men and women often have different ways to think and solve problems. When they study together, they may learn from each other and improve understanding. Group discussions become more interesting because everyone has their own different views. This can help everyone learn better and think more creatively. Mixed classes also teach teamwork and cooperation which is important skills in both work and daily life. Separating students by gender does not guarantee better results. Learning with both boys and girls can make students more active and confident. In conclusion, I cannot agree with idea that boys and girls should be taught separately. I strongly believe that mixed education at university is more effective. It helps students improve social skills and prepare them for real life future.

üéÑ Vladimir13/12/2025, 00:08:44
Some people believe that university education would be more effective if male and female students were taught in separate classes. While this idea may be beneficial in some cultures, I completely disagree with it because mixed-gender education better prepares students for real life and encourages balanced academic development. On the one hand, proponents of single-gender education argue that separating men and women can improve concentration and academic performance. They claim that students may feel less distracted and more confident when expressing their opinions without pressure from the opposite gender. For instance, some studies suggest that female students may participate more actively in science or technology subjects when taught separately. However, despite these potential advantages, I believe that teaching men and women together is more effective overall. Firstly, universities are not only places for getting academic knowledge but also environment where students develop social and communication skills. In real workplaces, men and women must cooperate closely, and mixed-gender education helps students learn respect each other, teamwork, and different perspectives from early stage. Separating students by gender could limit these important interactions and create unrealistic social boundaries. Moreover, academic success depends on teaching quality, motivation, and resources than on gender separation. Modern educational methods can provide individual learning needs without separating students. Providing variety in classrooms often leads to richer discussions, critical thinking, and a broader exchange of ideas, which enhances learning outcomes for everyone. In conclusion, although teaching men and women separately may offer some academic benefits in certain cases, I strongly believe that mixed-gender education is more effective at university level. It not only supports academic growth but also prepares students for social and professional life in a large world

üéÑ muhammad12/12/2025, 06:53:57
Today, people in many countries have to spend more and more time away from their families. Why is this happening ? What effects does this have on the people themselves and on their families Nowadays it is undeniable that working men spend progressively more time away from family members in most of countries. There are several reasons for this tendency, and it could have significant impacts on social cohesion and affect on their health due to job demands or economic necessity. One significant factor contributing to this issue is a working hours. In most of corporations, for instance, working 12 hours a day is obligation, despite opportunities such as higher salaries or job perspective in a long-term, accordingly, workers spend half of their day in a work place. Moreover, many employees tend to work at nonstandard work schedules ‚Äì especially logistics groups- where in most of the cases promote only night shifts. Another major cause behind this problem is earn finance resources despite consequences. Most of young men tend to choose work abroad for making more money. As a result, they are restricting themselves to spend time in company of family. These two factors are root cause of spending more time on particular duty rather than with families, but other causes should not be underestimated. In addition, to above major causes, these factors contribute to harmful effects. One major consequence of this trend is health problems. Long working hours may cause stress from overpressure or burnout result from lack of rest. When people spend most of their time at work they are not able gain sufficient support from family, which can trigger feeling of anxiety influence on mental health. Another vital impact of this issue is lack of family attention. Being disconnected from family members may cause feeling of loneliness, affecting emotionally. Furthermore, this can lead to weaken trust and emotional support, accordingly, make relationship more fragile. In conclusion, there are several reasons why majority of individuals spend more their time being far away from family members and this tendency can result in a number of negative impacts on family supports and health.

üéÑ Farida11/12/2025, 05:06:12
Today, people in many countries have to spend more and more time away from their families.Why is this happening? What effects does this have on the people themselves and on their families? Around the world, people are spending far less time with their families than in the past. This is largely caused by long working hours and the fact that both parents work, which together create problems with health and overall well-being. One significant factor contributing to this issue is prolonged working hours in many cities. Adults now have to work much longer than traditional 8-hours day. This usually happens because of high living costs, increased competitions on the workplace, and the pressure to earn a stable income. Another major cause behind this problem is household in which both parents working. Nowadays it is common for both parents work full-time to provide a better life for their children. Since university education and privat tutor become financially demanding, many families feel that both parents must work. A major effect of this trend is the negative impact on individuals‚Äô physical and mental well-being. When people spend most of their time at work, they often experience stress, and a lack of work‚Äìlife balance. As a result, they may struggle to find time to relax, which can lead to burnout and a decline in their overall quality of life. Families are also effected by this situation in several ways. When parents are rarely at home, communication within the family weakens, and children may feel less supported or supervised. This can lead to misunderstandings, behavioural problems, or a weaker emotional bond between parents and children. Furthermore, family traditions such as eating meals together or spending weekends as a group become less common, which reduces the sense of stability within the household. In conclusion, long working hours and the necessity for both parents to work full-time are the main reasons why families spend less time together. This development has serious consequences, including increased stress for individuals and weakened relationships within family members.

üéÑ Sevinch11/12/2025, 04:18:01
Essay Nowadays, people in many countries spend increasingly more time away from their families, and several structural and social factors contribute to this trend. This essay will discuss the main reasons behind this phenomenon and examine its effects on individuals and their families. One major reason for reduced family time is long working hours and rising job demands. In many economies, competitive labour markets require employees to work extended schedules, often exceeding 50 hours per week. Such demanding routines create work‚Äìfamily conflict, leaving individuals with limited energy or availability for meaningful family engagement. Another significant cause is the growth of dual-earner households. As living costs increase, many families rely on two incomes, forcing both parents to juggle employment, childcare, and household responsibilities. This situation leads to a ‚Äútime squeeze‚Äù where adults feel they do not have enough hours in the day to balance their roles. These pressures result in several negative effects. For individuals, the most immediate consequence is deterioration of physical and mental well-being. Chronic stress from overwork can cause sleep disturbances, burnout, and emotional exhaustion. Over time, this undermines life satisfaction and increases risks of mental health problems. For families, the main impact is reduced parental involvement and weaker relationships. When parents lack time, children receive less emotional support, supervision, or help with schoolwork. Studies show that limited parental presence can negatively influence children‚Äôs academic performance and overall development. Additionally, strained schedules may reduce family cohesion and increase conflict between spouses. In conclusion, rising work demands and economic pressures are key reasons why people spend less time with their families. These causes have serious consequences for individuals‚Äô health and for the stability and well-being of family relationships. Addressing these issues requires supportive workplace policies and better social assistance systems.

üéÑ Abdullokh11/12/2025, 03:54:04
In recent years, many individuals around the world have been spending increasing amounts of time away from their families. This trend can be attributed to several social and economic factors, including work demands and educational pressures. While this situation may seem unavoidable for many people, it can lead to a range of negative consequences for both individuals and their family members. One significant factor contributing to this issue is the increasing pressure at work. In many countries, employees often have to work long hours or stay overtime to keep their jobs or earn enough money to support their daily needs. Because of this, they have very little time left to spend with their families. Another major cause behind this problem is the growing number of people who move to other cities or countries for better education or job opportunities. Although this may help them improve their future, it also keeps them away from home for long periods. One major consequence of this trend is that individuals may experience more stress and loneliness. When people do not spend enough time with their families, they miss emotional support and may feel isolated. Another significant impact of this issue is the weakening of family relationships. Children may feel less connected to their parents, and communication inside the family can decrease. Over time, this can lead to misunderstandings and a lower sense of unity within the household.
In conclusion, people today spend more time away from their families mainly because of work pressure and the need to move for better opportunities. These changes can lead to stress for individuals and weaken relationships within the family.

Many people are busy with work, travel and personal responsibilities. Families are not able to spend as much time together as before. There are several reasons for this tendency, and it could have significant impacts on both individuals and their family relationships One significant factor contributing to this issue is many people have jobs with long working hours. Many jobs require long hours and some people even have to travel for work or move to another city to find better opportunities. As a result, they cannot spend as much time with their families as they want. Another major cause behind this problem is modern life. People often try to keep their responsebilities , such as studying, working or taking care of personal goals. This busy lifestyle leads them to spend less time for family activities. One major consequence of this trend is it can have negative effects on individuals. When people stay away from their families for long time, they may feel stressed or burn out. They may also feel lonely because there is no one to talk or share their feelings with. Another significant impact of this issue is this can affect their mental health. Children may grow up feeling less connected to their parents and parents may face misunderstanding or arguments because they do not spend enough quality time together. In some cases, family relationships may break down completely. However, there can also be some positive effects. For example, if parents work long hours to earn money, they can provide their family and improve their living conditions. Some people also became more independent when they live away from home. In conclusion, there are several reasons why people spend more time away from their families and this tendency can result in a number of nagative impacts on family relationships. It is important for people to spend time with family in order to maintain strong and healthy connections.

Nowadays, in many parts of the world, people are spending increasing amounts of time away from their families. This essay will explore the reasons behind this situation and discuss the effects it may have on individuals as well as their family members. One significant factor contributing to this trend is the rise in long working hours. In many countries, companies expect employees to stay beyond their scheduled shifts or complete additional tasks at home, which often results in less free time with family. This situation can mainly be attributed to financial pressures, as people feel the need to earn more due to the rising cost of living. Another major cause is the growth of urban areas and long commuting distances. Many individuals travel for hours each day to reach their workplaces, and this routine leads to reduced energy and fewer opportunities for meaningful family interactions. One important effect of this issue is its negative impact on emotional well-being. When people spend most of their time working or commuting, it may trigger stress, tiredness, and a sense of disconnection, which can be bad for mental health. As a result, individuals may struggle to maintain a healthy work‚Äìlife balance. Another key consequence is the weakening of family relationships. Limited time together often reduces communication and shared activities, which can have serious implications for family stability. Children, in particular, may feel a lack of attention or emotional support from their parents. In conclusion, there are several reasons why people today spend less time with their families, including long working hours, economic pressure, and lengthy commutes. This trend can negatively affect both personal well-being and family bonds, making it important to promote healthier routines and better work conditions.

Today, people in many countries have to spend more and more time away from their families. Why is this happening? What effects does this have on the people themselves and on their families? In recent years, it has become increasingly common among individuals in many parts of the world to spend less time with their families. This trend is mainly caused by economic pressures and modern work patterns. As a result, both people and their family members experience negative consequences. One of the main reasons for this development is the rising cost of living. In many countries, salaries lower than inflation rate, forcing people to work more hours or take one more job to maintain a normal living level. In addition, globalisation has made the job market more competitive, employees often feel pressure to work overtime to secure their positions. The effects of this trend are significant. For individuals, spending less time with family can lead to stress, burnout, and emotional exhaustion. Without regular support from family members, people may feel isolated or disconnected, which can negatively affect their mental well-being. Families, especially children, may also suffer. When parents are rarely at home, children may have lack of not only attention to them but also emotional support, which can lead to behavioural problems or weaker family relationship. Furthermore, reduced family interaction can create misunderstandings among family members and damage overall family unity. In conclusion, people are spending more time away from their families mainly due to financial pressures, demanding work conditions, and long commutes. This situation can harm both individuals and their families by causing stress, weakening relationships, and reducing emotional support. To solve these issues, governments and employers should promote a healthier work‚Äìlife balance.

üéÑ OZODBEK09/12/2025, 04:02:53
The air pollution. The main problem that many countries face and suffer from these days. There are several reasons that can be put forward to explain this, and there are significant impacts on the environment and living creatures.  One significant factor contributing to this issue is constructing new buildings. Large buildings are built every year. The people who live in the countryside move to the urban areas, and it may lead to overcrowding of population. However, burning non-recyclable materials such as oil plastics, or Pampers has a role in air pollution, producing black smog that cannot fly away from the ozone layer. These materials are burning in the closed areas, and usually, no one knows about it.  One major consequence of this trend is when humans move to the city, they think that there they can earn more than in rural areas. This often results in overcrowding and in the rise of accommodations. The government built new houses and produced dust in the air, and we breathe this. Furthermore, some factories burn non-recycled materials, and this situation can have serious implications for the air. Materials that burn generate a considerable amount of smog, and they cannot be recycled or flown. In some cases, these issues could affect health and cause illnesses like asthma and other respiratory system issues.  In conclusion, there are several reasons why air is polluted, and this tendency can result in a number of negative impacts on both health and the environment. Everyone has responsibilities not only in air pollution but also in other world problems too.
Word count: 260
AI Feedback
üéÅ
Hi
üéÑ Turapova Sevinch09/12/2025, 03:57:38
In many urban areas today, the rise in air pollution has become a serious concern. This problem is closely linked to the demands of our fast-paced industrialised world, where growing populations and expanding industries lead to a steady increase in harmful emissions. As a result, many cities now struggle to maintain clean air, and this situation is affecting both the environment and public health. There are two main causes behind this rising level of pollution. The first is the surge in private vehicle use. People depend excessively on cars for even short journeys, and this daily traffic releases large amounts of exhaust fumes into the atmosphere. The second major cause is the lack of strict environmental considerations when planning industrial zones. Many factories are built in close proximity to residential areas, meaning that dangerous pollutants reach citizens directly and contribute to poor air quality. The effects of this issue are farreaching. One significant impact is on human health. Continuous exposure to toxic air can lead to respiratory problems such as asthma, as well as cardiovascular diseases, especially among vulnerable groups like children and the elderly. Another serious consequence is the damage caused to local ecosystems. Polluted air settles on soil and water, harming flora and fauna and creating knock on effects that disturb the natural balance and reduce biodiversity. In conclusion, the main causes of growing air pollution in urban areas are overreliance on cars and poorly regulated industrial development. These factors harm both people and the environment, making it essential for governments to implement stronger measures to protect public health and natural ecosystems.

Hello, DEXTER MORGAN!
üéÑ Farida09/12/2025, 03:47:16
In today‚Äôs industrialised world, air pollution in many cities is rising rapidly. This problem is mainly caused by increased construction activities and the growing number of private vehicles. These factors lead to serious environmental damage and health issues for the public. One major reason for this rise is the large amount of construction work taking place in urban areas. Building new houses, offices, and roads produces a lot of dust and harmful particles. Processes such as demolishing old structures or mixing cement release toxic materials into the air, which can easily spread across neighbourhoods. When this pollution builds up, it reduces air quality and creates smog, especially in crowded districts. Another important cause is the rapid growth in private car ownership. As more people buy cars, there are more vehicles on the road, which leads to higher emissions of dangerous gases. Traffic jams make the situation even worse because cars release pollutants continuously when they are stuck in slow-moving traffic. Many people avoid using public transport because it is often uncomfortable or unreliable, which increases the number of private vehicles even more. The effects of this pollution are serious for both the environment and public health. Polluted air can damage trees, reduce visibility, and contribute to climate change. For humans, long-term exposure can lead to breathing problems, asthma, and even heart diseases. Children and elderly people are especially at risk. In conclusion, rising air pollution in cities is mainly caused by construction work and the increasing number of cars. These factors harm the environment and endanger people‚Äôs health. To improve this situation, governments should promote cleaner building methods and develop better public transport to reduce car use.

üéÑ Abdullokh09/12/2025, 01:54:35
In recent years, air quality has been deteriorating in many cities, and this has turned into a major issue. Although several reasons contribute to this growing problem, it is impact on ecosystems and human well-being can be extremely serious. One significant factor contributing to the issue is deforestation.When large areas of land are cleared for agriculture, construction, or industrial purposes, trees that normally absorb harmful gases are lost. As a result, pollutats remain in the atmosphere instead of being filtered out. Another major cause behind this problem is vehicle emmissions.Cars, buses, and trucks release large amounts of carbon monoxide, nitrogen oxides, and other harmful gases into the atmosphere. As the number of vehicles continues to grow in many cities, these pollutants acumulate and significantly reduce air quality. Heavy traffic and old, poorly maintained vehicles make the situation even worse, leading to dense smog and higher pollution levels. One major consequence of this trend is the significant damage it causes to the environment. Polluted air contains harmful gases, such as sulfur dioxide and nitrogen oxides, which can mix with rainwater to form acid rain. This gradually weakens trees, and contaminates rivers and lakes, harming plants, fish, and other wildlife. Over time these effects disrrupt ecosystems, reduce biodiversity, and make natural habitats less resilient to challenges like climate change. Another major consequence of this trend is its impact on public health. Breathing polluted air expozes people to harmful gases and particles, which can cause respiratory problems such as asthma and bronchitis. Long-term exposure may also increase the risk of heart disease and weaken the immune system. Children and the elderly are particularly vulnerable and overall, poor air quality can reduce life quality and place a burden on healthcare systems. In conclusion, the rise in air pollution is caused by several factors, including vehicle emissions, industrial activities, and deforestation. This problem has serious consequences, both for the environment, through issues like acid rain and ecosystem damage, and for human health, through respiratory and other diseases.

Rubric: In many urban areas, the rise in air pollution is becoming a significant concern. What are the main causes of this increase, and what effects does it have on environment and public health?


Essay:

In recent decades, air contamination is becoming more and more considerable issue. There are several reasons which can be put forward to explain this, and there are significant impacts on natural world and public health.


One major factor contributing to this concern is increased use of

vehicles. More cars and buses on the roads lead to higher level of harmful gases. Many vehicles are emitting exhaust fumes such as nitrogen oxide and carbon dioxide. These gases often have detrimental impacts on environment.

Another major cause behind this problem is dependence on fossil fuels. Many cities rely heavily on fossil fuels such as coal and oil, as the main source of energy to run industries and produce electricity. When they are burned, they release large amount of toxic gases. Since urban areas need a lot of energy, they continue to burn fossil fuels contaminating the air.


One major consequence

of this trend is climate change. Climate change is mainly caused by rising greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. These gases trap the heat from the sun, causing the Earth to warn up. As a result, cities are experiencing hotter temperatures.

Another essential impact of this issue is respiratory problems. Pollutants such as dust and hazardous gases are irritating people‚Äôs lungs and airways making it more challenging to breathe. Long-term exposure can cause chronic diseases such as lung cancer and asthma.

To sum up, there are several reasons why air contamination is devastative

issue, and this tendency can result in a number of negative impacts on nature and individual life‚Äôs causing respiratory problems.

There is a growing belief that authorities should ban all types of advertisement. This essay argues that this view is misguided because advantages of advertisement are more significant. A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that advertising keeps consumers informed. Ads help consumers learn about new products, services, and opportunities that they might miss. Ads could inform people by the most convenient way, through internet, for instance, about seasonal discounts or even essential services such as banking apps. This information allows individuals to make better decisions about what to do. Therefore, I believe that adverts play a key role on people‚Äôs decisions. Another key factor that challenges this claim is that advertising makes free content possible. Ads are the main source of income for many media platforms such as aternos ond so on, and without it, these platforms could not operate for free, since they rely on ads. For instance, if ads were fully banned, TV channels and many websites would be forced to charge subscription fees and would lose their viewers because not everyone want to buy subscriptions. Because companies pay to display ads, viewers can enjoy entertainment and information for free. Thus, advertisement should not be banned due to these arguments. To sum up, I am convinced that this view is flawed because of free content and useful information advertisements provide. If used in moderation and with a clear purpose, ads would be not only useful but also a good marketing way of introducing the product.

Many many of them highlight product features, price ranges, and the additional services companies provide, such as repair centers or customer support lines. This information functions is helpful for enabling people to compare similar products and decide which option best fits their needs and budget. If all advertising were banned, buyers would have far less opportunity to clear and organized product information, making the purchasing process more confusing. In conclusion, I strongly believe that advertising should not be completely banned, as it helps consumers make informed choices and plays a vital role in supporting business growth. While some adverts may be misleading, appropriate regulation is a better solution than a total ban.

üéÑ Sevinch06/12/2025, 04:21:43
Rubric:some people think there should be a complete ban in all forms of advertising to what extent do you agree or disagree Essay In recent years, the influence of advertising has become so widespread that some individuals argue for a blanket ban on all forms of promotional activity. While I acknowledge that certain advertisements can be misleading or harmful, I completely disagree with the idea of a total prohibition. Instead of removing advertising altogether, it would be more sensible to restrict the most problematic types and encourage ethical marketing practices. To begin with, advertising plays a crucial role in supporting the economy, especially for SMEs that rely heavily on promotional tools to reach potential customers. For many small companies, completely imposing a ban on advertising would limit their ability to compete with larger corporations and could eventually push them into bankruptcy. Without the visibility that promotions offer, these enterprises would struggle to introduce new products, raise awareness, or build customer trust. Moreover, modern advertising has become part of mainstream culture, shaping consumer habits and informing people about available goods and services, from household appliances to educational opportunities. Another key reason why a full ban would be unrealistic is that advertising helps consumers make informed choices. Rather than eliminating it, governments could reallocate resources towards stricter monitoring and enforcing guidelines against deceptive content. This approach would ensure that campaigns remain honest and socially responsible. For example, unhealthy or manipulative advertisements could be limited to specific platforms or shown at restricted hours, reducing potential harm without implementing a total ban. In conclusion, although concerns about the negative effects of advertising are understandable, enforcing a blanket ban would do more harm than good. It is far more reasonable to restrict misleading or harmful promotions while encouraging transparent and ethical campaigns that benefit both businesses and consumers.

üéÑ ozodbek06/12/2025, 04:16:48
Advertising has become a part of daily life, and some people argue that it should be completely banned. Although advertisements can sometimes mislead people, I believe that banning all advertising would create more problems than it solves. One reason why some individuals support a full ban is that advertisements can be manipulative. Companies often exaggerate the quality of their products to attract more customers. As a result, people may waste money on items that they do not really need. Another concern is that advertising affects young children. For example, many ads show toys, sweets or fast food, which can influence children‚Äôs behaviour and even harm their health in the long term. From this point of view, banning advertising seems reasonable. However, despite these disadvantages, a complete ban is unrealistic and unnecessary. Advertising plays an important role in the modern economy. It helps businesses introduce new products and services, and without it, many small companies would struggle to survive. Moreover, advertisements provide useful information for consumers. For example, people learn about discounts, new technologies, or educational courses, which can be beneficial for their daily lives. Instead of banning all ads, governments can set strict rules to prevent false or harmful advertising. This is a more balanced and practical solution. In conclusion, although advertisements sometimes have negative effects, I do not support a total ban. In my opinion, advertising is necessary for economic development and consumer choice, but it should be controlled to ensure that it remains honest and safe.

üéÑ Glazkov Vladimir06/12/2025, 03:11:30
Some people think that there should be a complete ban on all forms of advertising. To what extent do you agree or disagree? Many people believe that advertising should be completely prohibited because it has a negative influence on society. Although advertising can sometimes be misleading, I disagree with the idea of removing it fully. On the one hand, some individuals argue that advertising encourages people to buy things they do not really need. For example, companies often exaggerate the benefits of their products, which can create false expectations and lead to disappointment. In addition, children are easily influenced by bright and attractive commercials, which may push them to demand unhealthy food or unnecessary toys. These effects make some people feel that a ban on advertising would protect consumers. However, despite these drawbacks, advertising also has important advantages that cannot be ignored. Firstly, it helps businesses promote their products and reach customers. This is especially important for small companies that depend on advertising to survive in a competitive market. Secondly, advertisements provide useful information about new products, services, and discounts, allowing consumers to make smarter choices. Finally, advertising supports many industries, such as television, online platforms, and sports organisations, by providing essential funding. In my view, rather than banning advertising, governments should introduce clear rules. They could limit advertisements aimed at children, control false claims, and ensure that companies provide accurate information. This approach would reduce the negative impacts while keeping the benefits. In conclusion, although advertising can sometimes be harmful, a complete ban is not a practical solution. With better regulation, advertising can remain an important and helpful part for modern society.

Rubric: Some people think that there should be a complete ban on all forms of advertising. To extent do you agree or disagree? Designers, marketers, and media specialists are rely on this inductry, therefore complete ban would create widespread unemployment. This often results in people making more informed purchasing decisions, Moreover, public health and safety campains - such as those encouraging recycling or reducing smoking - are the result of goverenment advertising. If advertisement were removed, this could have serious implication for public education and community well being. While it is true that misleading advertisement can trigger unethical behavior or confusion, this problem can mainly be attributed to weak regulation rather than advertising itself. As a result, stricter monitoring would be far more effective than a universal ban. In conclusion, siome reasons can be identified for why advertising should contunue to exist, and the impacts of a complete ban would be overwhelmingly negative. A more balanced approach is to regulate harmful advertising rather than eliminate all of promotion.

Teacher Feedback
üîπ Task Response ‚Äî Band 7.0‚Äì7.5

Strengths:

You clearly disagree with a complete ban and maintain this position throughout.

Your ideas are relevant, well-developed, and logical.

You support your opinion with clear reasons:

economic importance

job creation

consumer awareness

public health campaigns

You address the opposing view (harmful advertising) and refute it effectively by suggesting regulation instead of a ban.

What prevents a higher score:

The introduction could be slightly clearer and more concise.

A few ideas could be illustrated with specific examples to strengthen arguments.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.0‚Äì7.5

üîπ Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äî Band 7.5

What you did well:

Clear paragraph structure: introduction, two body paragraphs, counterargument, conclusion.

Logical progression of ideas.

Effective use of linking devices:

Although, Moreover, As a result, While it is true that

Minor issues:

A few punctuation errors interrupt flow.

One or two sentences are slightly long and could be split.

Example:

‚ùå Designers, marketers, and media specialists are rely on this industry‚Ä¶
‚úÖ Designers, marketers, and media specialists rely on this industry‚Ä¶

‚úÖ Estimated band: 7.5

üîπ Lexical Resource (Vocabulary) ‚Äî Band 6.5‚Äì7.0

Strong points:

Good range of academic vocabulary:

significant, contribute, economic growth, regulation, unethical behaviour

Appropriate tone for an opinion essay.

Major issue: spelling
There are many spelling errors, which IELTS penalises heavily:

Incorrect Correct
signaficant significant
comsumers consumers
custumors customers
cantributing contributing
couse cause
campains campaigns
goverenment government
siome some
contunue continue
advertisement advertising (in general use)

These reduce your lexical score despite good word choice.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5‚Äì7.0

üîπ Grammatical Range & Accuracy ‚Äî Band 6.5

Strengths:

Good variety of sentence structures.

Effective use of complex sentences (Although, While it is true that‚Ä¶).

Errors do not usually block meaning.

Common grammar problems:

Subject‚Äìverb agreement:

‚ùå Advertising play a major part

‚úÖ Advertising plays a major part

Verb form errors:

‚ùå are rely on

‚úÖ rely on

Article misuse:

‚ùå therefore complete ban

‚úÖ therefore, a complete ban

These errors are noticeable but manageable.

‚úÖ Estimated band: 6.5

üü¢ Overall Estimated IELTS Writing Task 2 Band Score:
‚≠ê Band 7.0

This is a strong Band 7 essay with:

Clear position

Logical argumentation

Good coherence

Appropriate academic tone

However, frequent spelling mistakes and minor grammar issues prevent it from reaching Band 7.5‚Äì8.

üîπ What to Fix to Reach Band 7.5‚Äì8

Proofread spelling carefully (this is your biggest weakness)

Fix subject‚Äìverb agreement errors

Use 1‚Äì2 specific examples

Slightly tighten the introduction
AI Feedback
üéÅ
don‚Äôt break your neck
üéÑ Abdullokh05/12/2025, 04:43:34
In recent years, there has been a growing debate about whether all forms of advertising should be completely banned. Some people argue that advertisements have too many negative effects on society and should therefore be removed entirely. However, I strongly disagree with this idea. Firstly, I disagree with a complete ban because advertising is essential for the growth of businesses. It allows companies, especially small and newly established ones, to introducce their products to potential customers. Without advertisements, many busineses would struggle to reach a wide audience and compete in the market. As a result, this could slow down economic development and lead to fewer job opportunities for people. Secondly, advertisements play an important role in providing people with valuable information that they might not discover on their own. For example, many individuals learn about new products, technological improvemnts, or special discounts through advertisements. This helps customers make more informed choices and compare different options before buying something. In addition, advertisements often inform people about essential services such as medical check-ups, educational courses, or job openings. If all forms of advertising were banned, the public would have limited access to these updates, and this could make everyday life less convenient. Instead of introducing a complete ban, governments should regulate advertsing to ensure that information remains accurate and does not mislead consumers.
In conclusion, although some people believe that advertising should be completely prohibited, I think such a ban would be impractical and unnecessary. Advertisingg not only helps businesses grow and supports the economy
Word count: 253

Band 7 Model Answer

Organised travel to distant countries has become increasingly popular in recent years. Many people enjoy exploring remote destinations, and although this trend brings some benefits, it also has important consequences for both people and the natural environment.

One major positive impact of travelling to distant locations is that it can broaden a person‚Äôs horizons. Experiencing different cultures and traditions allows travellers to develop new skills and learn new ways of living. For example, visitors may discover new cooking methods, building styles or communication habits by observing how people in other countries live. Such experiences can also inspire creativity and encourage personal growth. In addition, travelling to remote destinations helps individuals adapt more quickly to unfamiliar environments, building confidence, flexibility and the ability to handle new situations.

However, visiting faraway regions can also cause harm to the environment. Many natural areas are extremely fragile, and large numbers of tourists may damage wildlife habitats, disturb animals or contribute to pollution. Forests, mountains and coastal cliffs, for instance, may suffer when too many visitors arrive at the same time. Although these impacts are serious, they can be reduced through responsible tourism. Guided tours that follow eco-friendly rules and support wildlife protection can help preserve nature while still allowing people to explore remote destinations.

In conclusion, there are several reasons why more travellers are choosing to visit faraway places, and this trend has both positive and negative effects. While travel can damage the environment, it also provides exciting experiences and valuable cultural knowledge for individuals.

A growing number of people now choose to join guided trips to distant areas. This essay will examine the positive and negative aspects of this development. I believe this trend largely positive for humans and natural world. On the one hand, there are several negative aspects of guided tours.First and one of the major reasons is some remote areas are extremely sensitive for large groups. Many of these areas have ecosystems which develop with very little human contact, so even small disbalances can lead to long-term damage. Second issue is that remote places often lack medical facilities, transport, or clean water.This means that it could be really challenging to find travel methods with minimal risk or even safe water supply. On the other hand, these trips can offer several important benefits for individuals and the environment. For the reason that commercially organized travel to distant destinations helps people broader their worldview and cultural awareness. This trips to remote regions helps to learn unique traditions,lifestyles and language for travelers. As a result,they could become open-minded and tolerant,as exploring unfamiliar cultures helps them challenge stereotypes and appreciate different ways of life.The main environmental advantage is that it raises global awareness of environment issues. Tourists learn about endangered species or fragile ecosystems and may support conservation campaigns. In conclusion, although guided trips to remote regions can pose risks to fragile ecosystems and may lack essential infrastructure, they also provide meaningful cultural experiences and promote environmental awareness. On balance, I believe this trend is largely positive, as responsible tourism can help protect natural areas while allowing individuals to develop broader perspectives.

Band 7 Model Answer

A growing number of people now choose to join guided trips to distant regions. This essay will examine the positive and negative aspects of this development. Overall, I believe this trend is largely beneficial for both individuals and the natural environment.

On the one hand, organised tours to remote areas can create several problems. Many of these locations are extremely sensitive to large numbers of visitors. Their ecosystems have developed with minimal human contact, meaning even small disturbances may lead to long-term ecological damage. Another issue is the lack of infrastructure. Remote places often have limited medical facilities, weak transportation networks and unreliable access to clean water. As a result, travellers may face difficulties in emergencies or be exposed to unsafe conditions.

On the other hand, these trips also provide important benefits for both people and the environment. Commercially organised travel allows individuals to broaden their worldview and develop cultural awareness. Visiting remote regions exposes travellers to unique traditions, lifestyles and languages, helping them become more open-minded and tolerant. In addition, guided tours can promote environmental awareness. Tourists often learn about endangered species or fragile ecosystems and may later support conservation initiatives after witnessing these issues first-hand.

In conclusion, although guided trips to remote areas can put pressure on fragile environments and present safety challenges due to limited infrastructure, they also offer valuable cultural experiences and raise awareness of environmental protection. On balance, I believe this trend is largely positive, especially when tourism is managed responsibly.

Band-7 Sample Answer

Nowadays, it has become increasingly common for people to travel to foreign countries. This trend is driven by several factors, and although it brings certain benefits for travellers, it also causes significant environmental damage.

One positive impact of international travel is that it allows young people to broaden their interests and learn about other cultures. By visiting different countries, travellers can experience new cuisines, traditional clothing and unique customs that they would never encounter at home. These cultural exchanges help young people develop open-mindedness and encourage tourism growth, as countries share their traditions with a wider audience.

However, the negative effects of this trend are more serious, particularly for the environment and, in some cases, for individuals. Long-distance flights produce large amounts of carbon emissions, which contribute to climate change. Road trips also rely heavily on petrol and diesel vehicles, causing air pollution that harms wildlife and ecosystems. In addition, travelling to distant countries may pose health risks for certain passengers, such as stress or high blood pressure during long flights. These issues show that while travel can be enjoyable, it can also create environmental damage and safety concerns.

In conclusion, although travelling to other countries offers cultural and personal benefits, it also results in significant environmental problems. In my view, the advantages should be enjoyed responsibly, and travellers must be aware of the negative effects associated with global tourism.
AI Feedback
üéÅ
Hi
üéÑ Turapova Sevinch04/12/2025, 04:22:40
Rubric: Organized trips to remote countries are increasingly common. Is it a positive or negative development for individuals and the environment.

Many people now travel to distant and untouched regions, and this trend is becoming more widespread. While such trips offer personal benefits, I believe they bring more harm than good both for individuals and the environment.
On the one hand, organised trips to remote areas can be beneficial for travellers. Visiting isolated locations allows people to experience landscapes and cultures that they would never encounter in cities or popular tourist destinations. This can broaden their horizons and help them appreciate nature on a deeper level. In addition, remote travel often involves physical activities such as hiking or climbing, which may contribute to better health and a sense of achievement. For some individuals, escaping busy urban life and spending time in quiet, untouched places can also reduce stress and improve emotional well-being. On the other hand, I believe this trend has more negative consequences, especially for the environment. Many remote areas contain fragile ecosystems that can be easily damaged by increased human presence. For example, visitors may unintentionally disturb wildlife, leave waste behind or contribute to soil erosion. Moreover, organised trips usually require long flights or off-road vehicles, both of which increase carbon emissions and accelerate environmental degradation. From an individual perspective, travelling to such isolated regions can also be risky. Harsh weather conditions, limited medical support and unfamiliar surroundings may put travellers in dangerous situations. In conclusion, although travelling to remote places can offer unique experiences and personal growth, I think the negative impacts on the environment and the potential risks for individuals make this trend largely harmful.
Word count: 278

Hello, DEXTER MORGAN!
üéÑ Positive or negative development AKRAMJONOV MUSLIMBEK04/12/2025, 04:18:04
Rubric: Organized trips to remote countries are increasingly common. Is it a positive or negative development for individuals and the environment? Essay: Thanks to the world being more connected, there are now opportunities for people to travel overseas. While the proposal has some potential drawbacks, I believe the benefits carry more weight overall. On the one hand, it is undeniable that the most significant drawback of travelling abroad is high carbon footprint. Approximately 9 percent of global CO2 emissions are caused by traveling. Most of these emissions are produced when tourists fly or drive long distances, so the longer the journey, the higher levels of carbon dioxide that are emitted. Moreover, tourists are involved in damaging ancient artifacts. Many countries have their own historical landmarks, and tourists could accidentally break some medieval dishes or paintings. For instance, in Machu Picchu in Peru, one tourist accidentally scratched stones and walked into restricted area while taking photos. As a result, government limited daily number of visitors and put more security to protect it. Therefore, travelling abroad has some negative aspects. On the other hand, I would argue that these disadvantages are outweighed by positive aspects. One of the biggest advantages of travelling abroad is improving language skills. People, who took a trip to foreign country, could learn local language, for example by watching local television or chatting with natives. Furthermore, when tourism increases, the government invests more. If more and more individuals will travel to certain area, authorities will be encouraged to invest more in this area to attract tourists making it easier and safer to travel. For instance, building tourist centre and better roads. Therefore, I believe that mass tourism has benefits not only for tourists, but also for locals. To sum up, despite some negative aspects, I believe that the benefits of mass tourism are more significant for the reasons aforementioned
Word count: 311

‚≠ê Overall: 6.0‚Äì6.5

BAND 7:

Organised trips to remote countries are becoming increasingly common thanks to improved global connectivity. Although this trend has some negative consequences, I believe the benefits for individuals and local communities are more significant overall.

On the one hand, travelling to distant destinations can create environmental and cultural problems. The most serious issue is the high carbon footprint associated with long-distance travel. It is estimated that around 9% of global CO‚ÇÇ emissions come from tourism, particularly from long-haul flights and road transport. Another drawback is the potential damage to historical or cultural sites. Some tourists behave carelessly around ancient landmarks, which may lead to accidental harm. For example, in Machu Picchu, a visitor once scratched stones while attempting to take photos in a restricted area. As a result, the government introduced stricter entry limits to protect the site. These issues show that tourism can have harmful effects if not managed responsibly.

On the other hand, I believe these disadvantages are outweighed by the benefits. Travelling abroad allows people to improve their language abilities and cultural understanding by communicating with locals and experiencing everyday life firsthand. Furthermore, when a destination attracts more tourists, local authorities often invest in better infrastructure, such as roads, visitor centres and public transport. This not only makes travel safer and more comfortable but also creates jobs and stimulates economic development in remote communities. For these reasons, organised trips can be advantageous for both travellers and local residents.

In conclusion, although such trips may contribute to environmental damage, the personal and economic benefits are more significant. With proper management, organised tourism can bring positive outcomes for individuals and the wider community.
AI Feedback

Meaning is often unclear ‚Üí Band 4.

‚∏ª

‚≠ê FINAL BAND: 4.5 ‚Äì 5.0

You have strong ideas, but the English is not understandable enough for a higher band.

Band 7 Model Answer

Organised trips to remote countries are becoming increasingly popular. While this trend offers some positive experiences, I believe the negative consequences for the environment and local communities are more significant.

On the one hand, travelling to remote places can provide several benefits for individuals. Such trips allow travellers to explore unique landscapes, observe rare wildlife and learn about cultures that may be very different from their own. These experiences can broaden their horizons, increase cultural awareness and contribute to personal growth. In addition, organised tours often provide opportunities to build confidence. Navigating unfamiliar environments, languages and customs helps travellers develop independence and self-reliance, which are valuable life skills.

However, despite these advantages, I would argue that the drawbacks are more substantial. The biggest concern is the environmental impact. Many remote regions have fragile ecosystems that can be easily damaged by large numbers of tourists. Activities such as hiking, camping or off-road driving may disturb wildlife habitats and cause pollution. Furthermore, increased tourism can affect the local economy in negative ways. A sudden rise in visitors may lead to higher living costs, creating pressure on indigenous communities. Tourism can also influence cultural identity, as local people may feel compelled to change their traditions or adopt foreign habits to attract visitors.

In conclusion, although organised trips to remote countries offer memorable experiences and personal development opportunities, these benefits are outweighed by the environmental damage and cultural disruption they may cause. Therefore, I believe this trend is more negative than positive.
AI Feedback
üéÅ

Band 7 Model Answer

Organised trips to remote countries are becoming increasingly common in today‚Äôs world. This trend has raised discussions about whether it is beneficial or harmful. Although there are some drawbacks, I believe it is mostly a positive development.

One negative effect of this trend is the damage it can cause to the environment. Increased tourism often results in pollution, waste, and disturbances to wildlife. Remote areas, which are usually fragile, may suffer from erosion or habitat destruction when large numbers of visitors arrive. Long-distance flights also generate significant carbon emissions, contributing to climate change. As a result, some people argue that organised trips harm natural ecosystems.

However, there are several strong reasons why this trend can be considered positive for individuals and local communities. Travelling to remote places allows people to experience unique cultures and breathtaking natural landscapes, which can have a profound impact on personal growth. Organised tours also make these journeys safer, as guides provide support and reliable information. Another advantage is that tourism contributes to the local economy by creating jobs and generating income for small communities. Therefore, when managed responsibly, such trips can bring significant benefits.

In conclusion, although organised trips to remote countries may lead to environmental challenges, they also offer valuable personal and economic advantages. Overall, I believe the benefits of this development outweigh the drawbacks.
AI Feedback
üéÅ

üéÑ –í–ª–∞–¥–∏–º–∏—Ä –ì–ª–∞–∑–∫–æ–≤03/12/2025, 06:15:15
*Organized trips to remote countries are increasingly common. Is it a positive or negative development for individuals and the environment?* In recent years, travelling to remote destinations through organised tours has become increasingly popular. Although this trend brings certain drawbacks for the environment, I believe its overall impact on individuals and local communities is largely positive. On the one hand, organised trips to isolated regions can provide significant benefits for individuals. Firstly, such tours offer a safe way for people to explore unfamiliar places that would be difficult to visit independently. Tour companies usually provide experienced guides, transportation and logistical support, which allows travellers to focus on enjoying the culture and nature without worrying about safety. Secondly, these trips often promote cultural understanding. When tourists interact with indigenous communities, they gain deeper knowledge about traditional lifestyles, which can broaden their worldview and foster respect for different cultures. On the other hand, the growing popularity of organised travel to remote areas can have negative consequences for the environment. Large groups of tourists may put pressure on fragile ecosystems. For example, increased foot traffic in rainforests or mountain regions can damage vegetation, disturb wildlife and contribute to soil erosion. Moreover, tour operators sometimes prioritise profit over sustainability, which can lead to waste, pollution and overuse of natural resources. If not managed properly, this form of tourism risks harming the very destinations people come to admire. In conclusion, while organised tourism in remote areas may cause environmental challenges, I consider it a mostly positive development due to the cultural and educational benefits it offers to travellers. With responsible management, the environmental impact can be significantly reduced.

This can broaden their perspectives and increase their appreciation of global diversity. In addition, organized tours often provide income for local communities, which can encourage authorities to preserve natural areas and protect wildlife, since these places attract tourists. On the other hand, travelling to remote locations also has several drawbacks for both individuals and the environment. ‚≠ê FINAL BAND: 6.5 (Pay attention to WORD LIMIT!)

Band 7.5 Model Answer

Thanks to increased global connectivity, people now have more opportunities to travel to distant and remote destinations. While this trend offers some benefits, I believe that the drawbacks are more significant for both individuals and the environment.

On the one hand, there are several positive aspects of organized trips to remote countries. These journeys allow travellers to experience unique cultures, landscapes, and traditions that they would never encounter in their everyday lives. Such exposure can broaden their perspectives and deepen their appreciation of global diversity. Moreover, organized tourism can generate income for local communities. This financial support often encourages governments and residents to protect natural areas and preserve wildlife, since these attractions draw more visitors.

On the other hand, travelling to remote locations also presents serious disadvantages. Many of these regions have fragile ecosystems that can be easily damaged by large numbers of tourists. Increased foot traffic, waste, and transportation can disturb wildlife and pollute land and water. In addition, organized trips to isolated communities may disrupt traditional lifestyles, leading to cultural commercialisation or a loss of privacy for local residents. Finally, long-distance travel typically requires air transport, which significantly increases carbon emissions and contributes to global environmental problems.

In conclusion, although organized trips to remote countries can offer cultural benefits and economic support, the negative impacts on the environment and local communities are more substantial. Therefore, I believe that the drawbacks outweigh the advantages.

It is commonly believed that young people should spend more of their leisure time with their family members rather than devote time to entertainment. This essay argues that this view is misguided because balanced lifestyle is healthier than spending all time with family and various forms of activities which reduce stress. A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that it ignores the importance of teenager's social and emotional development. Relying too much on parents can limit their ability to adapt to different environments. If a young child spends almost all his time with parents or siblings, they may become overly reliant on family support. It could be really challenging for them to communicate with strangers or even their classmates. Spending time with their peers helps them build strong confidence in situations outside their home. In conclusion, I firmly disagree with the idea that children should spend most of their leisure time with their family members. Due to the importance of independence in real-life situations and emotional and mental state with entertainment and group activities provide.

Band 7 Model Answer

Many believe that young people should spend most of their free time with their families instead of engaging in other forms of entertainment. However, this essay argues that this view is misguided because young people need a balanced lifestyle that supports both independence and emotional well-being.

A major reason why this belief is unconvincing is that it overlooks the importance of teenagers‚Äô social and emotional development. Spending nearly all their time with their families can make young people overly dependent on their parents and unable to adapt to different social environments. For example, children who rarely interact with peers may struggle to communicate confidently with classmates or strangers. In contrast, spending time with friends helps them develop independence, build confidence, and learn how to handle real-life situations outside the home.

Another key point is that entertainment and social activities are essential for reducing stress. Young people today face considerable pressure from school, exams, and high expectations from both parents and society. Recreational activities such as sports, clubs, or creative hobbies allow them to relax and maintain a healthy emotional balance. For instance, participating in team sports not only helps teenagers unwind but also teaches teamwork and cooperation‚Äîskills that cannot be gained through family interactions alone.

In conclusion, I firmly disagree with the idea that young people should spend most of their leisure time with their families. Although family relationships are important, entertainment and social activities play an essential role in building independence, reducing stress, and supporting healthy emotional development.

Band 7 Model Answer

Spending time with family is often considered essential for a child‚Äôs emotional and social development. While some people argue that children should focus more on friends and other activities, I strongly believe that family time is far more beneficial.

To begin with, spending time with family helps children build strong emotional connections. When young people communicate regularly with their parents, they feel supported, understood, and more secure. This emotional foundation increases their confidence and helps them deal with problems in a healthy way. For instance, teenagers who discuss their challenges at home often make better decisions because they receive guidance based on real experience. Moreover, families play a crucial role in teaching important values such as respect, responsibility, and honesty. These qualities are rarely learned from formal lessons; instead, children absorb them through everyday interactions at home.

However, it is true that children also need time with friends and at school. Socialising helps them develop teamwork, independence, and communication skills. In my view, this does not replace the unique support that families provide. A healthy balance is ideal, but family time should remain the priority because it lays the foundation for a child‚Äôs character and future behaviour.

In conclusion, although spending time with friends is beneficial, I believe that family time is far more important for a child‚Äôs emotional growth and long-term development.
AI Feedback
üéÅ
Hi
üéÑ Turapova Sevinch02/12/2025, 03:17:01
There is a growing belief that adolescence ought to allocate more of their past times with their families. I accept that young people should prioritise family time, as it provides support and helps shape their character. To begin with, spending free time with family creates a stable emotional foundation that adolescents often need during this sensitive stage of life. Young people commonly deal with academic pressure, changes in friendships and uncertainty about their future. When they regularly interact with parents or siblings they can share their worries and receive advice from those who understand them best. For instance, simple activities such as cooking together or having a walk in the evening allows to teenagers to open up and feel less isolated. This emotional closeness not only reduces stress but also teaches them how to build healthy relationships outside the house. In addition, family time plays a crucial role in developing important values and life skills that entertainment alone cannot offer. While hobbies, games or social media provides relaxation, they rarely teach responsibility, empathy or patience. In contrast, participating in family routines such as helping with choreses or taking part in cultural traditions, encourages youngsters to become more considerate and disciplined. These experiences prepare them for adulthood by showing them how to cooperat respect others and manage real-life responsibilities. As a result, young people who spend sufficient time with their families often grow into more confident and well-rounded individuals. In conclusion, although entertainment has its place in a young person‚Äôs life, I believe that family time is far more valuable. It strengthens emotional wellbeing and helps adolescents develop the essential skills needed for their future.
