Band 7.5 Model Answer

There is a growing belief that adolescents should spend more of their free time with their families. I agree with this view, as family time provides emotional support and plays an important role in shaping young people‚Äôs character.

To begin with, spending time with family creates a stable emotional foundation that adolescents often need during this sensitive stage of life. Young people frequently experience academic pressure, changes in friendships, and uncertainty about their future. When they regularly interact with parents or siblings, they can share their concerns and receive guidance from those who understand them best. For instance, simple activities such as cooking together or taking evening walks allow teenagers to open up and feel less isolated. This emotional closeness not only reduces stress but also teaches them how to build healthy relationships outside the home.

In addition, family time helps develop important values and life skills that entertainment alone cannot provide. While hobbies, games, or social media offer relaxation, they rarely teach responsibility, empathy, or patience. In contrast, participating in family routines‚Äîsuch as helping with chores or taking part in cultural traditions‚Äîencourages young people to become more disciplined and considerate. These experiences prepare them for adulthood by teaching them how to cooperate, respect others, and manage real-life responsibilities. As a result, adolescents who spend sufficient time with their families often grow into more confident and well-rounded individuals.

In conclusion, although entertainment is an enjoyable part of a young person‚Äôs life, I believe that family time is far more valuable. It strengthens emotional well-being and helps adolescents develop essential skills for their future.
AI Feedback
üéÅ
Hello, DEXTER MORGAN!
üéÑ Dilnura02/12/2025, 01:32:30
Many believe that young people should spend more of their free time with their family instead of other entertainment. Do you agree or disagree? It is widely believed that the young people ought to spend a more of their spare time at home with family rather than enjoying other leisure activities. I completely disagree with this view because independence, confidence, and communication skills should be encouraged in young people. A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that spending leisure time at home with family does not always lead to strong relationships. Most young people already meet their family members every day at home and they usually talk to their parents about school, personal things and any other things. Forcing them to stay at home can make them feel controller or independent. Young people often have different interests from their parents so using time with them might feel boring and uncomfortable. Family time can feel repetitive and boring rather than build meaningful relationships. Another factor that challanges this claim is that entertainment and leisure activities outside the home provide opportunities to grow. Participate in clubs, volunteer works or use time with peers allows them to develop teamwork, leadership communication skills. Moreover , exploring new activities and environments helps youn people discover their talents which can be useful for their future choices. They need to explore the world independently to build confidence. Friends also helps them cope with stress and boost self-confidence. When young people use their time with peers who have similar interests they tend to feel more comfortable and better understood. Consequently entertainment activities are more beneficial for their personal development than simply staying at home. In conclusion, I do not agree that teenagers should use most of their time to family. Family relationships are crucial but teenagers also need the freedom to explore their interests and engage in social activities that support their personal growth.
Word count: 318

Band 7 Model Answer

It is widely believed that young people should spend most of their free time at home with their families rather than taking part in leisure activities. However, I completely disagree with this view because young people need opportunities to build independence, confidence, and communication skills.

One major reason why this belief is unconvincing is that spending more time at home does not necessarily strengthen family relationships. Most teenagers already see their parents every day and talk to them about school or personal issues. Forcing them to stay at home can make them feel controlled and limit their sense of independence. Young people often have different interests from their parents, so spending too much time together may feel repetitive and uninteresting. As a result, extended family time does not always lead to meaningful connections.

Another reason why I disagree is that leisure activities outside the home provide essential opportunities for personal growth. Participating in clubs, volunteering, or spending time with peers helps young people develop teamwork, leadership, and communication skills. Exploring new environments also allows them to discover talents that may influence their future goals. In addition, friends play an important role in helping teenagers cope with stress and build self-confidence. When they spend time with peers who share the same interests, they feel more supported and understood. Therefore, entertainment and social activities are often more beneficial for their development than staying at home.

In conclusion, I do not agree that teenagers should spend most of their free time with their families. Although family relationships are important, young people need freedom to explore their interests and engage in social activities that support their personal growth.

Rubric: Many believe that young people should spend more of their free time with their family instead of other entertainment. Do you agree or Disagree? Essay: It is commonly believed that young people should devote the majority of their leisure time to interacting with their family members rather than engaging in entertainment activities. I entairley disagree, mainly because entertainment offers signaficant social development benifits, and the generation gap often makes family interaction less enjoyable or productive for children. A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that young people already spend a large part of their day with family members. As a result, asking them to spend even more time at home may become boring and repetitive. For example, family conversations often focus on daily routines, school, or parents‚Äô problems, which may not be interesting for children. This assumption is flawed because teenagers usually prefer hobbies or activities that match their interests, not only family talks. Therefore, I refute the idea that they should devote more free time to their family. Another factor that challenges this claim is that entertainment and social activities help children develop communication and teamwork skills. When they join clubs - sport teams, or recreational groups - they meet new people and learn how to cooperate with others. This clearly demonstrates that social experience outside home is necessary for building confidence and independence. Moreover, taking part in entertainment events allows youngsters to relax after school, which improves their mental wellbeing. For this reason, I strongly believe that limiting entertainment time is not beneficial. In conclusion, I cannot agree with the idea that young people should spend most of their free time with their families. To sum up, entertainment and social environments play a key role in children‚Äôs development, so they should be encouraged to explore new hobbies and friendships instead of staying only with family.

Band 7.5 Model Answer

It is commonly believed that young people should devote most of their leisure time to interacting with their families rather than engaging in entertainment activities. I entirely disagree with this view, mainly because entertainment provides important social development benefits, and the generation gap often makes family interaction less enjoyable or meaningful for children.

One major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that young people already spend a considerable part of their day with their families. Asking them to spend even more time at home can easily become repetitive and uninteresting. Family conversations often focus on daily routines, school matters, or parents‚Äô concerns, which may not appeal to teenagers. They generally prefer hobbies and activities that match their personal interests rather than constant family discussions. Therefore, I disagree with the idea that young people should devote the majority of their free time to family interactions.

Another strong argument supporting this view is that entertainment and social activities help children develop essential communication and teamwork skills. When they join clubs, sports teams, or recreational groups, they meet new people and learn how to cooperate with others. Such experiences outside the home are necessary for building confidence and independence. Moreover, engaging in enjoyable activities allows young people to relax after school, which supports their mental well-being. For these reasons, limiting their entertainment time would be counterproductive.

In conclusion, I do not agree that young people should spend most of their free time with their families. Entertainment and social environments play a key role in children‚Äôs personal development, and they should be encouraged to explore new hobbies and friendships rather than remain solely within the family circle.

Band 7 Model Answer

Nowadays, it is commonly believed that young people should spend more of their free time with their families rather than on entertainment. I completely agree with this view, mainly because family time plays a crucial role in emotional development, building essential skills, and supporting long-term well-being.

One key reason why this view is valid is that family interactions help strengthen young people‚Äôs social values. Spending time with parents and siblings teaches communication skills, empathy, and responsibility, which are difficult to develop through entertainment alone. For example, sharing meals or having meaningful conversations creates an atmosphere of trust and emotional security, especially during challenging periods in adolescence. These experiences not only improve family relationships but also reduce behavioural problems.

Another strong argument supporting this idea is that family time shapes young people‚Äôs personality and future decision-making. Parents often provide guidance based on real-life experience, helping their children make wiser choices about education, relationships, and career paths. Although entertainment activities are enjoyable, they cannot replace the wisdom and support that families offer. Furthermore, in today‚Äôs digital age, where many young people are distracted by screens, prioritising family time can help maintain balance and protect emotional health.

In conclusion, although entertainment has its benefits, I am convinced that spending more leisure time with family is far more meaningful. Family gatherings provide life guidance, emotional support, and essential social skills ‚Äî advantages that entertainment alone cannot offer.

üéÑ Unknown01/12/2025, 07:00:36
*Many believe that young people should spend more of their free time with their family instead of other entertainment. Do you agree or disagree?*

Nowadays it is becoming popular among teenagers spend less time in family circle. This essay argues that this view is misguided because although family time is important, young people also need personal space to develop socially and emotionally.

A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that while spending time with relatives can be valuable, teenagers also need opportunities to explore the world beyond their home environment. Activities such as sports, hobbies, or spending time with friends allow them to build independence, improve teamwork, and develop communication skills that they cannot gain at home.

Another factor that challenges this claim is that modern entertainment such as playing games, attending clubs, or participating in online communities can help young people explore their interests and creativity. For instance, joining a music group or playing competitive sports not only provides enjoyment but also teaches discipline and helps them relieve stress after school. Moreover, constantly being required to prioritise family time may create unnecessary pressure, especially if the young person feels their need for autonomy is being overlooked. Healthy development includes learning to balance responsibilities and personal freedom.

Inconclusion, although family time is valuable, I believe that young people should not be expected to spend the majority of their free time at home. Allowing them to participate in various entertainment activities outside the family contributes to their social skills, emotional health, and overall personal growth, while also helping them gain broader experiences that shape a more confident and independent personality.

Band 7 Model Answer

Nowadays, many teenagers spend less time with their families, and this trend is becoming increasingly common. This essay argues that although family time is important, young people also need personal space to develop socially and emotionally.

One major reason why the belief that teenagers should spend most of their free time with their families is unconvincing is that young people need opportunities to explore the world beyond their home environment. Activities such as sports, hobbies, or meeting friends allow them to build independence, improve teamwork, and strengthen communication skills that cannot always be developed at home. These experiences play a vital role in helping teenagers understand themselves and interact with others more effectively.

Another factor that challenges this claim is that modern forms of entertainment, such as gaming, joining clubs, or participating in online communities, allow young people to explore their interests and creativity. For example, joining a music group or playing competitive sports not only provides enjoyment but also teaches discipline and helps them relieve stress after school. In contrast, constantly being required to prioritise family time may create unnecessary pressure, particularly if teenagers feel that their need for autonomy is not respected. A healthy upbringing requires a balance between responsibility and personal freedom.

In conclusion, although spending time with family is valuable, young people should not be expected to spend most of their free time at home. Allowing them to take part in a variety of recreational activities contributes to their social development, emotional well-being, and overall personal growth, while giving them broader experiences that help shape a confident and independent personality.

Some people hold the view that children should spend most of their leisure time with their family members rather than engaging in recreational activities. This essay argues that this view is misguided because the benefits of leisure-time activities are more significant. A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that leisure time activities play a crucial role in childrens physical and mental development. When children engage in activities such as sports, art, or outdoor play, they not only improve their physical health but also enxance essential skills like creativity, teamwork, and problem-solving. These opportunities are often unavailable at home, where children may spend their time passively. Moreover, particepating in recreational activities allows children to socialise with their peers, which helps them build confidence and develop stronger communication skills. Therefore, limiting their free time solely to family interactions may hinder their overall growth. Another factor challenges this claim is that recreational activities can make children happier and more relaxed. When children play games, draw, or join clubs, they can enjoy themselves and forget about stress from school. This helps them feel better and also improves their health a little. If children spend all their free time only with family, they may feel bored or tired of the same routine. Therefore, having time for different activities is important to make children‚Äôs life more interesting and enjoyable. In conclusion, while spending time with family is important, children should also have time for recreational activities. These activities help them develop important skills, become more confident, and enjoy their free time.

Band 7 Model Answer

Some people believe that children should spend most of their free time with their families rather than engaging in recreational activities. However, this essay argues that this view is misguided because leisure-time activities play a more important role in children‚Äôs development.

One major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that leisure-time activities are essential for children‚Äôs physical and mental growth. When children participate in sports, art, or outdoor play, they not only strengthen their physical health but also develop key skills such as creativity, teamwork, and problem-solving. These opportunities are often limited at home, where children may spend their time passively. Furthermore, taking part in recreational activities allows children to socialise with peers, which helps them build confidence and improve communication skills. Therefore, restricting their free time to family interactions alone may hinder their overall development.

Another factor that challenges this claim is that recreational activities contribute to children‚Äôs emotional well-being. Activities such as drawing, playing games, or joining hobby clubs allow children to relax and release stress from school. This supports their mental health and helps them maintain a positive mood. In contrast, spending all their free time with family may become repetitive and less stimulating. As a result, having access to a variety of enjoyable activities is important for making children‚Äôs daily life more balanced and fulfilling.

In conclusion, although family time is valuable, children should also have the freedom to engage in recreational activities. Such experiences help them develop essential skills, build confidence, and maintain emotional well-being.

üéÅ
üéÑ AKRAMJONOV MUSLIMBEK agree disagree30/11/2025, 08:28:55

Rubric:

Many believe that young people should spend more of their free time with their family instead of other entertainment.

Do you agree or disagree?

Essay:

It is commonly believed that young people ought to allocate most of their spare time to their family rather than to entertainment activities. This essay argues that this view is misguided because advantages of entertainment are more significant.


A major reason why this argument unconvincing

is that family reunions are boring and repetetive for many youngsters, because they already spend much time at home talking or interacting with family members. Additional communication through family gatherings might be uninteresting for children, as topics are repetitive, such as authorities or world issues which are interesting only for adults. This burden creates pressure and restricts personal growth. Therefore, I disagree the view that family reunions are significant and teenagers should devote their leisure time.

Another factor that challenges this

claim is that entertainment can be educational. Since, not all entertainment activities are useless, as many of them improve vital skills, such as logical thinking. A compelling example of this is strategy-based video games, such as Clash of Clans or Dota 2 which encourage players to analyze complex situations and make decisions under pressure or playing a musical instrument, which improves creativity by encouraging them to learn different sounds and create own musical patterns. These activities let them wind down. Thus, entertainment is beneficial for developing necessary skills.


To sum up, I completely disagree with the view that young people should devote most of their free time interacting with family due to differences in interests and vital skills that can be learned by engaging in entertainment if used in moderation.

Word count: 275

‚Ä¢ Some ideas are too general.

üìå 4. Grammar Range & Accuracy ‚Äî 5.5‚Äì6

Frequent grammar errors:

‚Ä¢ Wrong pronouns: create own musical patterns
‚Ä¢ Some unclear or incomplete clauses

Too many errors ‚Üí 5.5‚Äì6.

‚∏ª

‚≠ê FINAL SCORE: 6.0‚Äì6.5

You are close to Band 7 but need cleaner grammar and more accurate vocabulary.

Band 7 Model Answer

Many people believe that young individuals should spend most of their free time with their families rather than engaging in entertainment activities. However, I disagree with this view because entertainment provides important benefits that cannot be replaced by family interaction alone.

One major reason why this opinion is unconvincing is that family gatherings can sometimes be repetitive and uninteresting for teenagers. Young people already spend a considerable amount of time at home talking to their parents, so additional family meetings may feel unnecessary. Moreover, the topics discussed during these gatherings‚Äîsuch as politics or world events‚Äîare often more appealing to adults than to teenagers. As a result, young people may feel bored or pressured, which can limit their personal growth. Therefore, I do not believe that they should devote most of their free time to family interactions.

Another factor that challenges this view is that many forms of entertainment are educational and help develop important skills. Not all entertainment activities are meaningless; for example, strategy-based video games such as Clash of Clans and Dota 2 encourage players to analyse complex situations and make decisions under pressure. Similarly, learning a musical instrument enhances creativity and discipline, as teenagers must practise regularly and create their own musical patterns. These activities also help them relax after academic stress. Thus, entertainment can play a key role in developing useful cognitive and creative skills.

In conclusion, I completely disagree with the idea that young people should spend the majority of their free time with their families. Differences in interests and the valuable skills gained through entertainment show that young people benefit greatly from engaging in enjoyable activities, as long as these are used in moderation.

A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that social media strengthens relationships by allowing people to communicate across long distances. Many platforms now give opportunity to not only chat via internet but also helps make video calls. It is not only useful for people with disabilities but additionally for students who study abroad. For instance learners often experience homesickness in foreign country so internet platforms give opportunity to contact with relatives and place video calls which can replace a real life conversations. Another factor that challenges this claim is that online platforms help users find supportive communities and collaborate with others who share similar interests. Online platforms allow people to join groups based on shared interest, educational goals or personal challenges. For example students who prepare for exams or which share same hobbies could exchange ideas and provide advice for each others which is not easy even offline. In addition social media not only connects people but creates meaningful collaborations, challenging the idea which could lead to isolation. In conclusion, I entirely disagree with the view that social networking sites lead people to become less social,its opportunities to most of the people especially for disables. For these reasons, I strongly believe that it has more advantages.

Band 7 Model Answer

It is commonly believed that internet-based communication platforms reduce face-to-face communication and weaken social relationships. However, I completely disagree with this view, as social media offers many opportunities to maintain connections and build supportive communities.

One major reason why social media does not isolate people is that it strengthens relationships across long distances. Modern platforms not only allow users to chat online but also provide high-quality video calls. This is especially beneficial for individuals with physical or mental disabilities who may find it difficult to attend school or university in person; online communication enables them to study from home and stay socially involved. It is also extremely helpful for students who study abroad. Many of them experience homesickness, and social media allows them to talk to relatives and video-call their families, helping them stay emotionally connected even while living in another country.

Another reason why social media supports social connection is that it helps people find communities and collaborate with others who share similar interests. Online groups allow users to join discussions based on hobbies, educational goals, or personal experiences. For example, students preparing for exams or people with the same hobbies can exchange ideas, give feedback, and support one another. These interactions are often more convenient than offline communication and help users feel included. In this way, social media promotes meaningful collaboration and challenges the belief that it leads to isolation.

In conclusion, I strongly disagree with the view that social networking sites make people less social. These platforms help individuals maintain relationships, support people with disabilities, and create new opportunities to connect. Therefore, social media has far more advantages than disadvantages.

Some people think that spending time online only reduce real communication, whereas others claim that social networks improve relationships and make life easier. This essay will look into both views and explains why I believe that social media makes many people more isolated than before. Many users argue that they can talk to friends and family far away without any problem, so social networks are very useful. It is undeniable that the most significant benefit of social media is that communication become faster and more comfortable. However some people says that online platforms help shy people to communicate better, but this argument is not always true. On the other hand, I would argue that social media actually bring more harm to real life communication. Advocates of this view argue that people spend too much time scrolling posts instead of meeting friends face to face. For example, many teenagers feel lonely and depressed even if they have hundreds of followers, which shows that online connection is not real. While social media can be entertaining sometimes, I am convinced that these platforms create distance between people in long-term. Those who support this idea believe that too much online time worsen family relationships and cause mental problems. In conclusion, although both sides have strong argumments, I would like to say that social media platforms make people more isolated than connected. Summing up, there is no doubt that social networks have some benefits, but depending on them completly would be a serious mistake for many individuals.

However, I completely disagree with the claim that this makes individuals to feel isolated,as i believe they offere meaningful opportunities for communication. A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that social media does not isolate people is that it helps maintain close relationships despite physical distance. Platforms such as messaging apps like Instagram or telegram allows individuals to communicate instantly with friends and family, even if they live in different countries. By sharing everyday experiences, offering emotional support and celebrating important events online, users often feel more connected rather than distant from their loved ones. Another factor that challenges this claim is that social media provides opportunities to form new connections and join supportive communities. People can engage in online groups which is connected with their interests, such as art, fitnes or education, and interact with others who share similar interests or passions. This is particularly beneficial for those who struggle with face-to-face communication, as online environments offer a comfortable space for self-expression. Consequently, these digital interactions help reduce loneliness instead of increasing it. In conclusion, although some argue that social media leads to isolation, I firmly believe that it is more beneficial. These platforms help strengthen relationships and create new social opportunities, making people feel more connected and supported in their daily lives.

Band 7 Version (Improved)

Many people argue that social media platforms cause users to feel separated rather than united. However, I completely disagree with the claim that they make individuals feel isolated, as I believe they offer meaningful opportunities for communication.

A major reason why this opinion is unconvincing is that social media helps people maintain close relationships despite physical distance. Platforms such as Instagram or Telegram allow individuals to communicate instantly with friends and family, even if they live in different countries. By sharing everyday experiences, providing emotional support, and celebrating important events online, users often feel more connected rather than distant from their loved ones.

Another factor that challenges this claim is that social media provides opportunities to form new connections and join supportive communities. People can engage in online groups that match their interests, such as art, fitness or education, and interact with others who share similar passions. This is especially beneficial for individuals who struggle with face-to-face communication, as online environments create a comfortable space for self-expression. Consequently, these digital interactions help reduce loneliness instead of increasing it.

In conclusion, although some argue that social media leads to isolation, I firmly believe that it is more beneficial. These platforms strengthen existing relationships and create new social opportunities, helping people feel more connected and supported in their daily lives.

üéÑ Glazkov Vladimir28/11/2025, 20:42:55
In recent years, social media has become one of the most influential forms of communication. While these platforms were originally designed to connect individuals across the globe, it is often argued that they actually make people more isolated. I completely agree with the view that despite offering opportunities for communication, social media often contributes to greater loneliness and weaker real-life relationships. One key reason why this view is valid is that, social media creates an illusion of connection. People may have hundreds of online friends or followers, yet these relationships are often not strong. Instead of talking face-to-face, individuals exchange short messages, likes, or emojis, which cannot replace real interaction. As a result, some users spend less time with family or friends in person, which eventually leads to emotional distance and isolation. Moreover, extensive use of social networks can negatively affect mental health. People often compare one‚Äôs life with their online can cause feelings of anxiety or depression. When people feel discouraged, they tend to avoid real-life social activities, further deepening their sense of loneliness. As a result, social media can push individuals away from native human contact. Another strong argument supporting this idea is that, when online interaction replaces real-world socialising, people may gradually lose communication skills and become more dependent on virtual contact. Afterwords, this dependence can make individuals feel more isolated, even while they constantly connected. In conclusion, I agree with the view that it often makes people more isolated. Its tendency to create shallow relationships and reduce real-life communication have strong negative effect on young generation. To avoid isolation, social media should be used in moderation and just being an additional part of offline interactions.

Band 7 Model Answer

In recent years, social media has become one of the most influential forms of communication. While these platforms were originally designed to connect individuals across the globe, many argue that they actually make people more isolated. I completely agree with this view, as social media often contributes to loneliness and weaker real-life relationships.

One key reason why social media can increase isolation is that it creates an illusion of connection. People may have hundreds of online friends or followers, yet these relationships are often superficial. Instead of engaging in face-to-face conversations, users exchange short messages, likes, or emojis, which cannot replace real interaction. As a result, individuals may spend less time with family and friends in person, leading to emotional distance and loneliness. In addition, the excessive use of social networks can negatively affect mental health. People frequently compare their lives with the idealised posts of others, which can lead to feelings of anxiety or low self-esteem. When this happens, they may avoid real-life social activities, further strengthening the cycle of isolation.

Another strong argument supporting this view is that replacing real-world interaction with online communication can weaken essential social skills. If people rely too heavily on virtual contact, they may struggle to express themselves confidently in person or maintain meaningful conversations. Over time, this dependence can make individuals feel more isolated, even if they appear active online.

In conclusion, I believe that social media often makes people more isolated. Its tendency to create shallow relationships and reduce face-to-face communication has negative effects, especially on young people. To avoid these outcomes, social media should be used in moderation and treated as a support to real-life interactions rather than a replacement for them.

I entirely disagree, mainly because these sites provide advantages ways to communicate with any people whenever users are, for establishing new relationships and to stay informed about any global occasion. A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that social platforms created convenient method to make users together for enhancing existing relationships and building new friendships. Today the internet provide easy access for individuals who can stay in touch with family members or colleagues via video calls or chatting via messengers. Another clear counterexample can be seen in a clear example such as Pinterest, which is designed for amateurs who aid to stay in touch with friends who live far away and sharing photos, emotions and life updates, alternatively, it allows to users connect with others peoples who share similar interests through chats and forums to expand subscriber‚Äôs network. What is more, such applications in our world offer a comfortable way for introverts to engage with others, who may find person, interactions quite elaborate. In addition to forming and strengthening relationships, media platforms can also have vital effects on people‚Äôs awareness. A hundred of billions individuals claim, that majority platforms promote all sort of information about political,social,economical and cultural situation around the world. These kind of data could be a key element for users accordingly raising mindfulness and uniting people around crucial issues. VK, for example, is well-known not only like a platform for having talk with acquaintances but also prone to entail particular feed for world news. ‚≠ê FINAL BAND: 5.0 ‚Äì 5.5

Band 7 Model Essay

Nowadays, many people believe that social networking sites have a strong influence on people‚Äôs social behaviour. I completely disagree with the view that these platforms isolate individuals. In my opinion, social media helps people maintain relationships, create new connections, and stay informed about important events around the world.

One major reason why social media does not cause isolation is that it allows people to stay in touch even when they are far apart. In the past, long-distance friendships were difficult to maintain, but today applications such as Telegram and Instagram make communication quick, simple, and affordable. For instance, students who study abroad can easily talk to their families every day through video calls and messages. This constant interaction strengthens bonds and reduces feelings of loneliness.

Furthermore, social media encourages the formation of new friendships and communities. People with similar interests can join online groups where they share ideas and learn from one another. For example, someone who is interested in start-ups can join entrepreneurship forums, receive feedback on their projects, and connect with people who share the same goals. As a result, users feel more included and supported, rather than isolated.

In addition, social networking sites play an important role in increasing people‚Äôs awareness of global events. Most platforms provide updates on political, social, economic, and cultural issues from around the world. This continuous flow of information helps users stay informed and participate in discussions that unite people around shared concerns. For example, platforms like VK and Instagram offer news feeds that allow individuals to follow international events in real time.

In conclusion, although some people believe that social media separates individuals, I strongly disagree. These platforms help people maintain strong relationships, make new connections, and stay informed about global developments. Therefore, social media brings people closer rather than isolating them.
AI Feedback
üéÅ
1
üéÑ Agree or disagree essay. Maqsudjon28/11/2025, 08:45:55
Rubric: Social media platforms make people more isolated rather than more connected. Do you agree or disagree? Essay: Social media has become one of the main tools for communication. Some people hold the view that these platforms make individuals more isolated, but i strongly oppose the view. In my view, social media helps people stay connected, build communities, and even improve cooperation for study or work. A major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that social media allows people maintain relationship even when they are physically far apart. In the past, long distance friendships were difficult to keep, but now applications - Telegram and Instagram - make communication quick and free. A clear counterexample can be seen in between students which are studying abroad, they can easily talk to their family every day through video calls.This constant interaction prevents loneliness and strengthens borders between people. Furthermore, social media encourages the formation of new friendships. People with similar throughts and interests can join online groups and communities. Someone, for instance, who loves doing start ups can join start ups group, learn from others, share their works, and take a feedbacks. As a result, they feel more included rather than isolated. In addition, social media can be used as a collobrative tool for education and work. Students often create group chat to discuss homework, share ideas, and help each other. During the Covid-19 pandemic, many schools continued teaching through online platforms, which shows that social media can actually bring people closer while studying together. In conclusion, i cannot agree with the idea that social media reduces real communication, i think it does the opposite. It helps individuals maintain relationships, make new friendships, and colloborate more effectively. Therefore i strongly believe that social media connects us more than it isolates us.
Word count: 299

‚Ä¢ You answered the question properly
‚Ä¢ You gave three fully developed reasons
‚Ä¢ Examples support your arguments
‚Ä¢ Well-written conclusion

‚∏ª

üìå 2. Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äî Band 6.5

‚Ä¢ Good essay structure
‚Ä¢ Clear topic sentences
‚Ä¢ Good progression of ideas
‚Ä¢ Paragraphs developed logically

Weaknesses:
‚Ä¢ Some sentences run together without proper punctuation
‚Ä¢ Some linking words missing or misused (e.g., ‚ÄúTherefore i strongly believe‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Üí missing comma + capital letter)
‚Ä¢ A few paragraphs feel slightly repetitive in structure (‚ÄúA major reason‚Ä¶‚Äù, ‚ÄúFurthermore‚Ä¶‚Äù, ‚ÄúIn addition‚Ä¶‚Äù).

Still, CC is 6.5.

‚∏ª

üìå 3. Lexical Resource ‚Äî Band 6

‚Ä¢ Correct use of topic vocabulary
‚Ä¢ Good control of meaning

Problems:

‚ùå ‚Äúallows people maintain relationship‚Äù ‚Üí allows people to maintain relationships
‚ùå ‚Äústrengthens borders between people‚Äù ‚Üí Wrong word ‚Üí strengthens bonds
‚ùå ‚Äúsimilar throughts‚Äù ‚Üí thoughts
‚ùå ‚Äústart ups group‚Äù ‚Üí a start-up group
‚ùå ‚Äútake a feedbacks‚Äù ‚Üí receive feedback
‚ùå ‚Äúcollobrative tool‚Äù ‚Üí collaborative tool
‚ùå ‚Äúcolloborate‚Äù ‚Üí collaborate

These errors limit your LR score.

‚∏ª

üìå 4. Grammar Range & Accuracy ‚Äî Band 5.5‚Äì6

You demonstrate a good range, but too many accuracy errors for Band 7.

Frequent errors:
‚Ä¢ Missing articles
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúallows people maintain relationship‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Subject‚Äìverb agreement
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúgroup chat to discuss homework‚Äù ‚Äî should be ‚Äúgroup chats‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Spelling
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúthroughts‚Äù / ‚Äúcollobrative‚Äù / ‚Äúcolloborate‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Run-on sentences
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúA clear counterexample can be seen in between students which are studying abroad, they can easily talk‚Ä¶‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Incorrect prepositions
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúbetween students which are studying abroad‚Äù ‚Üí among students who are studying abroad
‚Ä¢ Lowercase ‚Äúi‚Äù ‚Üí must be ‚ÄúI‚Äù

Because errors occur often, GRA stays at 5.5‚Äì6.

‚∏ª

‚≠ê OVERALL: 6.0‚Äì6.5

BAND 7 essay:

Social media has become one of the main tools for communication. Some people believe that these platforms make individuals more isolated, but I strongly disagree. In my view, social media helps people stay connected, build communities, and collaborate more effectively for study or work.

One major reason why this argument is unconvincing is that social networking platforms allow people to maintain relationships even when they are physically far apart. In the past, long-distance friendships were difficult to keep, but applications such as Telegram and Instagram make communication quick and free. A clear example can be seen among students studying abroad who can easily talk to their families every day through video calls. This constant interaction prevents loneliness and strengthens bonds between people.

Furthermore, social media encourages the formation of new friendships. People with similar interests can join online groups and communities. For instance, someone who enjoys working on start-ups can join entrepreneurship groups, learn from others, share their projects, and receive feedback. As a result, they feel more included rather than isolated.

In addition, social media can be used as a collaborative tool for education and work. Students often create group chats to discuss homework, share ideas, and support one another. During the Covid-19 pandemic, many schools continued teaching through online platforms, which shows that social media can help people stay connected while studying together.

In conclusion, I do not agree with the idea that social media reduces real communication. Instead, it helps individuals maintain relationships, form new friendships, and collaborate more effectively. Therefore, I strongly believe that social media connects us far more than it isolates us.
AI Feedback
üéÅ
üéÑ Do you agree or disagree? AKRAMJONOV MUSLIMBEK28/11/2025, 08:36:25
Rubrik: Social media platforms make people more isolated rather than more connected. Do you agree or disagree? Essay:
There is a growing belief that social media causes isolation instead of connection with people. I completely agree with the view that social media has a negative impact. One key reason why this view is valid is that social networking platforms may cause addiction. These platforms, such as Instagram or TikTok, are attractive enough to keep users engaged for a long time, since they are designed for this with endless scroll of short videos. While watching these short videos they change mood very quickly. Therefore, after some time of watching, it might be boring for them to do usual activities, as brain gets used to fast changes. Although these social networks are good source of information, many use it not in moderation, so this leads to information overload. As a result, young people will be less sensitive. Another strong argument supporting this idea is that excessive use of social media reduces face-to-face communication between individuals, as it causes less personal interaction. This clearly demonstrates that people might have fewer friends and they may feel loneliness. In addition, this may lead to watch more and more videos, since they do not have any friends to hang out with. A compelling example of this is when family reunites, many will be glued to phone screen while waiting for food. Therefore, these reunions might be reduced, since they will not be as interesting as before.
To sum up, I firmly support the view that social networking platforms are affecting society more negatively than positively due to addiction and less communication.
Word count: 274

üìå 1. Task Response ‚Äì Band 6

Strengths

‚Ä¢ You give two clear reasons: addiction + reduced real-life communication.
‚Ä¢ You provide examples and explain them.

‚ùå Weaknesses
‚Ä¢ Some ideas are unclear or scientifically inaccurate (e.g., ‚Äúyoung people will be less sensitive‚Äù).
‚Ä¢ Arguments jump from one idea to another without strong logical links.
‚Ä¢ Some claims need clearer development.
‚Ä¢ Conclusion is very short and does not summarise the main points.

Still a Band 6 because you answered the question fully, but not deeply or precisely enough.

‚Ä¢ Word forms:

‚∏ª

‚≠ê Overall: 5.5‚Äì6.0

You have Band 7 ideas but Band 6 accuracy.

Band 7 Model

There is a growing belief that social media isolates people rather than connecting them. I completely agree with this view because social networking platforms often create addiction and reduce meaningful face-to-face communication.

One key reason why social media can lead to isolation is that these platforms are intentionally designed to keep users online for long periods. Applications like Instagram and TikTok use endless scrolling and short, fast-paced videos that constantly stimulate the brain. As a result, many users find it difficult to enjoy slower, everyday activities because they become used to quick entertainment. Although social media can be a useful source of information, people often consume it without moderation, which leads to information overload and emotional fatigue.

Another strong argument is that excessive use of social media reduces personal interaction. Many individuals spend so much time online that they have fewer opportunities to build real friendships in their daily lives. For instance, during family gatherings, it is common to see people focusing on their phones instead of talking to one another. Over time, this weakens relationships and makes social events less meaningful, causing people to feel more isolated. In addition, online communication usually involves short messages or emojis, which cannot replace genuine conversations.

In conclusion, I firmly believe that social media has a negative influence on society because it encourages addictive behaviour and reduces real-life communication.

Its commonly believed that social media causes isolation instead of connection with people .I completely agree with the view that social media causes isolation. One key reason why this view is valid is that social media makes people spend less time communicating in real life. Many people prefer to chat online, watch short videos, or scroll through posts instead of meeting their friends or family in person. Because of this, they miss real convercations where they can clearly express their feelings and understand others. For example, many teenagers sit together in the same room, but each of them is busy with their phones, so they do not actually talk to each other. Over time, this reduces their ability to build strong reletionships and makes them feel more lonely. Therefore, social media seems to connect people, it often reduces real-life interiaction Another strong argument supporting this idea is that many friendships on social media are not very strong, because people only show the best parts of their life online. When users look at these perfect photos or stories, they sometimes feel like their own life is not good enough, so this make them feel more lonely. Also, online friends often don‚Äôt talk deeply with each other, they just send short messages or emojis, which is not helping to build a real connection. For example, some people have many folowers, but they don‚Äôt have someone who they can speak to when they have a problem. Because of this, social media friendships becoming more fake and people feel more isolated. To sum up,I firmly support the view that social media affects people negatively due to less communicating and not strong friendships.

üìå 4. Grammar Range & Accuracy ‚Äî Band 5

You make very frequent grammar errors, especially with:

‚ùå Articles
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúIts commonly believed‚Äù ‚Üí It is commonly believed
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúthis make them feel‚Äù ‚Üí this makes them feel

‚ùå Subject‚Äìverb agreement
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúfriendships becoming‚Äù ‚Üí friendships are becoming
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúthis make them feel‚Äù ‚Üí makes

‚ùå Sentence fragments / missing punctuation
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúTherefore, social media seems to connect people, it often reduces real-life interiaction‚Äù ‚Üí comma splice

‚ùå Incorrect sentence structure
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúTherefore, social media seems to connect people, it often reduces‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Üí should be Although social media seems to connect people, it often reduces‚Ä¶

‚û° Grammar errors appear in almost every sentence ‚Üí Band 5.


‚≠ê OVERALL: 5.5 ‚Äì 6.0

Your ideas are good, but your accuracy pulls you down.
The good news: your structure and content are already Band 7-level.

Band 7 Model Essay

It is commonly believed that social media makes people more isolated rather than more connected. I completely agree with this view because online communication often replaces real-life interaction and many relationships formed on social media are weak or superficial.

One key reason why social media can increase isolation is that it reduces the amount of time people spend communicating face-to-face. Many individuals prefer to chat online, watch videos or scroll through posts instead of meeting friends or family in person. As a result, they miss real conversations where they can clearly express their feelings and understand others. For instance, it is common to see teenagers sitting in the same room but focusing only on their phones instead of talking to each other. Over time, this weakens their ability to build strong relationships and leads to greater feelings of loneliness.

Another strong argument is that many friendships on social media are not very meaningful. People usually share only the best parts of their lives online, which creates unrealistic expectations and makes others feel dissatisfied with their own situation. In addition, online communication often relies on short messages or emojis, so people rarely discuss serious topics or offer emotional support. For example, someone may have hundreds of followers but still lack a close friend to talk to when they face a problem. Consequently, these shallow online connections can make people feel even more isolated.

In conclusion, social media often increases isolation because it reduces real-life interactions and encourages weak, surface-level relationships. For these reasons, I believe that social media can make people feel more lonely rather than truly connected.
AI Feedback
üéÅ
üéÑ Sevinch Turopova27/11/2025, 02:08:31
Rubric: some students take a year off between school and university,to work or to trevel. Do the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages? Over the last few years a gap year is taken between schools and higher education among some students, with purpose of working or traveling. While i accept that this changes can have certain benefits for students. I believe that it is likely to have a harmful impact on their education. On one hand, there is some positive aspects for taking a year off. A distinct advantage is that students can unwind after a years of education and it helps them to reduce stress levels. Moreover they can develop independence and improve their financial situation.For instance working during the gap year lets students save money for their tuition fees or living expenses and it makes students more responsible and confident. On the other hand, I believe this development has far more drawbacks. Major disadvantage is that it has a risk of immotivation and losing interest of studying at university. Sinse a long break might make it harder to return to studying or students might decide not to go to university at all. Another point to consider is the finances and falling behind their peers. Travelling can be expensive and and may lead to dabt. While their peers can start their education earlier and graduate earlier, students who chose a gap year may not pass the exams and the pressure of their debt and regration will couse depression or even suicide. To sum up, while a year off can be good due to mental rest and developing independence, ut can also damage their mental health and reduce motivation

THE WINNER TAKES IT ALL
üéÑ Do the ADV outweigh DISADV? Maqsudjon26/11/2025, 11:13:20
Rubrik: Some students take a year off betwen school and university, to work or to travel. Do the advantages outweigh to disadvantages? Essay: Many students choose to take gap year between finishing school and starting university to work employment and travelling purposes. In my opinion gap year could more benifitional than drowbacks. One the one hand, taking a year of can lead to several disadvantages. One major problem is that students who start working and earn a regular income may become less motivated to continue their education, financial independence may seem more appealing than academic pressure. Moreover, if the gap year poorly planned, valuable time could be wasted, and instead of gaining new skills, teenagers might spend their days on unproductive activities such as relaxation or intertainment. This situation is often viewed negativly by parents and educators because it offers little long term benefit.Additionally, returning to academic life after a gap year can feel burden, as study habits may have weakened, and students may struggle to adabt to structured learning environment again. One the other hand, a gap year also offers significant advantages. Firstly, it can provide young people with real world experience that cannot always be gained in the classroom.Working part time or volunteering may help students learn responsibility, manage money, and developing communication skills. Secondly, travelling during the gap year can expand students horizons. They might be explore new countries, learn foreign languages, experience different cultures. As a result, they often become more independent and mature, returning to university with clearer goals and stronger motivation. In many cases, this break from formal study allows them to enter higher education with confidence and fresh mindset. In conclusion, while a gap year carries risk such as loss of motivation and wasted time, it can also serve as a valuable period for personal growth and development. While proper planning, a gap year may become a productive experience that prepares students for universtiy life both emotionally and intelectually.
Word count: 326

üéÑ Abdullokh26/11/2025, 04:37:07
A lot of students take a gap year between school and university in order to gain employment or explore the world.While taking a gap year can bring some immediate drawbacks I am convinced that its more likely to have long term benefits. On the one hand there are some drawbacks for taking a gap year for students.The main drawback can be that the students may forget the academic knowledge and and study skills that they learned in high school.Since they are not regularly studying during the gap year.It becomes difficult for them to enter university.Another potential downside might be that students who choose to travel rather than working may bring some financial problems.The travelling could be considered quite expensive, and a large amount of money may be required for transportation, acommodation, and daily expenses. As a result, financial pressure might be experenced before they even start university. On the other hand,I believe that the benefits of this scenario are more crucial.One significant advantage is that financial benefits can be gained during a gap year.When students decide to work instead of travelling, a considerable amount of money can be earned.The incomes can be used for tuition fees,accommodations and daily expenses,and it can reduce the financial pressure.Another benefit could be learning new cultures.When students travel during a gap year, they are exposed to different lifestiles, languages, and traditions. This experience helps them understand how people in other countries think and live. As a result, their worldview becomes broader, and they develop greater open-mindedness and tolerance. In conclusion, it seems that the potential benefits of taking a gap year are more significant than the possible drawbacks for the mentioned reasons.

üéÑ Dilnura31/12/1969, 16:00:00

Nowadays it is increasingly common for people to study higher education overseas. While the proposal has some potential drawbacks, I believe the benefits carry more weight overall.


On the one hand studying overseas can be pricy. Tuition fees, accommodation and travel costs are higher than in a student‚Äôs home country which can be financial pressure students and their family. Students may also struggle with homesickness and culture shock. They may feel lonely and cannot adapt to a new country, especially the culture and lifestyle. Difference language can be challanging for everyday communication. Some students may also find difficult to make friends at first everything can be unfamiliar. But some  students are supports by university services to help them adapt. These support systems can play a important role to helping students. 


On the other hand, the benefits of studying overseas are significant. They often provide better opportunities, advanced facilities and courses that not avalible in the home country. This advantages can better enhance a student‚Äôs knowledge and skills. Students can also build connections with people from around the world, which can benefit their future careers. the experience can help them improve their language skills and broaden their worldview. Living abroad also encourage independence and confidence. Students learn to solve problems on their own in a new environment. 


To sum up, despite some negative aspects, I believe that the benefits of studying overseas are more significant for the reasons aforementioned. It can be valuable in a student‚Äôs personal and professional development

üéÑ Farrukh31/12/1969, 16:00:00
Some individuals are of the opinion that global warming is the most pressing environmental problem nowadays, while others believe that deforestation has a more devastating impact on our world. Some people think that rising temperatures is the biggest danger for humans, whereas others claim that cutting down forests effect the planet much more serious.

On the one hand, there is a belief that global warming bring more harm than any other problem. Many scientists argue that increasing greenhouse gases cause melting ice caps, rising sea levels and extreme weathers, so this issue must be taken very serious. It is undeniable that the most significant result of global warming is that millions of people may lose their homes in the future. However some people says that global warming is too slow process to worry now, but this argument is sometimes not true.

On the other hand, I would argue that deforestation also has huge negative impacts which cannot be ignored. Advocates of this view argue that cutting forests destroys biodiversity, animals lose their habitats and the air become more polluted. For example, without trees, the Earth cannot produce enough oxygen very quick. While some countries try to plant new trees, I am convinced that these efforts are not enough for long-term protecting the nature. Those who support this idea believe that deforestation is the main reason of many environmental problems today.

In conclusion, although both sides have strong argumments, I would like to say that global warming plays a slightly more important role in damaging our planet. Summing up, there is no doubt that deforestation is also dangerous, but ignoring climate change completly would be a huge mistake for humanity.
Word count: 276
Teacher Feedback
1. TASK RESPONSE ‚Äî Band 6

Strengths
‚Ä¢ You discuss both views
‚Ä¢ Your opinion is clear
‚Ä¢ Examples and explanations are relevant
‚Ä¢ The structure of your argument is logical

What lowers the score
‚Ä¢ Some ideas are not fully developed
(‚Äúglobal warming is too slow to worry now‚Äù ‚Üí needs deeper explanation)
‚Ä¢ The second body paragraph contains inaccurate scientific claims:
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúEarth cannot produce enough oxygen very quick‚Äù (not accurate)
‚Ä¢ The conclusion repeats the introduction instead of summarising key points
‚Ä¢ Some arguments are too general (‚Äúhuge negative impacts‚Äù, ‚Äúdangerous‚Äù)
‚Ä¢ You say global warming is ‚Äúslightly more important‚Äù, but your body paragraphs don‚Äôt justify ‚Äúslightly‚Äù ‚Äî this weakens your position

‚û° This is a Band 6 level response: fully addresses the task, but lacks precision and depth needed for Band 7.

2. COHERENCE & COHESION ‚Äî Band 6

Strengths
‚Ä¢ Clear paragraph organisation
‚Ä¢ Good use of ‚ÄúOn the one hand / On the other hand‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Logical flow of ideas

Weaknesses
‚Ä¢ Some linking words are inaccurate:
‚Ä¢ ‚Äútaken very serious‚Äù
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúeffect the planet much more serious‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Some sentences do not link smoothly
‚Ä¢ A few cohesion errors:
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúHowever some people says‚Ä¶‚Äù
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúSumming up‚Äù ‚Üí too informal for academic writing
‚Ä¢ Minor paragraph imbalance (the second paragraph feels shorter and less developed)

‚û° Cohesion is good but not fully natural ‚Üí Band 6.

3. LEXICAL RESOURCE ‚Äî Band 5.5

You try to use topic vocabulary, but there are many incorrect collocations and inaccurate word choices.

‚ùå Incorrect / unnatural vocabulary & collocations:
‚Ä¢ global warming bring ‚Üí brings
‚Ä¢ very serious ‚Üí very seriously
‚Ä¢ taken very serious ‚Üí taken very seriously
‚Ä¢ cutting down forests effect the planet ‚Üí affects
‚Ä¢ more serious ‚Üí more seriously
‚Ä¢ huge negative impacts ‚Üí vague
‚Ä¢ very quick ‚Üí quickly
‚Ä¢ long-term protecting the nature ‚Üí long-term protection of nature
‚Ä¢ the main reason of many environmental problems ‚Üí a major cause of many environmental problems

‚ùå Repetition
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúdangerous‚Äù, ‚Äúnegative impact‚Äù, ‚Äúserious‚Äù, ‚Äúharm‚Äù ‚Äî used repeatedly and vaguely

Strengths
‚Ä¢ Good topic vocabulary: greenhouse gases, rising sea levels, biodiversity, habitats, climate change
‚Ä¢ Good awareness of academic tone

However, Band 7 requires accurate, flexible vocabulary, not just topic words.

‚û° Band 5.5 for Lexical Resource.

4. GRAMMAR RANGE & ACCURACY ‚Äî Band 5

This is the main issue holding your score down.

‚ùå Frequent errors:
‚Ä¢ Subject‚Äìverb agreement:
‚Ä¢ rising temperatures is ‚Üí are
‚Ä¢ global warming bring ‚Üí brings
‚Ä¢ Articles:
‚Ä¢ a important role ‚Üí an important role
‚Ä¢ Verb forms:
‚Ä¢ effect ‚Üí affect
‚Ä¢ says ‚Üí say
‚Ä¢ Word forms:
‚Ä¢ argumments ‚Üí arguments
‚Ä¢ completly ‚Üí completely
‚Ä¢ Prepositions:
‚Ä¢ reason of ‚Üí reason for
‚Ä¢ Sentence structure issues:
‚Ä¢ cutting down forests effect the planet much more serious
‚Ä¢ air become more polluted

Strengths
‚Ä¢ Some correct complex sentences
‚Ä¢ You attempt a variety of structures

But Band 7 requires mostly error-free sentences, which is not the case here.

‚û° Band 5 for GRA.

OVERALL: 5.5

Rewritten essay for Band 7:

Some individuals believe that global warming is the most urgent environmental problem nowadays, while others argue that deforestation has a more devastating impact on our world. Some people think that rising temperatures pose the greatest danger to humanity, whereas others claim that cutting down forests affects the planet even more seriously.

On the one hand, many people argue that global warming causes more harm than any other environmental issue. Scientists state that increasing greenhouse gas emissions lead to melting ice caps, rising sea levels and more frequent extreme weather events. These consequences show why global warming must be taken very seriously. One of the most significant risks is that millions of people living in coastal regions may lose their homes in the future. Although some people say that global warming is a slow process and not an immediate threat, this view underestimates the long-term effects that are already becoming visible.

On the other hand, some people believe that deforestation has equally serious impacts that should not be ignored. Supporters of this view argue that cutting down forests destroys biodiversity, causes animals to lose their habitats and makes the air more polluted. Trees absorb carbon dioxide and release oxygen, so removing large areas of forest reduces the Earth‚Äôs ability to regulate the atmosphere. While some countries try to plant new trees, these efforts are often too slow to balance the rapid rate of deforestation. Many people therefore consider deforestation to be a major cause of several environmental problems today.

In conclusion, although deforestation has severe consequences, I believe that global warming is a more pressing issue because of its global scale and long-lasting effects. Ignoring climate change completely would be a serious mistake for humanity, and urgent action is required.
AI Feedback
üéÅ
üéÑ Sevinch Turopova31/12/1969, 16:00:00
Rubric: More and more students are choosing to study at colleges and universities in a foreign country. Do the benefits of studying abroad outweigh the drawbacks? Thanks to the world being more connected, there are now more opportunities for people to go and travel overseas.Institutions in another country are chose to study by an increasing numbers of students. This essay will clarify both sides of the issue and demonstrate my views that the benefits outweigh the drawbacks. On one hand, studying abroad has some downsides.Firstly, finances and language barriers which most students face while they are abroad. Of course, their colleges or universities may offer their oven scholarships and grant options. However, this may not be enough to cover all their needs such as tuitions ( if there are) housing and etc.What about language barriers? Even most advanced speakers can come across with this issue as native speakers may speak in more informal language which wasn't taught to them. Moreover students might experience homesickness and cultural shock. Since everything will be different starting from food and architecture to customs and social norms. If it combines with homesickness students may fall to depression. On the other hand, studying in foreign country offers a huge range of impressive opportunities! One of the great strengths of studying overseas is learning the language and culture of your host country while you are leaving there. They can broaden their perspectives on life and also make new friends, plus they will always have lots of stories to tell to their meets in their hometown. Furthermore they may have better study opportunities overseas than they do at home. Gain more deeply specialised knowledge in their chosen area of study. Besides, if they mention that they have studied abroad it will look very good to potential employers when it comes to applying for occupation. As it shows that they possess valuable workplace qualities such as independence initiative and responsibility which they have developed in foreign country. In conclusion, while studying in foreign country can be bad due to finances and homesickness it can also be more beneficial for their future!

THE WINNER TAKES IT ALL
üéÑ Glazkov Vladimir31/12/1969, 16:00:00
*While some people consider global warming to be the most pressing environmental problem which we have at the moment, others believe that deforestation has a more devastating impact on our world. Discuss both sided and give your opinion* Some people believe that global warming is the most major ecological dilemma, which we facing right now. However, other claim deforestation has more risk to the Earth. Notwithstanding the arguments between this eco-activists groups, i strongly believe that both problems have an equal impact not only on our lives but also even on our planet. There are some reasons why some people hold the view that global warming is more damaging than cutting down trees. For instance, greenhouse gases generated by unlimited car using or by traditional methods of generating energy based on using fuel oil or coal which emits carbone dioxide into the atmosphere. More than 41 billion tons was emitted into the atmosphere in 2024 and this number is increasing year by year on 0.5% which cause global temperature increase. The second significant factor is overpopulation. Almost 9 billion of population will be reached by 2037, but we already have a problem with food and water sources with our current number of people. We are consuming more and more resources are not renewable and which require lots of energy to produce them. On the other hand, opponents of climate change claim that the deforestations has more impact on our daily lives than global warming. Deforestation also has massive negative effect to our planet such as lack of oxygen. Cutting trees interrupts the process of photosynthesis which helps to accumulate oxygen in our atmosphere and it is a factor in the occurrence of many bronchial diseases. Another type of deforestation is wildfires. A lot of wildfires occurs every year due to people oversight. And it is on of the strongest impacts of deforestation, not only woods disappearance but also emission of carbone dioxide into the atmosphere. At the same time, desertification and global warming are equally influencing us. Logically, inhabiting organisms like a human cannot live without forests, also, they cannot live in extreme temperature of the atmosphere. To conclude, we cannot separate these problems. Both of them have negative impacts on our world.

Rewritten essay for BAND 7:

Some people argue that global warming is the most urgent environmental problem we face today, while others believe that deforestation has a more devastating impact. Both issues are serious, and this essay will discuss each view. However, I believe that climate change has a wider and more dangerous influence on our planet.

Those who think global warming is the most pressing problem point to several key reasons. First, greenhouse gases produced by car emissions and traditional energy production significantly increase carbon dioxide levels. In 2024 alone, more than 41 billion tons of CO‚ÇÇ were released into the atmosphere, and this amount continues to rise by about 0.5% each year. As a result, global temperatures continue to increase. Another major concern is overpopulation. The world‚Äôs population is expected to reach almost 9 billion by 2037, and we already face shortages of food and water in many regions. Higher temperatures make it even more difficult to manage these limited resources.

On the other hand, supporters of the opposite view argue that deforestation has a more direct impact on daily life. Forests play a crucial role in producing oxygen and absorbing carbon dioxide, so cutting them down reduces air quality and increases the risk of respiratory diseases. Additionally, deforestation often leads to the destruction of habitats. Many species cannot survive anywhere else, and their loss contributes to a decline in biodiversity. Wildfires, many of which are caused by human activity, also destroy millions of hectares of forest every year and release large amounts of carbon dioxide into the air.

In my view, climate change and deforestation are connected problems, but global warming is more dangerous because it affects the entire planet. Rising temperatures cause extreme weather, rising sea levels and long-term changes that no single country can tackle alone.

In conclusion, although both global warming and deforestation have serious environmental consequences, global warming poses a more significant threat due to its global scale and long-lasting effects.
AI Feedback

Rewritten essay for BAND 7:

People have different views about whether global warming or deforestation is the most serious environmental problem we face today. Some argue that global warming is not a crucial issue, while others believe that the destructive effects of logging are more significant. This essay will examine both sides and explain why I believe that global warming is more urgent to address.

On the one hand, many people think that deforestation causes serious damage to the environment. One common argument is that farmers cut down trees to create grazing land for livestock. As the global population grows, the demand for beef, milk and other animal products increases, which leads to more forest destruction. Another argument is that many countries depend on wood exports for economic development. However, cutting and processing large amounts of wood releases carbon dioxide into the atmosphere, which contributes to climate change. As a result, fewer trees are available to absorb CO‚ÇÇ, and more carbon stays in the air, warming the planet.

On the other hand, many people, including myself, believe that global warming is a more serious problem. Rising temperatures cause extreme weather conditions such as floods, heatwaves and hurricanes. These events destroy homes, damage farmland and reduce food supplies. Low-lying island countries like the Maldives may completely disappear due to rising sea levels. Furthermore, higher temperatures can cause long periods of drought, making it difficult for farmers to grow essential crops such as maize. I believe that global warming threatens both human life and natural ecosystems worldwide.

In conclusion, although deforestation has many harmful effects, I believe that global warming has a greater impact because it influences the entire planet. If we ignore this problem now, the consequences in the future will be far more severe.
AI Feedback

Rewritten essay for BAND 7:

There is no doubt that both deforestation and global warming are major environmental problems today. Some people believe that global warming is the most destructive issue, while others argue that the harmful effects of cutting down trees are more serious. This essay will discuss both views and explain why I agree with the former opinion.

On the one hand, many people think that deforestation is a highly damaging environmental issue. Forests absorb carbon dioxide and produce oxygen, which helps maintain clean air. An average tree, for example, can remove about 22 to 25 kilograms of CO‚ÇÇ every year. In addition, forests are home to many species of animals, and large-scale logging can lead to habitat loss and even extinction. For instance, one type of leopard in Taiwan became extinct because its forest habitat was destroyed.

On the other hand, there are people, including myself, who believe that global warming has a much more devastating impact on the natural world. Firstly, rising temperatures are causing ice caps to melt almost four times faster than they did several decades ago. This contributes to rising sea levels. Venice, for example, is currently at high risk of flooding, and higher sea levels could eventually destroy this historic city. Secondly, global warming leads to extreme weather conditions such as hurricanes, heatwaves and severe storms. These events damage homes, farmland and food supplies. I believe that global warming threatens both the atmosphere and human health.

In conclusion, although deforestation has serious negative effects, I believe that global warming is a more significant threat because its consequences are global and long-lasting.
AI Feedback
üéÅ
üéÑ Sevinch Turopova31/12/1969, 16:00:00
Some people argue that global warming is the most urgent environmental issue we face today, while others believe that deforestation causes more serious long-term damage. Both problems pose significant threats to our planet, and I subscribe to the former idea and will explain why. There are some reasons why some people hold the view that cutting down trees can be detrimental to our globe. First of all, deforestation destroys the natural habitats of countless species leading to a decline in biodiversity and even an extinction of rare animals. Forests also play a important role in maintaining the balance of the atmosphere by absorbing carbon dioxide and producing oxygen. When large areas of trees are removed, carbon emissions increase and contribute to climate unstability. In addition, deforestation results in soil erosion and land degradation, which reduce agricultural productivity and make communities more vulnerable to natural disasters such as floods and landslides. These shows why many people consider deforestation as a highly destructive environmental problem. On the other hand, opponents of deforestation, as well as I, claim that raising the temperature of the earth‚Äôs surface has huge devastating impacts on our environment. Global warming leads to extreme weather events including heatwaves, droughts and storms, all of which seriously affect human health and the natural world. Rising temperatures also cause the melting of polar ice caps leading to higher sea levels and putting millions of people living in coastal regions at risk. Moreover, climate change distrupts global food production making it harder for developing countries to ensure food security. Marine creatures are also suffering, as warmer oceans damage coral reefs and change a behaviour of fish species. In conclusion, although deforestation has serious environmental consequences, I believe that global warming is a more pressing issue due to its widespread and long-lasting impacts. That is why governments and individuals should take urgent action to reduce emissions and protect our planet for future generations!
Word count: 319
