Rewritten essay for BAND 7.5 - analyse it:

Some people argue that global warming is the most urgent environmental issue we face today, while others believe that deforestation causes more serious long-term damage. Both problems pose significant risks to our planet; however, I support the view that global warming is the more pressing concern.

On the one hand, many people believe that cutting down trees has severe consequences for the environment. Forests play an essential role in regulating the atmosphere by absorbing carbon dioxide and releasing oxygen. An average tree, for example, can remove around 22 to 25 kilograms of CO‚ÇÇ each year. In addition, forests provide habitats for countless species, and large-scale logging often leads to a loss of biodiversity and even the extinction of endangered animals. The extinction of the Formosan clouded leopard in Taiwan is one such example. Furthermore, deforestation contributes to soil erosion and land degradation, which reduce agricultural productivity and increase communities‚Äô vulnerability to floods and landslides. These points show why many people see deforestation as a highly destructive environmental problem.

On the other hand, I believe that global warming has an even more devastating impact on the natural world. Rising temperatures intensify extreme weather events such as heatwaves, droughts and powerful storms, all of which threaten human health and ecosystems. Higher temperatures also accelerate the melting of polar ice caps, leading to rising sea levels. As a result, low-lying coastal areas, including cities like Venice, face an increased risk of flooding. Moreover, climate change disrupts global food production by damaging crops and altering growing conditions, making it more difficult for developing countries to maintain food security. Marine life is also under threat, as warmer oceans harm coral reefs and affect the migratory patterns and behaviour of many fish species.

In conclusion, although deforestation has serious environmental consequences, I believe that global warming is a more urgent issue due to its global scale and long-lasting effects. For this reason, both governments and individuals must take immediate action to reduce carbon emissions and protect our planet for future generations.
AI Feedback
üéÅ

OVERALL: 5.0/5.5

Rewritten essay for BAND 7:

Some people think that climate change is the most urgent environmental problem today, while others argue that cutting down trees has a more harmful impact. Both sides have strong arguments, and this essay will discuss them. However, I believe that climate change is the more serious issue.

On the one hand, many people think that deforestation is a major problem. Forests play a crucial role in absorbing carbon dioxide and producing oxygen, so when large areas of trees are cut down, air quality becomes worse. Deforestation also has a strong effect on local communities. People who live near forests may lose important natural resources, such as food, shelter and traditional plants used in medicine. Furthermore, forests are home to many unique species of animals and plants. When habitats are destroyed, many species cannot survive anywhere else, which leads to a loss of biodiversity.

On the other hand, I believe that climate change is even more urgent. Rising temperatures often cause extreme weather events such as floods, heatwaves and hurricanes. These events not only put people‚Äôs lives at risk but also damage agriculture, homes and infrastructure. In addition, climate change contributes to the melting of polar ice caps, which leads to rising sea levels. This threatens coastal cities and may force millions of people to relocate. Climate change is a global problem that affects every country, and it cannot be solved by one nation alone.

In conclusion, although deforestation has serious consequences for wildlife and local communities, I believe that climate change is the more important issue because it affects the entire planet. As both problems are connected, we must take action quickly to reduce global warming and protect our environment.

OVERALL: 5.5

Rewritten essay for Band 7:

Nowadays, it is undeniable that both global warming and deforestation have severe effects on the environment. Some people believe that rising temperatures are a more urgent problem, while others argue that cutting down trees has a greater impact. This essay will discuss both views, and I will explain why I believe that global warming causes more serious issues than deforestation.

On the one hand, many people think that deforestation is the main environmental problem. One major reason is the loss of biodiversity. Forests are home to thousands of species, and when large areas of trees are destroyed, many animals lose their habitats. This can lead to a decline in their population and even extinction. In addition, deforestation contributes to climate change. Trees absorb carbon dioxide, and when they are cut down, more greenhouse gases remain in the atmosphere. As a result, air quality worsens, and people may face more breathing-related health problems.

On the other hand, I believe that global warming is an even more serious issue. The most obvious impact of rising temperatures is the increase in sea levels. As the planet becomes warmer, ice sheets and glaciers melt, adding more water to the oceans. This threatens coastal cities and puts millions of people at risk of flooding. Furthermore, higher temperatures increase the frequency of droughts, especially in dry regions. Hot weather causes faster evaporation of water resources, which results in water shortages and damaged agricultural land.

In conclusion, although deforestation has harmful effects on wildlife and the climate, I believe that global warming is a more critical problem. It leads to rising sea levels, extreme weather conditions and severe consequences for both people and the environment.

Rubrik: Some students take a year off between school and university, to work or to travel. Do the advantages outweigh the disadvantages Essay:
It is true that these days a gap year is taken before going to higher education for making a trip or engaging in employment by many school leavers. While this trend can bring some immediate drawbacks, I am convinced that it is more likely to have long-term benefits for their lives. On the one hand, year off had brought some drawbacks. Firstly, students who chose to travel rather than working may encounter several problems, such as financial burden. Travelling might be expensive, and will cause financial pressure. For instance, not every family can afford even a small trip for a few days. Secondly, school program could be forgotten after some time, as job can be too tiring and students could not revise it. It may take long time to restore this valuable knowledge. Thirdly, students who engages in employment could be exploited in exhausting job by their employers. If not well-prepaired, students can suffer from such problems On the other hand, I would argue that these disadvantages are outweighed by positive aspects. The second argument is that, year off can be beneficial for gaining practical knowledge that is not taught in the school while working. To sum up, despite some negative aspects, I believe that the benefits of this gap year are more significant for the reasons aforementioned.

Some individuals are of the opinion that global warming is a more pressing problem, while others believe that deforestation is very harmful. This essay will discuss both views and conclude with personal perspectives, however I believe that global warming cause more issue than deforestation. There are some reasons why some people hold the opinion that deforestation is the main problem. The first reason might be cutting down the trees that can filter the polluted air to fresh air, but we should consider that most of the polluted air is filtered by the underwater plants like algae. Despite this reason, cutting down the trees might affect pollution. How? Because the dust goes up when the trees are falling down and can pollute a little city and may be the cause of diseases, like blurring the eyesight or problems with the breathing ability. Furthermore, there is a belief that global warming is an issue as big as deforestation but worse. We know that global warming is caused by deforestation too, and there are some reasons too. Cutting down the trees and constructing new buildings instead has effects on the environment. The ultraviolet light that comes from the sun falls to the ground and goes back to the upper surface, but when the light comes and falls on the asphalt, the substance in the asphalt begins to heat up, and the cut trees can't absorb at least half of the ultraviolet light. Looking at both arguments, it's clear that global warming causes more problems than deforestation, but we can clearly see that cutting down the trees is one of the reasons for global warming.

Rewritten essay for Band 7.0 - analyse it:

Nowadays, people face many environmental problems, and opinions about the most serious one are divided. Some people believe that global warming is the most pressing issue, while others argue that deforestation is more harmful. This essay will discuss both views, but I believe that global warming causes more problems than deforestation.

Those who think deforestation is the main issue point out several negative effects. First, trees help improve air quality by absorbing carbon dioxide and releasing oxygen. When forests are cut down, the air becomes more polluted, which may lead to health problems such as breathing difficulties. In addition, deforestation increases the amount of dust in the air and reduces natural shade, making cities hotter and less comfortable for people to live in.

On the other hand, many people believe that global warming is a more serious problem. Rising temperatures lead to a range of dangerous consequences, including melting ice caps, rising sea levels and more frequent natural disasters. These changes threaten not only wildlife but also human populations living in coastal areas. Furthermore, global warming is made worse by deforestation itself, because trees that normally absorb carbon dioxide are removed. As a result, more greenhouse gases stay in the atmosphere, trapping heat and increasing global temperatures.

In conclusion, although deforestation is a serious environmental issue, I believe that global warming is more critical because it leads to natural disasters and affects the entire planet. Since deforestation contributes to global warming, both issues need attention, but rising temperatures should be our main concern.
AI Feedback
üéÅ
Hi
üéÑ Farida31/12/1969, 16:00:00
There has been a noticeable rise in the number of students who choose to continue their college or university studies in a foreign country. While this trend can involve certain financial and emotional difficulties, I believe its advantages are far more significant. It is true that studying overseas can create financial presure. International tuition fees and living expenses are usually high, meaning that families may need to make significant sacrifices. Some students even rely on part-time jobs, which can add extra stress. Additionally, cultural and emotional difficulties are common among international students. They often face unfamiliar social norms, language barriers, and feelings of homesickness, all of which can affect their well-being during the first months abroad. Despite these issues, the advantages of studying abroad are far more significant. One major benefit is the opportunitiy to develop strong language skills. Living in a country where the target language is used daily allows students to gain natural fluency, something that is difficult to achieve through classroom study alone. Moreover, foreign universities often provide access to high-quality education, modern facilities, and innovative teaching methods. Students can later bring this advanced knowledge back to their home country, helping improve local industries, education, and research. In this way, studying abroad not only benefits individuals but also contributes to national development. Overall,while the financial and emotional challenges of studying in another country are undeniable, the long-term benefits such as improved language proficiency and access to world-class education are far more influential.

There are many reasons why some people hold the view that cutting down trees has dramatic effect on the environment.First and one of the biggest problem it is air pollution.Moreover the main thing that cleans it from harmful gas counts plants especially trees.If carbon dioxide exceed norm it could lead to dramatic health problems and will shorten life expectancy of population.Second it effects on our water sourses.Trees act like a natural sponge which collect rain water,also it is a main filters of our water supplies,without it water become too salty to drink or even for agriculture and irrigation system. Those who advocate as well as I that increase in earth's temperature is even more serious problem.The main reason for this is that rising temperature leads to natural disasters.For instance icebergs' melting leads to floods which dramaticly effects on animals and us as well.Floods coused by it overlap islands and even continents.Another problem is erosion of the ozone layer.It is caused by carbon emissions caused by human's overconsumption.Which lead to problems with skin like skin cancer.Another thing to consider is that it effect on plants and all vegetation, it could become toxic which really effects on what we consume. In conclusion, although deforestation is a serious issue, I believe that global warming is an even bigger problem. This is because rising temperatures cause more natural disasters and damage both the environment and human health. For these reasons, global warming should be our main concern today.
Word count: 294

Lexical Resource ‚Äî 5.0

‚Ä¢ ‚Äúdramatic effect‚Äù (should be ‚Äúa dramatic effect on‚Äù)
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúair pollution. Moreover the main thing that cleans it from harmful gas counts plants‚Äù
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúwater become too salty‚Äù (not true + wrong collocation)
frequent spelling mistakes: coused, effect/affect, sourses, dramaticly
informal or incorrect phrases

The biggest weakness.

very frequent grammatical mistakes
article errors (the/a)
subject‚Äìverb agreement errors
incorrect sentence structure
punctuation problems
fragments (‚ÄúWhich lead to problems‚Ä¶‚Äù)
run-on sentences

Overall: 5.0 (ideas are good, but language control is weak)

Rewritten essay for Band 7:

Global environmental problems have become a major concern today. Some people believe that rising temperatures are the most serious issue, while others argue that large-scale deforestation is more critical. This essay will discuss both views and explain why I believe that global warming is the greater threat.

Those who think deforestation is more serious point out several important effects. First, cutting down trees leads to higher levels of air pollution. Trees absorb carbon dioxide and release oxygen, so when forests disappear, air quality becomes worse and people may face more health problems. Second, deforestation affects our water sources. Trees act like natural sponges, collecting rainwater and helping to filter it. Without them, water supplies become less reliable and may not be clean enough for drinking or agriculture.

On the other hand, many people, including myself, see global warming as an even more urgent problem. One major reason is that rising temperatures lead to more natural disasters. For example, the melting of icebergs raises sea levels, which can cause floods and destroy the habitats of both animals and humans. Another concern is the erosion of the ozone layer, which is damaged by carbon emissions produced by human activity. This increases the risk of skin cancer and other health problems. Global warming also affects plants and ecosystems, disrupting food production and threatening biodiversity.

In conclusion, although deforestation is a serious issue, I believe that global warming is an even bigger threat. Its impact on natural disasters, human health and the environment makes it the most urgent environmental problem facing our world today.
AI Feedback

üéÑ Muhammad31/12/1969, 16:00:00
Edited essay Nowadays, it is undeniable that an overwhelming majority of students opt to study at educational institutions abroad. Some individuals think that studying in an overseas country has some distinct advantages, whereas others claim that this trend may carry more downsides. While this trend has some negatives, I would argue that the positives are more substantial. On the one hand, studying abroad at a higher educational institution may involve several drawbacks. The most common disadvantage is the financial cost. For instance, students could encounter with high cost of tuition fees, accommodation expanses and travel cost which can create financial pressure for students. And sometimes, most of the families could not be prepared overpay amount of money for studying abroad because of their limited budgets. Additionally, majority of students claim that another major negative of this is adapting to a new lifestyle which is prone to entail some obstacles. Studying in another country may lead to feelings of loneliness or cultural shock, especially for those who struggle to adapt to unfamiliar social norms. Finally it is likely that potential candidates who are aid to study overseas may not be familiar with the local policies. In spite of above arguments, I would argue that these drawbacks are outweighed by the advantages. One of the greatest positive aspects is the opportunity for personal growth. Students who attend foreign universities can obtain unique experiences and exposed to higher-quality education. Many of Western countries are remarkably well known with their innovative teaching methods. This environmental can significantly enhance their knowledge and practical skills. In addition, living in another country allows young people built themselves and being independent. Such experiences strengthen key soft skills including problem-solving, communication, which is valued by CEO. To conclude, there are a number of downsides associated with studying in a foreign country, including financial strain and issues with adapting to a new environment. Nevertheless, these drawbacks are relatively minor compared to the positives, such as the chance for personal development and the accelerate of knowledge. Therefore, the advantages of this clearly outweigh the negatives.

Thre is no doubt that global warming and deforastation has became a significant issue for our world.Some people think that global warming is more significant for enviromental issues whereas others claim that cutting down trees has more devostiting impacts on our world.This essay intends to analyze both perspectives .I,however believe that cutting down trees is more significant issue for our world.
There are many reasons why some people hold the view that global warming is significant for environmental issues which is happening nowadays.One common argument is issue is the rapid melting of the polar ice caps. As global temperatures continue to rise, massive amaunts of ice in the Arctic and Antarctic are disappearing, which leads directly to rising sea levels. This puts low-lying coastal cities at risk of flooding and may force millions of people to relicate in the future.Futhermore, global warming has a direct impact on human health and living conditions. Heatwaves are becoming more frequent causing heat related illnesses and increasing death rates, especially among the elderly and children.
Despite these arguments , I believe that cutting down trees has more signifacant isssues. Firstly trees produce oxygen and absorb a large amount of carbon dioxides helping to regulate earths climate. When vast areas of trees are cut down, not only does air quality deterriorate and global warming accelerate, but countless animal species also lose their natural habitats.Another major concern is that defarestation contributes directly to climate change. Trees act as natural carbon sinks, absorbing carbon dioxide from the atmosphire, but when they are cut down, this greenhouse gas accumulates, leading to higher global temperatures.
In conclusion,although both sides have strong atguments,I would say that deforastation is more significant issue for our world.

Task Response ‚Äî Band 6

You give your opinion clearly

2. Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äî Band 5.5

3. Lexical Resource ‚Äî Band 5

4. Grammar Range & Accuracy ‚Äî Band 5

Singular/plural mistakes (‚Äúglobal warming and deforestation has‚Äù ‚Üí have)
Article errors (‚Äúearths climate‚Äù ‚Üí ‚ÄúEarth‚Äôs climate‚Äù)
Frequent grammatical errors reduce clarity

Overall: 5.5

Your essay for Band 7.0 - analyse it:

Some people argue that global warming is the most serious environmental problem we face today, while others believe that deforestation has a greater impact on the world. This essay will discuss both views, but I believe that cutting down trees is a more significant issue.

Many people consider global warming to be the most urgent challenge because its effects are already visible across the planet. One major concern is the rapid melting of the polar ice caps. As global temperatures rise, huge amounts of ice in the Arctic and Antarctic melt, which causes sea levels to increase. This puts coastal cities at risk of flooding and may force millions of people to relocate in the future. In addition, global warming has a direct impact on human health. Heatwaves have become more frequent, leading to heat-related illnesses and higher death rates, especially among the elderly and children.

However, I believe that deforestation is an even more serious problem. Trees play a vital role in producing oxygen and absorbing carbon dioxide, which helps regulate the Earth‚Äôs climate. When large areas of forest are destroyed, air quality becomes worse and global warming accelerates. Moreover, deforestation threatens countless species by destroying their natural habitats. Another important point is that trees act as natural carbon sinks. If they are cut down, more carbon dioxide remains in the atmosphere, trapping heat and increasing global temperatures.

In conclusion, although global warming is a major environmental issue, I believe that deforestation is more significant because of its direct impact on climate regulation, biodiversity and the quality of life on our planet.
AI Feedback
üéÅ
üéÑ Maqsudjon31/12/1969, 16:00:00
EDITED VERSION.
Rubric: More and more students are choosing to study at colleges and universities in a foreign country. Do the benefits of studying abroad outweigh the drawbacks?

In this era of globalization, many students want to study in a country abroad. This decision has some upsides, but also some downsides. In my opinion, the benefits are a little stronger than the drawbacks.
One the one hand, this situation has disadvantages. one big problem is that studying abroad can be expensive. Tuition and living costs must be paid, and many families cannot afford this. Another problem is homesickness. Students might be affected by loneliness because their family is far away. Sometimes it is difficult to adapt to a new culture. Students can be faced cultural shock. When students move to a new country or environment with different traditions, language, and lifestyle they can fell confusion and stress. 
One the other hand, studying abroad also has advantages. First of all, good education can be received in other countries. Many useful subjects are taught better there, so students can learn more. Also, a new culture and language canbe learned. This might help students become more openminded and more confident. Furthermore foreign county university's diploma can help to students find the better job rather than local university's diploma.
In conclution, even though there are some problems with studying abroad, i think the advantages are more important. Students can get better knowledge and a new experience, so the benifits outweigh the drawbacks.Overall, studying another country can open new doors for students and help them grow personally and academically. It often becomes a life changing opportunity that shapes their future in a positive way.

üéÑ Farrukh31/12/1969, 16:00:00
Some individuals are of the opinion that studying in a foreign country is unnecessary for students, while others believe that going abroad for education is a very essential part of modern learning. Some people think that living and studying overseas only make students confused and stressed, whereas others claim that it helps them improve their knowledge more deeper. On the one hand, there is a belief that foreign study bring more harm than good. Many parents argue that students already face many challenges at home, so sending them abroad is unfair and too expensive for families. It is undeniable that the most significant benefit of staying in their own country is that learners can have more comfortable life with family support. However some people says that studying abroad causes loneliness and even mental problem to students, but this argument is sometimes exaggerated. On the other hand, I would argue that these disadvantages are outweigted by the positive aspects. Advocates of studying overseas argue that it improves independence, language skills and practise of communication. For example, without living in another country, students often cannot learn foreign languages very quick. While studying abroad can be difficult sometimes, I am convinced that these positive aspects are more important for long-term success. Those who advocate international education believe that it prepares students for global careers and future opportunities. In conclusion, although both sides have strong argumments, I would like to say that studying in a foreign country plays a main role in students education. Summing up, there is no doubt that some challenges exist, but avoiding international study completly would be a mistake for many young people.

Teacher Feedback
1. Task Response ‚Äî Band 6

Strengths
‚Ä¢ You discuss both sides
‚Ä¢ You give your opinion clearly
‚Ä¢ Your position is consistent

Problems
‚Ä¢ Some ideas are underdeveloped or unclear
‚Ä¢ Some arguments are repeated
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúStudying abroad causes confusion and stress‚Äù ‚Üí no explanation
‚Ä¢ Conclusion restates ideas but doesn‚Äôt summarise well
‚Ä¢ Some statements are imprecise (‚Äúimprove their knowledge more deeper‚Äù)

‚û° You answer the question, but not fully or clearly enough for Band 7.

2. Coherence & Cohesion ‚Äî Band 6

Strengths
‚Ä¢ Paragraphing is logical
‚Ä¢ Connectors ‚Äúon the one hand / on the other hand‚Äù are used correctly

Problems
‚Ä¢ Linking inside paragraphs is weak
‚Ä¢ Some sentences break cohesion because of grammar errors
‚Ä¢ Paragraph 1: ideas jump without smooth transitions
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúHowever some people says‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚Üí grammatical error + weak link

‚û° Structure is good, but the flow is not smooth enough for Band 7.

3. Lexical Resource ‚Äî Band 5‚Äì5.5

This is the biggest issue.

‚ùå Incorrect or unnatural expressions:
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúforeign study bring‚Äù ‚Üí foreign study brings
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúknowledge more deeper‚Äù ‚Üí learn more deeply / gain deeper knowledge
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúpractise of communication‚Äù ‚Üí communication skills
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúmain role in students education‚Äù
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúcompletly‚Äù
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúargumments‚Äù
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúvery essential‚Äù ‚Üí ‚Äúessential‚Äù is enough
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúmakes students confused‚Äù ‚Üí unnatural collocation
‚Ä¢ ‚Äúcauses mental problem‚Äù ‚Üí mental health problems

Many of your phrases sound translated, not natural English.

Band 7 requires precise, natural collocations. Your essay has too many inaccuracies.

4. Grammar Range & Accuracy ‚Äî Band 5

Frequent errors:
‚Ä¢ Subject‚Äìverb agreement:
‚Äúforeign study bring‚Äù, ‚Äúsome people says‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Articles missing: ‚Äústudents education‚Äù, ‚Äúhave more comfortable life‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Wrong word forms: ‚Äúmore deeper‚Äù, ‚Äúmain role‚Äù, ‚Äúpractise of communication‚Äù
‚Ä¢ Repeated punctuation errors
‚Ä¢ Fragmented sentences

You attempt complex structures, but there are errors in almost every sentence, which is Band 5.

OVERALL: 5.5

Rewritten essay for BAND 7:
Some individuals believe that studying in a foreign country is unnecessary for students, while others argue that international education plays an essential role in modern learning. Some people claim that living and studying overseas can confuse or stress students, whereas others think it helps them gain deeper knowledge and important life skills. This essay will discuss both views and explain why I support the latter opinion.

On the one hand, many people believe that studying abroad brings more disadvantages than benefits. Parents often argue that students already face many challenges at home, and sending them overseas is both expensive and emotionally difficult. It is true that staying in their own country allows students to enjoy family support and live more comfortably. Some people also claim that studying abroad can cause loneliness or stress, especially for teenagers who are not used to living independently. However, these concerns are sometimes exaggerated and depend largely on the individual student.

On the other hand, I believe that the advantages of studying abroad outweigh the drawbacks. Supporters of international education argue that it builds independence, improves language proficiency and strengthens communication skills. For example, students who live in another country usually learn a foreign language much faster than those who study it at home. Moreover, studying abroad exposes young people to different cultures and perspectives, which prepares them for global careers and increases their future opportunities. Although adapting to a new environment can be challenging, these experiences help students grow both academically and personally.

In conclusion, although studying abroad can present certain difficulties, I believe it plays an important role in students‚Äô education. Avoiding international study completely would mean missing valuable opportunities for personal development, cultural understanding and long-term success.

First of all, studying abroad might be difficult because of finantial problems, and after some period students can stop their study and feel stress. However, a half of students get a part time job that they could mix work with study. But there are also students who lose their study habits, after arriving to foreign county. This sort of students see the life of international people, and believe that life should be easier lile their. On the other hand, I believe this development has far more benefits. One of them is students can gain valuable experiences, for instence, feeding, taking care of themselves and also how to live alone. This can help them to be more independed and responsible and decide in what career they whant to pursue. Furthermore, in foreign county they could learn more about differnt cultures and develop important life skills, such as communication and problem soving. These is really important life skills that could be useful at university or in the future workplace. In conclusion, I believe that adventeges of studying abroad outweigh its disadventeges. For students who choose studying abroad I would say be careful and study harder to be someone in the future.

Who are studying abroad could obtain unique experience and practical skills, alternatively, it can lead to expanding sociability of students. Nowadays, it is becoming popular among students choosing study at colleges and universities which located abroad. In my opinion, there are many advatnages and drawbacks of this trend but benefits are carry more weight than disadvantages. On the one hand, studying in a foreign countries can be very expensive for some applicants and there is the first disadvantage is high cost for education. Not all the students was grown up in wealthy families, and can afford study abroad. According to statistics studying in foreign countries becoming more and more expensive and is approaching from 3000 to 4000 euro per year of study at well known universities. Moreover, studying abroad is very difficult for some people who are used to living in comfortable conditions when all facilities situated in one step from them. Students entering the university should clearly understand how they will communicate with foreigners and build new relationships withe them. Students who are introverted, probably, will feel uncomfortable themselves surrounded by new people and live conditions. One the other hand, studying abroad is has more opportunities to see the world and build new relationships which can strongly upside down your life. The most significant thing for people today is building the relationships that will help them in the future from getting a job to moving in new country and starting new life. The second strong benefit is traveling. While we are young we have more leisure time than when we start our own families. This is valuable opportunity to travel and discover a new world and get to know new cultures which helps you to boarder you knowledge horizons. In conclusion, despite the fact that topic is unique and has disadvantages such as high level of tuition fee and can be inconveniently for some people, advantages like a traveling and boarder your knowledge horizons carry more benefits for students future.

User Guide

For Students

1. Enter your name in the Your name field.

2. Write your essay in the Write your essay box.

3. Click Submit to save your essay to the cloud.

4. You can edit your essay by clicking the Edit button next to it.

5. To download your essay as a PDF, click Download PDF.

For Teachers

1. Enter the secret teacher key in the Teacher Key field and click Enter to access teacher mode.

2. Once in teacher mode, you can edit any essay, highlight important sections, underline useful phrases, or strike through errors.

3. You can also add or edit feedback by clicking Add/Edit Feedback next to an essay.

4. The teacher key is confidential. If you need the key, please contact Maqsudjon Polatov personally to request it.

Press Ctrl + ; again to close this window and return to the platform.
